Title: Junior Portfolio Data Analyst
Description:
In a nutshell üìå

Position: Junior Portfolio Data Analyst

Location: Madrid, onsite

Experience: At least 1 year in data analysis or a similar role




Want to know more? üëá




INSUD PHARMA operates across the entire pharmaceutical value chain, bringing specialized knowledge and experience in scientific research, development, manufacturing, sales, and marketing of a wide range of active pharmaceutical ingredients (APIs), finished dosage forms (FDFs), and branded pharmaceutical products, adding value to human and animal health.

INSUD PHARMA‚Äôs activity is organized into three synergistic business areas: Industrial (Chemo), Branded (Exeltis), and Biotech (mAbxience), with over 9,000 professionals in more than 50 countries, 20 state-of-the-art facilities, 15 specialized R&D centers, 12 commercial offices, and more than 35 pharmaceutical subsidiaries serving 1,150 clients in 96 countries worldwide. INSUD PHARMA believes in innovation and sustainable development.

Are you ready to be a #Challenger? üí™




What are we looking for? üîé




Support the Business Development team in identifying, analyzing, and selecting products to develop, both generic and innovative.
Perform quantitative (market data) and qualitative (strategic evaluations) analyses within portfolio selection and new product development.
Regularly monitor competitor performance.
Create KPIs and dashboards to provide insights into the execution quality of the Business Development and Portfolio teams.
Develop benchmarks to monitor company performance against peers.
Understand and feel comfortable with clinical and scientific language.
Work on strategic or operational projects.




The challenge! üöÄ

√á

Translate business rules into data logic to support strategic decision-making.
Collaborate closely with different departments to ensure quality and relevance of analysis.
Present results in a structured, clear, and convincing manner.




What do you need? ü§ì




Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Business (double major or Master‚Äôs in Data Science is a plus). Knowledge in Health Sciences is valued.
At least 1 year of experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role.
Proficiency in Python and SQL.
Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar.
Excellent analytical and conceptual skills.
Effective communication skills in English, both written and verbal.
Investigative and curious mindset with strong ability to understand business rules and translate them into data logic.
Strong interpersonal skills and desire to work in a highly collaborative environment.




How will the selection process be? üïµÔ∏è




Initial contact by phone or email.
1 or 2 interviews, either virtual or onsite.
Continuous communication about the status of the process.

At INSUD PHARMA, we promote gender equality and ensure a work environment free from discrimination based on ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, disability, or any other condition. We value diversity and foster inclusion in all our hiring processes.

HTML:
In a nutshell üìå

Position: Junior Portfolio Data Analyst

Location: Madrid, onsite

Experience: At least 1 year in data analysis or a similar role


Want to know more? üëá


INSUD PHARMA operates across the entire pharmaceutical value chain, bringing specialized knowledge and experience in scientific research, development, manufacturing, sales, and marketing of a wide range of active pharmaceutical ingredients (APIs), finished dosage forms (FDFs), and branded pharmaceutical products, adding value to human and animal health.

INSUD PHARMA‚Äôs activity is organized into three synergistic business areas: Industrial (Chemo), Branded (Exeltis), and Biotech (mAbxience), with over 9,000 professionals in more than 50 countries, 20 state-of-the-art facilities, 15 specialized R&D centers, 12 commercial offices, and more than 35 pharmaceutical subsidiaries serving 1,150 clients in 96 countries worldwide. INSUD PHARMA believes in innovation and sustainable development.

Are you ready to be a #Challenger? üí™


What are we looking for? üîé


  • Support the Business Development team in identifying, analyzing, and selecting products to develop, both generic and innovative.
  • Perform quantitative (market data) and qualitative (strategic evaluations) analyses within portfolio selection and new product development.
  • Regularly monitor competitor performance.
  • Create KPIs and dashboards to provide insights into the execution quality of the Business Development and Portfolio teams.
  • Develop benchmarks to monitor company performance against peers.
  • Understand and feel comfortable with clinical and scientific language.
  • Work on strategic or operational projects.


The challenge! üöÄ

√á

  • Translate business rules into data logic to support strategic decision-making.
  • Collaborate closely with different departments to ensure quality and relevance of analysis.
  • Present results in a structured, clear, and convincing manner.


What do you need? ü§ì


  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Business (double major or Master‚Äôs in Data Science is a plus). Knowledge in Health Sciences is valued.
  • At least 1 year of experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role.
  • Proficiency in Python and SQL.
  • Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar.
  • Excellent analytical and conceptual skills.
  • Effective communication skills in English, both written and verbal.
  • Investigative and curious mindset with strong ability to understand business rules and translate them into data logic.
  • Strong interpersonal skills and desire to work in a highly collaborative environment.


How will the selection process be? üïµÔ∏è


  • Initial contact by phone or email.
  • 1 or 2 interviews, either virtual or onsite.
  • Continuous communication about the status of the process.


üî∑ Think this offer is not for you? üî∑


Follow us on LinkedIn and Instagram for more job opportunities. #InsudPharma #Challenger #Insuder #InsudTalent

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

AbbVie's mission is to discover and deliver innovative medicines and solutions that solve serious health issues today and address the medical challenges of tomorrow. We strive to have a remarkable impact on people's lives across several key therapeutic areas ‚Äì immunology, oncology, neuroscience, and eye care ‚Äì and products and services in our Allergan Aesthetics portfolio. For more information about AbbVie, please visit us at www.abbvie.com. Follow @abbvie on X, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, LinkedIn and Tik Tok.

Job Description

The Data Analyst will work within Customer Engagement Analytics team in Spain, to provide technical expertise in Advance/Predictive/Prescriptive Analytics. The key responsibilities of the role will be to contribute to AbbVie Data Analytics projects and support Data Science projects. Should be highly analytical with love and high affinity for analysis, mathematics and statistics. Additionally, not only should be familiar with quantitative methodologies and programming but also keen on business acumen. The Data Analyst should have passion for data analysis, data quality and accuracy, data exploration, machine learning and out of the box thinking.

Key responsibilities:

Serve as a relevant member of Customer Engagement Analytics, working in close partnership with the rest of team member and Global Winning with Data team to implement global and local initiatives in the affiliate, becoming a trusted partner of the CEx local team.

Develop in collaboration with the commercial teams and other CEx teams, advanced analytics, identify synergies, optimize reporting strategy to generate business relevant outcomes.

Master in different Foundry datasets of varying complexity and size levels and develop new ways to generate creative predictive analytic solutions to work around data limitations.

Identify best practices and extend them to the rest of the organization in terms of repoting & analytics, Proactively identify new analytical approaches that would improve our ability to answer key business questions, by closely collaborating with key business partners to transform key business questions to insights.

Work with business stakeholders to define key business questions, requirements, timelines, objectives and success factors for winning with data initiatives.

Qualifications

BS degree in mathematics, statistics or engineering, computer science or economics complemented with a master in Big Data, Artificial Intelligence, Advanced Analytics, Machine Learning, Data Science or equivalent.

Portfolio of work demonstrating data science applications.

Minimum of 2 years of applied data science in fields such as data engineering, predictive modelling,

Experience developing and executing data analytica to address key business questions with positive and measurable outcomes.

Experience analyzing and drawing insights from key internally and externally generated data sets.

Essential skills:

Analytical reasoning abilities, intellectual curiosity, strong business acumen and creative problem solving.

Ability to interact effectively with/present to (verbally or written) to all levels of the organization.

Ability to be agile and nimble changing business conditions, strong collaborative relationships, teamwork across different functions and teams to contribute to productive culture.

Lead strategically and create trust within the team.

Additional Information

AbbVie is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to operating with integrity, driving innovation, transforming lives and serving our community.‚ÄØ Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled.

US & Puerto Rico only - to learn more, visit https://www.abbvie.com/join-us/equal-employment-opportunity-employer.html

US & Puerto Rico applicants seeking a reasonable accommodation, click here to learn more:

https://www.abbvie.com/join-us/reasonable-accommodations.html

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
üöÄ Data Analyst | Join a Fast-Growing FoodTech Startup in Madrid







üëã Who are we?

Founded in 2012, Take a Chef was born from the belief that exceptional culinary experiences should be accessible beyond traditional restaurant settings.

We envisioned a world where top-tier chefs could bring their talents directly to the dining tables of discerning individuals and families. üçΩÔ∏è

Combining cutting-edge technology üíª with a deep passion for food and hospitality ‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äçüî•, we‚Äôve become the leading global platform for high-quality private chef services.

Last year, we served over 500,000 clients in more than 100+ countries, working with a network of 70,000+ private chefs and partnering with renowned luxury travel brands like Airbnb, Onefinestay, Le Collectionist and more. ‚ú®







üéØ About the role

We‚Äôre looking for a Data Analyst who‚Äôs passionate about turning complex data into clear, actionable insights. If you love understanding business challenges, building dashboards, and automating data processes to empower decision-making across teams‚Äîthis might be your next role.







üõ†Ô∏è Responsibilities

üîç Deeply understand our business, products, and processes through data
üìä Create and maintain dashboards to track key metrics and visualize insights
üìà Generate reports and visualizations to communicate findings with clarity and impact
ü§ù Collaborate with cross-functional teams such as Product, Design, and Marketing to support their data needs
üß∞ Design scripts and tools to automate and streamline data extraction using Python, SQL, and APIs







‚úÖ Requirements

üéì Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative field (e.g. Data Analytics, Statistics, Mathematics)
üíº At least 3 years of experience working as a Data Analyst
üß† Strong experience (2+ years) with SQL, BigQuery, and Dataflow
üöÄ Self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced, autonomous environment

Title: Data Analyst - Fintech
Description:
At Leadtech, we've been redefining digital businesses since 2009, creating innovative online solutions that reach millions of users every month. With a diverse team of over 700 members from 23+ nationalities, we're united by a passion for creativity and collaboration.

We specialize in delivering user-centric experiences across web and mobile platforms, where people can connect with our products like never before.

We're proud of our global reach and committed to fostering an inclusive workplace where every individual contributes to our shared vision of bringing cutting-edge projects to life. Learn more about our journey and mission on our About Us page!

About The Role

Due to continuous growth, we are seeking an ambitious and detail-oriented Data Analyst - Payments Specialist to drive data-led insights and support our payments strategy during a critical expansion phase. As a fast-growing B2C company with a strong presence in the US and European markets, we are focused on scaling our brand, optimising payment performance, and enhancing fraud prevention. This role requires a strong analytical mindset and a deep understanding of digital payment ecosystems, transactional data, and customer behaviour. You will play a key role in analysing payment trends, identifying inefficiencies, preventing fraud, and enabling data-driven decision-making across our payments and risk operations.

Key Responsibilities:

You're our perfect candidate if you:


Investigate, prioritise, and document anomalies in payments data and fraud patterns to support rapid issue resolution and risk mitigation
Use advanced Excel skills (e.g., VLOOKUPs, pivot tables, IF conditions) to analyse payment transactions, identify unusual behaviour, and support reconciliation efforts
Ensure data accuracy across payment systems by validating transaction records and flagging inconsistencies or suspicious activity
Identify trends in payment failures, chargebacks, and fraud attempts to drive process improvements and reduce financial risk
Implement consumer data acquisition strategies and e-commerce analytics with a focus on optimising payment funnel performance and detecting fraud signals
Build and apply consumer segmentation and profiling models to detect high-risk behaviours and improve fraud prevention tactics
Respond to data analysis requests from fraud teams, compliance, finance, and operations with a focus on payment performance and fraud detection insights
Retrieve, clean, and prepare transactional data for deep analysis of payment patterns, fraud triggers, and refund behaviours
Contribute to daily, weekly, monthly, and annual reporting on payments KPIs, fraud rates, authorization success rates, and risk events
Perform in-depth analysis on large volumes of payments and fraud-related data using advanced techniques to extract actionable insights
Define and enforce data quality standards specific to payments and fraud monitoring systems, ensuring high confidence in real-time decisions
Maintain expertise in analytics tools and practices relevant to payments processing, fraud detection, and compliance reporting
Collaborate with engineering, product, risk, and business intelligence teams to embed data quality controls across payments and fraud pipelines
Create and optimise metrics and dashboards to monitor payment success, fraud incidents, transaction declines, and risk thresholds
Communicate key insights on payment performance and fraud trends to stakeholders, driving cross-functional initiatives for improvement
Research discrepancies in payment data and correct records to ensure accurate transaction histories and trustworthy reporting
Monitor real-time analytics dashboards for drops in payment success rates or spikes in fraud indicators, enabling swift investigation and escalation
Review and act on data control alerts related to payment processing, chargebacks, fraud scoring models, and transaction integrity
Continuously analyse payment flows to detect fraud attempts, reduce false positives, and improve approval rates through data-driven strategies


Requirements

Your expertise in a nutshell:


3+ years of experience as a Data Analyst, in payments, fraud, or transactional data
Strong SQL skills and experience with large datasets and relational databases
Proficient in BI/reporting tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Looker) and Excel.
Solid understanding of digital payment systems, chargebacks, fraud indicators, and PSPs
Experience with data modelling, ETL processes, and data quality best practices
Familiarity with Python, R, or statistical tools (SPSS, SAS) is a plus
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with keen attention to detail
Ability to communicate findings clearly to technical and non-technical stakeholders
Proactive, well-organized, and adaptable in a fast-paced environment
Fluent in English, both written and spoken
Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (e.g., Statistics, Economics, Computer Science)


YOUR TEAM:


We're team-first. If you believe in the power of collaboration and thatthe team's success is your success,then you're one of us!
Fun is fundamental. We believe in forming strong bonds in and outside the oce. That's why we have a team-building budget and organize activities to enjoy ourselves.
Positivity wins the day. Bring a positive attitude and communicate openly. Self-awareness and an openness to learn are always a plus


Benefits

WHY SHOULD YOU JOIN US?

Growth and career development


At Leadtech, we prioritize your growth. Enjoy a flexible career path with personalized internal training and an annual budget for external learning opportunities


Work-Life balance


Benefit from a flexible schedule with flextime (7 - 9:30 a.m. start, 3:30 - 6 p.m. end) and the option of working full remote or from our Barcelona office. Enjoy free Friday afternoons with a 7-hour workday, plus a 35-hour workweek in July and August so you can savor summer!


Comprehensive benefits


Competitive salary, full-time permanent contract, and top-tier private health insurance (including dental and psychological services)
25 days of vacation plus your birthday off, with flexible vacation options‚Äîno blackout days!


Unique Perks


If you wish to come, in our office in Barcelona you'll find it complete with free coffee, fresh fruit, snacks, a game room, and a rooftop terrace with stunning Mediterranean views
Additional benefits include ticket restaurant and nursery vouchers, paid directly from your gross salary


Join us in an environment where you're free to innovate, learn, and grow alongside passionate professionals. At Leadtech, you'll tackle exciting challenges and be part of a vibrant team dedicated to delivering exceptional user experiences

Equal Employment Opportunity Employer

Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, and/or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be part of a great project!

Location

You'll have the flexibility to choose whether you'd like to come to the office every day, from time to time, or work fully remote. We want you to find the best combination for you.

If you prefer to be surrounded with amazing people, our exceptional office is in Barcelona's Blue Building, located right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy our office perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and you'll also be able to take part in our Mario Kart and table tennis competitions.

The personal data you provide will be used to manage your candidacy for the corporate selection processes that fit your profile. If you wish, you can exercise your rights of access, rectification or cancellation by sending a letter to Avenida Litoral, 12-14, 5ta planta, Barcelona 08005, or emailing us at protecciondedatos@LeadTech.com, including a document that validates your identity.

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Pozuelo de Alarc√≥n, Community of Madrid, Spain
Description:
Verisure is seeking a talented, innovative, passionate¬†Data Analyst to join our growing and successful Group Marketing Team, reporting to the Group Head of Web development & Analytics.

Verisure is building a talented and passionate Digital Marketing Team, and the Data Analyst position is key to its success! This is your chance to visibly impact on Verisure‚Äôs growth and the development of a best-in-class organization.

The role‚Äôs relevance in data collection and analysis is a great opportunity for a strong talent to develop our organization‚Äôs growth. Our success depends on our people, and we invest in them every day. Working with Verisure is being part of an industry leading, world-class company that thrives on a strong entrepreneurial spirit.

Key Responsibilities

As a core member of the Group Digital Marketing team, the Data Analyst will play a crucial role in driving data-informed decision-making by performing the following responsibilities:

Improving the quality and consistency of digital marketing tracking, collaborating with technical teams to maintain a robust data infrastructure and ensure the integrity of analytics data.
Designing, building, and maintaining marketing performance dashboards and reports using Tableau, Looker Studio or similar data visualization tools, ensuring clarity, accuracy, and usability for diverse stakeholders.
Engaging with cross-functional stakeholders to understand business needs, translate them into data requirements, and deliver actionable insights through compelling analysis and visual storytelling.
Partnering with teams across the organization, including Product, CRM, and Web, to identify data opportunities, support campaign measurement, and foster a data-driven culture.
Extracting and manipulating data using SQL to support advanced analytics and reporting needs.
Contributing to the development and lifecycle of Adtech products, including participation in requirement definition, data architecture design, and ongoing maintenance.

Location

The position will be based in Madrid (Spain).

Candidate profile

Qualifications, Experiences, and Competencies

Required Qualifications

Education & Experience

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, Marketing, or a related field.
Minimum of 2‚Äì3 years of experience in data analysis within a digital marketing or Adtech environment.
Experience working in multinational or cross-market teams is a plus.

Technical Skills

Good understanding of digital tracking technologies, including GA4, Google Tag Manager, and custom event tracking.
Solid experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or Looker Studio.
Familiarity with digital marketing platforms (e.g. Google Ads, Meta Ads, DV360, etc.).
Knowledge of marketing KPIs, attribution models, customer journey analysis, and performance measurement.
Proficiency in SQL for data extraction, cleaning, and manipulation across large datasets.
Ability to handle large datasets and navigate data warehouse environments (experience with BigQuery is a plus).
Basic understanding of Python or R for automation and exploratory data analysis is an advantage.

Analytical & Business Acumen

Strong ability to translate business problems into analytical questions and deliver actionable insights.
Working knowledge of conversion funnel analysis, CRO strategies, and campaign optimization.
Experience with A/B testing design, analysis, and interpretation is a plus.

Communication & Collaboration

Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to present complex insights clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Proven ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Product, CRM, Design, and Content.
Proactive, detail-oriented, and comfortable working autonomously in a fast-paced environment.

Languages

Fluent English is required (written and spoken).
Other languages (e.g. Spanish, French, German, or Nordic languages) are a plus.

Preferred Qualifications

Experience working with Google BigQuery or similar cloud-based data platforms.
Exposure to Adtech environments, CDPs (Customer Data Platforms), or server-side tracking.
Experience with automated reporting solutions or building data pipelines.
Familiarity with marketing mix modeling, predictive analytics, or machine learning use cases.
Certifications such as:
Google Analytics Certification
Tableau/Power BI certifications
Meta or Google Ads certifications

Strong fit with our Company DNA

Passionate in Everything We Do: Our people have a sense of energy that is unmistakable, one that drives us to delight our customers and focus on creating impact quickly.¬†

Committed to Making a Difference: When we say we will do something; we deliver with excellence. We are accountable, focused and operate with discipline.¬†

Always Innovating: We believe that Innovation can be big or small; it‚Äôs a continuous state of mind that inspires us to think differently and always make things better. We are risk takers and we learn continuously.¬†

Winning as a Team: Our people know that by leveraging one another‚Äôs strengths, investing in and developing our team‚Äôs capability and by collaborating well, we will win.

With Trust & Responsibility: Operating with integrity is core to our success. We are humble, honest and value deep mastery and expertise. We do the right thing, always.

The Company

Verisure is the leading European provider of professionally monitored security systems with 24/7 response services. We protect more than 5 million families and small businesses across 17 countries in Europe and Latin America. And our mission is to provide our customers peace of mind by protecting what matters most to them.

With over 35 years of insight, experience, and innovation, Verisure is known for category-creating marketing, sales excellence, innovative products and services, and customer-centricity. Thanks to a strong focus on high quality, our customers are amongst the most satisfied and loyal in our industry. We have some of the strongest double-digit growth and retention rates globally in consumer-facing services which demonstrates our exceptional service levels and strong value proposition to our customers.

Diversity, inclusion, equity, and belonging at Verisure

At Verisure, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace, recognising that diversity of thought and background only makes our teams stronger and more innovative. We reject all forms of discrimination and bias, and we believe in access to opportunities for everyone, regardless of gender, age, disability status, race, sexual orientation, or any other status. Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Belonging values are embedded in our company‚Äôs DNA. And we continue to prioritise our DEIB efforts every day to create a more inclusive organisation, enable diverse representation of our community, and ensure equity and meritocracy every step of the way.

  • Fluent English is required (written and spoken).
  • Other languages (e.g. Spanish, French, German, or Nordic languages) are a plus.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience working with Google BigQuery or similar cloud-based data platforms.
  • Exposure to Adtech environments, CDPs (Customer Data Platforms), or server-side tracking.
  • Experience with automated reporting solutions or building data pipelines.
  • Familiarity with marketing mix modeling, predictive analytics, or machine learning use cases.
  • Certifications such as:
    • Google Analytics Certification
    • Tableau/Power BI certifications
    • Meta or Google Ads certifications

Strong fit with our Company DNA

  • Passionate in Everything We Do: Our people have a sense of energy that is unmistakable, one that drives us to delight our customers and focus on creating impact quickly. 

  • Committed to Making a Difference: When we say we will do something; we deliver with excellence. We are accountable, focused and operate with discipline. 

  • Always Innovating: We believe that Innovation can be big or small; it‚Äôs a continuous state of mind that inspires us to think differently and always make things better. We are risk takers and we learn continuously. 

  • Winning as a Team: Our people know that by leveraging one another‚Äôs strengths, investing in and developing our team‚Äôs capability and by collaborating well, we will win.

  • With Trust & Responsibility: Operating with integrity is core to our success. We are humble, honest and value deep mastery and expertise. We do the right thing, always.

The Company

Verisure is the leading European provider of professionally monitored security systems with 24/7 response services. We protect more than 5 million families and small businesses across 17 countries in Europe and Latin America. And our mission is to provide our customers peace of mind by protecting what matters most to them.

With over 35 years of insight, experience, and innovation, Verisure is known for category-creating marketing, sales excellence, innovative products and services, and customer-centricity. Thanks to a strong focus on high quality, our customers are amongst the most satisfied and loyal in our industry. We have some of the strongest double-digit growth and retention rates globally in consumer-facing services which demonstrates our exceptional service levels and strong value proposition to our customers.

Diversity, inclusion, equity, and belonging at Verisure

At Verisure, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace, recognising that diversity of thought and background only makes our teams stronger and more innovative. We reject all forms of discrimination and bias, and we believe in access to opportunities for everyone, regardless of gender, age, disability status, race, sexual orientation, or any other status. Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Belonging values are embedded in our company‚Äôs DNA. And we continue to prioritise our DEIB efforts every day to create a more inclusive organisation, enable diverse representation of our community, and ensure equity and meritocracy every step of the way.

Title: Junior BI Analyst
Description:
Overview: The position of Junior BI Analyst is an entry-level role. The role will include managing ad-hoc reporting/visualization tasks for production, sales, client reporting and more functions in the company.




Description:

Design & implement reports, dashboards, and visualizations using data visualization business intelligence tools
Optimize reporting dashboards with a focus on user experience, performance, flexibility, testability, and standardization
Working closely with stakeholders to understand requirements and provide the best possible solution
Make complex concepts simple and easy to understand by those around you through effective communication, planning and strategic execution
Maintain documentation for design, development and reporting work
Work within our systems and with BI team members to achieve high standards of data integrity, ensuring supporting metrics are accurate and complete
Working within team processes, data governance and security frameworks




Required Skills:

At least 1 year of experience working in a BI environment
Experience using Business Intelligence tools, such as Tableau or PowerBI
Experience in creating interactive dashboards
Minimum Bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent / in the process of completing those studies.
Ability to learn new skills quickly
Ability to maintain professionalism, focus and result-orientation under pressure and tight deadlines
Attention to detail
Excellent communication skills (both written and verbal) in English
Exceptional problem-solving/critical thinking skills
Experience working in a corporate environment




Desired Skills:

Exposure to Knime, Request Tracker (RT), Snowflake
Prior translation industry experience
Understanding of relational databases
Fluency in a foreign language

¬øC√≥mo es trabajar en Reale?

En Reale Seguros ofrecemos la experiencia y estabilidad que solo una gran empresa con gran recorrido puede ofrecer.

¬øA qui√©n estamos buscando?

Ser√° necesaria la experiencia en preparaci√≥n de informaci√≥n para su explotaci√≥n anal√≠tica y en la utilizaci√≥n de herramientas para el tratamiento masivo de datos: Python, Panda, Spark.

Las competencias m√°s rese√±ables para un buen desempe√±o del puesto ser√°n la de orientaci√≥n al cliente y resultados, visi√≥n estrat√©gica, capacidad proactividad y un nivel de ingl√©s B2

¬øQu√© tendr√°s que hacer?

El perfil de Business Data Analyst deber√° poner a disposici√≥n de la Compa√±√≠a la informaci√≥n para facilitar la toma de decisiones y el seguimiento/evoluci√≥n del modelo VoC/Cx, incluyendo la preparaci√≥n de los datos y el desarrollo de los cuadros de mando/informes/presentaciones necesarias para ello.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
¬°Hi! ¬°We are Cheil Spain! üöÄ




Cheil Worldwide is a full-service agency from brand building to digital transformations creating excellent data-driven experiences for every customer. As part of Cheil Worldwide, Cheil Spain plays its part in one of the world‚Äôs biggest agency networks ‚Äì comprising 53 offices and 8 affiliates in 43 countries globally with more than 6.000 employees and 600 clients around the world. Cheil Spain is made up of 100 employees from different disciplines, who are passionate about innovation in all its forms. We offer a wide variety of marketing and advertising services, including strategy and planning, creative, content production, traditional and digital media advertising, influencer marketing, event marketing, e-commerce and performance marketing, among others.




‚úîÔ∏è Your role at Cheil: Data Analyst




‚úîÔ∏è What we are looking for?




We are looking for a highly analytical and business-driven Senior Data Analyst to join our Performance team at Cheil Spain. This role will play a critical part in unlocking insights from web and CRM data to improve user experiences, increase conversions, and inform strategic decisions for Samsung Spain and Portugal.

The ideal candidate has strong expertise in Adobe Analytics and GA4, and a solid understanding of user behavior analysis, segmentation, and digital marketing KPIs. Bonus if you're familiar with SQL, Python, BigQuery, and Qlik.




‚úîÔ∏è Key Responsibilities:




Support CRM and performance initiatives through audience segmentation, behavior analysis, and campaign performance reporting.
Evaluate Campaigns, promotions, marketing channels attribution, the funnel, and much more for the understanding of the customer journey, identifying insights with clear business recommendations
Analyze user journeys and web behavior through Adobe Analytics and GA4 to identify performance trends, drop-offs, and optimization opportunities.
Create dashboards and reports using tools such as Adobe Workspace, Looker Studio, or Power BI to track performance and support internal and client decision-making.
Collaborate closely with UX, CRO, Paid Media, and CRM teams to align data strategies and contribute with actionable insights.
Define KPIs and measurement frameworks for digital marketing initiatives and validate technical tracking implementations (with support from GTM specialists if needed).
Deliver recurring and ad hoc reports for always-on and campaign-based activities, including funnel analysis, campaign attribution, and ecommerce performance.
Present insights clearly and effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, connecting data findings with business objectives.
Continuously monitor data quality, track implementation, and propose process improvements to strengthen data-driven decision-making.




‚úîÔ∏è Key Skills & requirements:




4+ years in a Digital Data Analyst role, ideally within an agency or ecommerce environment.
Advanced expertise in Adobe Analytics and Google Analytics 4.
Proven ability to extract, visualize, and present insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Experience building dashboards and reports using Looker Studio or Power BI.
Strong understanding of digital marketing campaigns, ecommerce KPIs, and data quality validation.
Excellent storytelling and presentation skills in PowerPoint.
Strong communication and teamwork skills, with a strategic business mindset.




Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with SQL, BigQuery, and Python for data querying and automation tasks.
Understanding of website tagging and event tracking via Google Tag Manager.
Knowledge of Adobe Audience Manager or other CDP tools.
Previous exposure to e-commerce platforms and CRO/UX concepts.
Familiarity with A/B testing frameworks and marketing attribution models.
Fluent in Spanish and English.




Languages:

C1 level of English required, with advanced English writing skills and the ability to communicate effectively with international teams and external suppliers.




‚úîÔ∏è We would like you to bring together attitudes that have to do with...




Working effectively with individuals of diverse cultures, interpersonal styles, abilities, motivations, or backgrounds.
Making the most effective use of the capabilities, insights, and ideas of all individuals.
Inspiring others by generating innovative solutions in work situations .
Trying different and novel ways to deal with work problems and opportunities.
Working effectively and cooperatively with others.
Establishing and maintaining good working relationships.
Setting high goals for personal and group accomplishment.
Tenaciously working to meet or exceed goals by proactively confronting difficult issues.
Establishing and sustaining trusting relationships by accurately perceiving and interpreting one‚Äôs own and others‚Äô emotions and behavior.
Leveraging insights to effectively manage one‚Äôs own responses and reactions.




‚úîÔ∏è Cheil offers you:




üå±Work in a growing environment, focused on creating and innovating with multidisciplinary and multicultural teams in Creativity, Digital Performance, Retail, Data and Technology.

‚úçÔ∏èStable position: Permanent contract because we want you to be part of Cheil and be able to develop with us.

üí∏Salary: To be negotiated based on experience. Bonus Performance.

üìñInternal training opportunities.

‚ù§Ô∏èSocial Benefits: Restaurant Tickets and Medical Insurance.

üïõTimetable from Monday to Thursday from 09.00-18.15 and Fridays from 09.00-15.00. July and August, we have an intensive working day, Monday to Friday from 8:00 - 15:00.

üíªHybrid working model.

üèñÔ∏è22 days of annual leave, plus 24 and 31 December and Advertising Day.

üí∞Possibility of incentive for attracting new clients and new employees to Cheil. Help us to keep growing!

üìçWe are located in Alcobendas and we have a direct bus service, 100% free, with departures from Plaza Castilla, Chamart√≠n and Nuevos Ministerios to our offices.




‚úîÔ∏è Next steps:




Are you motivated by what you have just read? Join Cheil!

If you are passionate about the world of advertising and have experience leading teams, we invite you to send your CV and cover letter. We hope to have a high-level professional who will help us continue to grow in the market.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Embat was born to design the best way for medium and large sized enterprises to plan their finances and monitor their cash flow in real time.




We are building a financial management platform that allows them to understand what has happened in the past, track what is happening today and forecast the future of their businesses.




Our mission is to build a product that leverages technology and excellent client experience to empower our clients to make the best business decisions by accessing the best financial information, 100x more efficiently than using Excel files.




Our solution translates into savings of up to 75% of the time that financial teams spend on manual tasks. This allows them to focus on what matters most: making a greater impact within their organization and achieving a better balance between personal and professional life.




Our platform is already the trusted treasury management software of a large number of medium and large-sized corporates in Europe.




Composed of a fantastic team of people of 80+ members with different backgrounds and nationalities.




Backed by reputable international investors with the ambition to make Embat global and a great place to work! We are backed by top-tier international VCs.




In February 2024, we closed our third round of investment worth 15 million euros! This has been led by the renowned international investment fund Creandum, with the invaluable support of our partners Samaipata, 4Founders Capital, VentureFriends, Hugo Ar√©valo and Martin Blessing.




As a Data Analyst, you will join our Data team and also work closely with Sales, Marketing, and Customer Success to help scale Embat‚Äôs commercial engine through data.




We‚Äôre looking for someone with 0‚Äì2 years of experience, curious by nature, and excited about turning raw data into insights. You‚Äôll help the team track performance, identify bottlenecks, uncover opportunities, and ultimately make better, faster decisions.




We pride ourselves on working in an agile, collaborative environment, with daily interaction across teams. You‚Äôll have ownership from day one and the space to grow your skills with guidance from experienced peers.




What will you do?





Support the collection, cleaning, and transformation of data from different tools (CRM, marketing platforms, customer success platforms).


Build and maintain dashboards and performance reports related to revenue, pipeline, marketing and retention.


Execute ad-hoc analyses to solve real business problems and communicate findings clearly to stakeholders.


Contribute to improving data accuracy by identifying inconsistencies and working cross-functionally to solve them.


Help document key metrics, sources and logic used in reporting processes.


Identify and help implement process automation and self-serve reporting opportunities.


Learn how to work with business teams and translate their questions into data-driven insights.
What are we looking for?


0‚Äì2 years of experience in data-related roles


Technical background (engineering, math, physics, statistics, economics or similar). Other degrees welcome if paired with a data bootcamp or master‚Äôs.


Basic SQL and Python knowledge


You are comfortable with numbers, and have high attention to detail


You are proactive, eager to learn, and a problem-solver by nature


You enjoy working cross-functionally with teams from different backgrounds


Strong communication and structured thinking


You speak Spanish fluently and have a working level of English
What comes with working at Embat?


We offer a platform that allows you to reach your professional and personal goals.


A competitive salary according to the project and responsibility.


English Classes.


Hybrid working setup & flexible schedule.


Latest technology of your choice to do your impactful work with.


Access to private health insurance with Sanitas.


Access to salary on demand, restaurante card, transport card, and kindergarten checks through Payflow.


Career progression - Twice-yearly performance reviews.


An opportunity to work hand in hand with our founders who built their careers in Investment Banking at J.P. Morgan for more than a decade


Team Buildings plans

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Us

Ruby Labs is a leading tech company that creates and operates innovative consumer products. We offer a diverse range of opportunities across the health, education, and entertainment industries. Our innovative teams are driving the future of consumer-led products, and we're always looking for passionate individuals to join us. Learn more about our story at: https://rubylabs.com/about-us/

About The Role

Ruby Labs is hiring a Junior‚ÄìMiddle Data Analyst to join our fast-paced and rapidly growing team. In this role, you will create new reports, improve existing ones, and ensure data accuracy to support informed decision-making. You'll work across a variety of products and clients, helping to build their future data environments and playing a critical role in leveraging data for strategic insights.

Key Responsibilities


Partner with Product Owners and Data Teams to support data needs.
Control and monitor marketing and product metrics using Mixpanel and Tableau.
Create new reports and collaborate with Product Owners and Developers to maintain high-quality event tracking by aligning on event naming and mapping standards for new features and A/B tests.
Set up and manage tracking systems (pixels, postbacks, events) across platforms (Meta, Google, MMPs, etc.); maintain and troubleshoot server-to-server integrations.
Ensure accurate attribution across paid channels and platforms.
Identify trends, patterns, and anomalies in data to support business insights.
Use SQL to retrieve and analyze data for reports and team requests.
Collaborate closely with the Data Team to ensure consistency in reporting and data quality across the organization.
Support campaign measurement and performance analysis.
Ensure data integrity and consistency across analytics tools and databases.


Qualifications


Degree in an analytical field such as Mathematics, Data Science, or Economics.
Minimum of 1 year of experience as a Data Analyst.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to identify trends, patterns, and insights in large datasets.
Excellent verbal communication skills.
Strategic thinking and ability to make data-driven decisions aligned with organizational goals.
Experience in Product Analytics.
Experience with Mixpanel, GA4, Amplitude, or similar tools.
Basic knowledge of SQL.
Experience with BI tools such as Tableau, Looker, or similar.
Familiarity with server-side tracking, MMPs, CDPs, and tag managers.


Nice to Have


Strong spoken and written English.
Experience in Marketing Analytics.
Experience with Python or R.
Experience with GCP and BigQuery.
Familiarity with platforms such as Google Ads, Facebook Ads, etc.
Experience with orchestration frameworks like Airflow.
Familiarity with git and the code review process.
Understanding of affiliate and performance marketing.


Location

Ruby Labs operates within the CET (Central European Time) zone. Applicants from any country are welcome to apply for the position as long as they are located within approximately ¬± 4 hours of CET. This ensures optimal collaboration and communication during working hours.

Benefits

Discover the perks of being part of our vibrant team! We offer:


Remote Work Environment: Embrace the freedom to work from anywhere, anytime, promoting a healthy work-life balance.
Unlimited PTO: Enjoy unlimited paid time off to recharge and prioritize your well-being, without counting days.
Paid National Holidays: Celebrate and relax on national holidays with paid time off to unwind and recharge.
Flexible Independent Contractor Agreement: Unlock the benefits of flexibility, autonomy, and entrepreneurial opportunities. Benefit from tax advantages, networking opportunities, reduced employment obligations, and the freedom to work from anywhere. Read more about it here: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1dHF4ctKlez75whdn-ybUwP5d5Wr0BdwVrorrm_fM40Q/preview


Be part of our fast-growing team and seize this excellent opportunity for personal and professional growth!

Interview Process

After submitting your application, we conduct a thorough review which typically takes 3 to 5 days, but may occasionally take longer due to the volume of applications received. If we see a potential fit, we proceed with the following steps:


Recruiter Screening (40 minutes)
Technical Interview (60 minutes)
Final Interview (40 minutes)


Life at Ruby Labs

At Ruby Labs, we are more than a team; we're a community united in pushing the boundaries of technology and innovation. Our combined passion fuels our ambition for excellence, driving impact that resonates around the globe.

We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that a diversity of thought and backgrounds builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate based on race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status. Join us and be part of a company that is crafting the future of technology across multiple industries.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Wood Mackenzie is the global data and analytics business for the renewables, energy, and natural resources industries. Enhanced by technology. Enriched by human intelligence. In an ever-changing world, companies and governments need reliable and actionable insight to lead the transition to a sustainable future. That‚Äôs why we cover the entire supply chain with unparalleled breadth and depth, backed by over 50 years‚Äô experience. Our team of over 2,400 experts, operating across 30 global locations, are enabling customers‚Äô decisions through real-time analytics, consultancy, events and thought leadership. Together, we deliver the insight they need to separate risk from opportunity and make confident decisions when it matters most.

WoodMac.com

Wood Mackenzie Brand Video

Wood Mackenzie Values


Inclusive ‚Äì we succeed together
Trusting ‚Äì we choose to trust each other
Customer committed ‚Äì we put customers at the heart of our decisions
Future Focused ‚Äì we accelerate change
Curious ‚Äì we turn knowledge into action


Job Description

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join Wood Mackenzie‚Äôs Power and Renewables Data team.

This role will focus on the analysis, programmatic acquisition, and preparation of data for delivery to our customers and research teams.

Wood Mackenzie Produces Research And Data That The Energy Industry Relies On To Understand And Navigate The Energy Transition. Examples Of Products That You Will Contribute To Include


Power supply and demand long-term outlooks
Power market pricing history and long-term outlooks
Renewable technology supplier leaderboards


Responsibilities


Own the quality and delivery timeline of critical datasets
Obtain, transform, and deliver information from our databases to support industry analysis using Excel, PowerQuery, PowerBI, GraphQL, SQL, Sisense, Python, and Snowflake
Create and maintain workflows for internal stakeholders
Create and maintain data pipelines to feed customer facing products
Identify and assess opportunities for optimization of our systems, processes, and datasets
Monitor and resolve alerts in production environments to preserve the integrity of our products
Identify internal and external sources of data that will support customer needs
Collaborate with colleagues across multiple time zones and disciplines to uncover pain points, process improvements, and product requirements


About You


At least 2 years of experience in a data analyst or data engineering role
Experience working in environments reliant on SQL, Python, and Snowflake
Experience with ETL processes and APIs for data integration
Hands on approach to problem solving that delves into the details while maintaining the ability to succinctly propose solutions to steer management decisions
Independently completes projects given time and platform constraints
Desire to play a key role in the energy transition by delivering the data and research that catalyzes progress
Intellectual curiosity about the provenance of data and journey it makes to arrive at a destination
Passionate ownership of projects and excitement to share accomplishments with fellow Woodmackers
Preferred: Experience in the energy industry or power modelling domain
Fluent in English. Bonus language skills: Mandarin, Spanish


Equal Opportunities

We are an equal opportunities employer. This means we are committed to recruiting the best people regardless of their race, colour, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. You can find out more about your rights under the law at www.eeoc.gov

If you are applying for a role and have a physical or mental disability, we will support you with your application or through the hiring process.

Title: Analista de datos
Description:

En ALTEN tenemos claro que el √©xito de nuestros proyectos se debe a las personas que forman nuestro equipo. Por eso, si tienes experiencia como Data Analytics con QA, nos comprometemos a impulsar tu talento, satisfacer tus expectativas laborales y hacerte sentir como en casa. ¬øTe unes a nuestro #WelcomeHome? ¬°Sigue leyendo!

Investigar causas ra√≠z de problemas relacionados con la calidad de datos y procesos usando metodolog√≠as como 8D, 5 Porqu√©s o Diagrama de Ishikawa.
Dise√±ar, proponer y seguir la implementaci√≥n de acciones correctivas y preventivas para mejorar la calidad de los datos y procesos t√©cnicos.

Title: Data Analyst (Engineer)
Description:
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products ‚Äî including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more ‚Äî help our 60+ million customers get more from their money every day.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‚Äå 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work‚Ñ¢. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach data science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren‚Äôt kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They‚Äôre some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in product teams and deliver rock star solutions.

We‚Äôre looking for a Data Analyst who can dig into our complex databases, look for the root cause of a problem, and design their own solutions by writing code to implement them.

This is an opportunity to apply your skills while picking up new ones and delivering value for millions of customers around the world.

Up to shape the future of finance? Let's get in touch.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing


Understanding our business and its processes through data
Applying this understanding and knowledge of data to help product and services teams
Developing documentation and data governance
Owning the entire ETL process
Designing key metrics to measure different aspects of the business
Creating and maintaining new aggregated views and tables to simplify data querying
Providing clean data sets, modelling data in a way that empowers end users to answer their own questions


What You'll Need


5+ years of experience in an analytical role, creating impactful data-driven solutions
Excellent background/education in a quantitative discipline
Great skills with Python, SQL, or other programming languages
Evidence of exceptional mathematical and statistics knowledge


Nice to have


An advanced degree in a core STEM subject
Solid experience with additional programming languages (Java, Scala, C++, etc.)
School/university Olympic medal competitions in physics, maths, economics, or programming


Building a global financial super app isn‚Äôt enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that‚Äôs why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We‚Äôre doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That‚Äôs why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Important notice for candidates:

Job scams are on the rise. Please keep these guidelines in mind when applying for any open roles.


Only apply through official Revolut channels. We don‚Äôt use any third-party services or platforms for our recruitment.
Always double-check the emails you receive. Make sure all communications are being done through official Revolut emails, with an @revolut.com domain.


We won't ask for payment or personal financial information during the hiring process. If anyone does ask you for this, it‚Äôs a scam. Report it immediately.

By submitting this application, I confirm that all the information given by me in this application for employment and any additional documents attached hereto are true to the best of my knowledge and that I have not wilfully suppressed any material fact. I confirm I have disclosed if applicable any previous employment with Revolut. I accept that if any of the information given by me in this application is in any way false or incorrect, my application may be rejected, any offer of employment may be withdrawn or my employment with Revolut may be terminated summarily or I may be dismissed. By submitting this application, I agree that my personal data will be processed in accordance with Revolut's <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Candidate Privacy Notice

Title: Data & Analytics Specialist
Description:
Hi! üëãüèº

At Shakers, we're on the lookout for a Data & Analytics Specialist to take our Product team to the next level üöÄ


Team and Role


If you have experience in working autonomously on technical data projects, thrive in a dynamic startup environment, and are ready to take your career to the next level, we want to hear from you.

This role offers the opportunity to enhance Shakers' analytics, with the chance to shape the next generation way of working. If you‚Äôre excited by the prospect of working in a fast-paced, innovative environment, collaborating with a talented team, and making a direct impact, this is the opportunity for you! ü§©


What you¬¥ll be doing


Your day-to-day as a Data & Analytics Specialist:


Writing efficient SQL queries for large-scale data warehouses.
Defining, building, and maintaining ETL models in our data warehouse (BigQuery) using dbt and Airflow.
Building data integrations and ensuring data quality across pipeline layers.
Documenting and maintaining code and queries in GitLab.
Creating dashboards and reports in Looker/Looker Studio/Metabase to communicate results and track KPIs.
Conducting exploratory analysis to shape projects and provide actionable recommendations.
Presenting insights to squad team members to guide business and product decisions.
Collaborating with PMs, designers, and engineers to define data needs, request app events, integrate third-party tools, and develop data models.
Supporting feature design with product managers and engineers through performance measurement and impact testing.
Developing organization-wide data sources to empower business teams in data exploration.
Working across teams to improve data practices and promote a data-driven culture.
What we¬¥re looking for


You¬¥re a great fit if you...


Strong alignment with our principles‚Äîwe take this very seriously.
At least 2 years of experience as a Data analyst/engineer.
Proficiency in writing and understanding complex SQL queries and handling large datasets.
Experience using Python for data science tasks (data cleaning, API calls, SQL calls, modeling)
Familiarity with data visualization tools like Tableau, Qlik, PowerBI, or Looker.
A graduate degree in Business Administration, Economics, Engineering, Statistics, or related fields.
Fluency in English and Spanish.


Bonus points:


A Master's degree or Bootcamp in Business Analytics, Business Intelligence, or related sciences.
Product Analytics experience with Amplitude, Datadog, Mixpanel, or similar.
Experience working with vector DDBB and building data resources for AI consumption
What's in it for you?


Compensation üí∞

The salary range for this position is between 40.250‚Ç¨ and 51.750‚Ç¨ OTE (on target earnings) gross annual salary.

The salary consists of:


Between 35.000‚Ç¨ & 45.000‚Ç¨ fixed salary
Up to 6.750‚Ç¨ quarterly bonus based on performance & potential (15%)


Why you¬¥ll love working at Shakers üíö


Be part of a rapidly growing, internationally expanding startup. üåç
Have an ambitious professional development plan to help you reach your full potential.
Enjoy an unbeatable team culture‚Äîask anyone on our team!
Take advantage of our hybrid ful flex methodology: a mix of remote and in-office work, with our office located in the heart of Madrid, Calle Vel√°zquez.
Perks include wellness programs, gym access, English classes, medical insurance, and more.


At the office... üìç


Organic fruit
Free caffeine and theine
Our recruitment process


As a startup, we are very agile and we like to see results quickly, which is why prioritize efficiency in our recruitment process.

Our goal is to have you onboard this July, so you can hit the ground running and make an impact from day one!

The Road to Joining Our Team


Round 1, Cultural Fit: Kick things off with an informal chat with our People & Culture team. Don‚Äôt worry‚Äîwe just want to get to know you better, learn about your goals, hobbies, and more!
Round 2, Case Study & Technical Skills with Product Team: Join two members of our Product team for a deep dive into a case study. This is your chance to showcase your client management skills and demonstrate how you approach problem-solving.
Round 3, Meet the Team: Have a conversation with additional team members to further explore your skillset and ensure there's a great cultural fit. This is also your chance to ask questions and see how we collaborate.
Final check, CEO Chat: Meet H√©ctor, our CEO! He‚Äôs excited to connect with you, talk about Shakers‚Äô future, and discuss your vision and expectations.


More about Shakers

At Shakers we imagine, design, and create the next-generation way of working.

Our vision is to be the leading community and platform in the world that helps companies work with freelance teams through our technology.

We are a 70-person, fast growing startup based in Madrid. It's the place for you if you're looking for a high-performance, very dynamic & technological environment surrounded by ambitious people!

Our DNA

At Shakers, we are obsessed with our values. Half of our bonuses are performance-based, and the other half come from embodying what it means to be a true Shaker!

WINNING TEAM üèÜ

We all feel like part of a winning team‚Äîone that pushes boundaries, challenges the status quo, and moves the needle! We set ambitious goals and seek people who are driven to achieve them.

F1C10 üí™üèº

We‚Äôre building an environment where fear doesn‚Äôt hold us back. Experimentation and learning from failure are part of our DNA. Fail fast, grow faster. Fail 1X, chase 10X. We value risk-takers who aren‚Äôt afraid to go big!

STAY HUMBLE ü§≤üèº

We embrace a beginner‚Äôs mindset‚Äîalways evolving, always learning, and always finding new solutions. At Shakers, humility combined with ambition fuels our success, and when we blend the two, the results are extraordinary!

A huge thanks for being interested in Shakers, we'd love to see you soon.

  • Experience using Python for data science tasks (data cleaning, API calls, SQL calls, modeling)
  • Familiarity with data visualization tools like Tableau, Qlik, PowerBI, or Looker.
  • A graduate degree in Business Administration, Economics, Engineering, Statistics, or related fields.
  • Fluency in English and Spanish.

Bonus points:

  • A Master's degree or Bootcamp in Business Analytics, Business Intelligence, or related sciences.
  • Product Analytics experience with Amplitude, Datadog, Mixpanel, or similar.
  • Experience working with vector DDBB and building data resources for AI consumption
  • What's in it for you?

Compensation üí∞

The salary range for this position is between 40.250‚Ç¨ and 51.750‚Ç¨ OTE (on target earnings) gross annual salary.

The salary consists of:

  • Between 35.000‚Ç¨ & 45.000‚Ç¨ fixed salary
  • Up to 6.750‚Ç¨ quarterly bonus based on performance & potential (15%)

Why you¬¥ll love working at Shakers üíö

  • Be part of a rapidly growing, internationally expanding startup. üåç
  • Have an ambitious professional development plan to help you reach your full potential.
  • Enjoy an unbeatable team culture‚Äîask anyone on our team!
  • Take advantage of our hybrid ful flex methodology: a mix of remote and in-office work, with our office located in the heart of Madrid, Calle Vel√°zquez.
  • Perks include wellness programs, gym access, English classes, medical insurance, and more.

At the office... üìç

  • Organic fruit
  • Free caffeine and theine
  • Our recruitment process

As a startup, we are very agile and we like to see results quickly, which is why prioritize efficiency in our recruitment process.

Our goal is to have you onboard this July, so you can hit the ground running and make an impact from day one!

The Road to Joining Our Team

  • Round 1, Cultural Fit: Kick things off with an informal chat with our People & Culture team. Don‚Äôt worry‚Äîwe just want to get to know you better, learn about your goals, hobbies, and more!
  • Round 2, Case Study & Technical Skills with Product Team: Join two members of our Product team for a deep dive into a case study. This is your chance to showcase your client management skills and demonstrate how you approach problem-solving.
  • Round 3, Meet the Team: Have a conversation with additional team members to further explore your skillset and ensure there's a great cultural fit. This is also your chance to ask questions and see how we collaborate.
  • Final check, CEO Chat: Meet H√©ctor, our CEO! He‚Äôs excited to connect with you, talk about Shakers‚Äô future, and discuss your vision and expectations.

More about Shakers

At Shakers we imagine, design, and create the next-generation way of working.

Our vision is to be the leading community and platform in the world that helps companies work with freelance teams through our technology.

We are a 70-person, fast growing startup based in Madrid. It's the place for you if you're looking for a high-performance, very dynamic & technological environment surrounded by ambitious people!

Our DNA

At Shakers, we are obsessed with our values. Half of our bonuses are performance-based, and the other half come from embodying what it means to be a true Shaker!

WINNING TEAM üèÜ

We all feel like part of a winning team‚Äîone that pushes boundaries, challenges the status quo, and moves the needle! We set ambitious goals and seek people who are driven to achieve them.

F1C10 üí™üèº

We‚Äôre building an environment where fear doesn‚Äôt hold us back. Experimentation and learning from failure are part of our DNA. Fail fast, grow faster. Fail 1X, chase 10X. We value risk-takers who aren‚Äôt afraid to go big!

STAY HUMBLE ü§≤üèº

We embrace a beginner‚Äôs mindset‚Äîalways evolving, always learning, and always finding new solutions. At Shakers, humility combined with ambition fuels our success, and when we blend the two, the results are extraordinary!

A huge thanks for being interested in Shakers, we'd love to see you soon.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Ebury is a global fintech firm dedicated to empowering businesses to expand internationally through tailored and forward-thinking financial solutions. Since our founding in 2009, we‚Äôve grown to a diverse team of over 1,700 professionals across 40+ offices and 29+ markets worldwide. Joining Ebury means becoming part of a collaborative and innovative environment where your contributions are valued. You‚Äôll play a key role in shaping the future of cross-border finance, while advancing your own career in a dynamic, high-growth industry.

Data Anayst

Madrid Office - Hybrid: 4 days in the office, 1 day working from home

Join Our Data Team at Ebury Madrid Office.

Ebury is looking to add a Data Analyst to our Analytics team. You will work with business stakeholders to gather requirements and will deliver insight solutions to leverage data to drive growth across different verticals.

What We Offer


Competitive salary and benefits package
Discretionary bonus based on performance
Continued personal development through training and certification
We are Open Source friendly, following Open Source principles in our internal projects and encouraging contributions to external projects


Responsibilities


Become knowledgeable in data sources and expected outputs in specific domains (including but not limited to Front Office, FX Risk Management and Customer Experience)
Skilled in transforming raw data into compelling insights and effectively communicating findings to diverse business stakeholders to foster data-informed actions.
Preparing and validating data and reporting requirements in collaboration with business stakeholders
Use SQL + Git + dbt to build new analyses and reports and support existing ones
Developing, testing, maintaining and documenting dashboards (Looker Studio Pro) and self-service analytics platform (Looker)
Use Python to manipulate data and model data solutions according to the business requirements
Seek to constantly improve, streamline and standardise processes, procedures, systems and tools


About You


Experience managing and querying large datasets using SQL
Experience using Python to manipulate data
Fluency in written and spoken English, a must
Experience with FX derivatives or financial instruments is a plus
Clear and direct communication skills about complex, technical topics
Track record of working autonomously with organisational and time management skills
Ability to work under pressure to meet tight deadlines while maintaining high attention to detail
Extreme ownership and accountability for work
Experience using dbt to model business logic, a plus
Experience working with BigQuery/Snowflake/Redshift, a plus
Experience working in Financial Services, Capital Markets, a plus


If you‚Äôre excited about this job opportunity but your background doesn‚Äôt match exactly the requirements in the job description, we strongly encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other positions we have.

About Us

Ebury is a FinTech success story, positioned among the fastest-growing international companies in its sector.

Founded in 2009, we are headquartered in London and have more than 1700 staff with a presence in more than 29 markets worldwide. Cultural diversity is part of what makes Ebury a special place to be. From Sao Paulo to Dubai, Vancouver to Auckland, we enjoy sharing team experiences and celebrating success across the Ebury family.

Hard work pays off: in 2019, Ebury received a ¬£350 million investment from Banco Santander and has won internationally recognised awards including Financial Times: 1000 Europe's Fastest-Growing Companies.

None of this would have been possible without our proudest achievement: our great people. Enthusiastic, innovative and collaborative teams, always ready to disrupt and revolutionise the fast-paced FinTech sector.

At Ebury, we‚Äôre committed to building a workplace where everyone feels valued, supported, and empowered to thrive. We‚Äôre proud to have active employee networks and ESG initiatives that reflect our inclusive culture, including our Women‚Äôs Network, LGBTQIA+ Network, and Veterans Network. These communities provide spaces for connection, mentorship, advocacy, and collaboration across our global teams.

We believe in inclusion. We stand against discrimination in all forms and have no tolerance for the intolerance of differences that makes us a modern and successful organisation. At Ebury, you can be whoever you want to be and still feel a sense of belonging no matter your story because we want you and your uniqueness to help write our future.

Please submit your application on the careers website directly, uploading your CV / resume in English.

Title: Data Analyst(They/She/He)
Description:
If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionize the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

ü§ù Our culture and strong values.

üí™ Our career development philosophy.

ü§ù Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

Support the optimization of logistics features, with a focus on delivery areas and supply/demand imbalances, by maintaining and improving settings, quantifying their impact, providing data-driven insights, coordinating feature rollouts, and measuring their effectiveness.

THE JOURNEY


Work closely with local/regional stakeholders, product teams and development teams, serving as a bridge between product and operations, to define how to best set up and enable products, monitor and give visibility of metrics and KPIs.
Deep-dive on business metrics, in order to explore areas of opportunity and enable data-driven decision-making, based on applied statistics and probability techniques
Develop and maintain scalable and self-service visualization tools and storytelling dashboards.
Build optimization processes to define the best tuning of every feature on each geography.
Build robust relationships with stakeholders acting as a strategic and supportive link between the technology, business and product.
Support recurrent processes within the team, enabling the adjustment of tools to business needs
Continuously explore and refine key operational metrics (delivery time, efficiency, costs), gaining a comprehensive understanding of Glovo‚Äôs logistics.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


1-3 years of professional experience outside of an academic and internship setting, in a quantitative analysis role
Excellent SQL and Excel/GoogleSheet skills
Solid proficiency in statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown.
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, PowerBI, ...
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Great spoken and written English.


Individuals representing diverse profiles, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable


üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
üí≥ Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!
