Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

THE WORLD OF UBISOFT

Ubisoft is a global leader in gaming with teams across the world creating original and memorable gaming experiences, from Assassin‚Äôs Creed, Rainbow Six, to Just Dance and more. We believe diverse perspectives help both players and teams thrive. If you‚Äôre passionate about innovation and pushing entertainment boundaries, join our journey and help us create the unknown!

Ubisoft Barcelona Mobile‚ÄØbrings together dedicated and experienced professionals that are focused on crafting high-quality F2P games for mobile. We strongly believe in the core values at the centre of our Ubilife, which encourage us to take ownership of our work, continually striving for excellence while promoting the sharing of knowledge across individuals and teams, without losing our sense of enjoyment and fun, while taking care for one another. We strive for a safe and respectful workplace for all team members and we‚Äôre transparent about the measures we are taking to do so. For this reason, Ubisoft‚Äôs Code of Conduct has been released publicly on our corporate website for all current and future team members.

Do you want to join us in the world of mobile gaming? If so, read on!

Job Description

YOUR DAILY ADVENTURE

Ubisoft Barcelona Mobile is currently seeking a Data Analyst to help our team on their next adventure. The Data Analyst will support insight initiatives for our BI team. Your daily adventure:



Turning data into actionable insights, by performing hands-on research, data exploration and analysis, to drive decisions and strategies for user acquisition, retention, and monetization.
Work with the game teams to provide insights into user behaviour, answer key business questions and support in AB test design and analysis.
Carry out projects on machine learning for behavioural segmentation and monetization.
Debugging and problem-solving issues to ensure the delivery of accurate and clear analysis, reports and tools.
Effectively communicate results and insights to senior stakeholders throughout the organization.
Coordinate, challenge and share the best analytical practices and methods within the organization.
Stay up to date with the latest developments in Machine Learning technologies and Data Science trends.
Contribute to the knowledge base and culture of the team.



Qualifications

YOUR SKILLS

Are you serious about fun? Do you consistently seek out learning opportunities and aim to beat your high score? Are you open to new ideas, perspectives and cultures and believe that it takes a world to build a world? At Ubisoft, you‚Äôll work alongside passionate and talented teams who are imagining the future of entertainment.



Master's degree in a quantitative field (i.e. Physics, Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science, Data Science...). PhD in any of these disciplines is a plus.
5+ years relevant work experience in similar positions, ideally in mobile gaming industry.
Highly proficient in SQL as well as Python for data exploratory analysis
Experience with cloud-based big data solutions such as Redshift, BigQuery.
Solid knowledge of data visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker, Microstrategy, etc.
Robust understanding of advanced statistics suitable for analysis of skewed populations.
Experience designing effective ways of communicating, visualising and reporting results/analysis.
Experience in predictive analytics and segmentation.
Excellent problem-solving capabilities with strong attention to details.
Work permit for Spain obtained prior to applying for the position is a must.



What can make you stand out:



Experience with Agile philosophies (e.g.: Scrum, Kanban, XP) and project management tools (e.g.: JIRA)
Software engineering skills, including best practices like CI/CD and Git.
Self-motivation, organization skills, team spirit, proactivity.
Passion for games. Interest in mobile F2P games.



Additional Information

YOUR LIFE AT UBISOFT BARCELONA MOBILE (and PERKS)



Hybrid work model.
Possibility for new parents to work from home 80% of the time.
Flex working schedule:‚ÄØ40hrs per week with start time between 8 AM ‚Äì 10 AM (possibility to start at 7:30 AM when working from the office) and leave from 4 PM (Fridays from 2 PM).
Reduced schedule‚ÄØ(35 hrs per week) in July and August, Easter, Christmas holidays, and special days like Sant Jordi and Revetlla de Sant Joan.
Personal Matters Hours:‚ÄØ24 hours paid for by Ubisoft that you can use for personal matters.
Holidays:‚ÄØ25 days per year + 1 day in your‚ÄØUbi-Birthday.
5 extra holiday‚ÄØdays‚ÄØon the year you celebrate your 5th/10th/15th/20th year with us.
Ticket Restaurant: 210‚Ç¨ per month, and‚ÄØFlexible compensation plan‚ÄØ(Ticket Transport & Ticket Nursery).
Health insurance‚ÄØwith Cigna, including‚ÄØPhysiotherapist & Psychology sessions‚ÄØwith a reduced price.
Life Insurance‚ÄØwith AXA.
Mobile Device‚ÄØGrant‚ÄØof 400 EUR‚ÄØstarting on your 1st year in the company.
Language trainings‚ÄØin English, Spanish, and French.
Professional development training & programs, based upon request.
Ubisoft games with discount‚ÄØand Uplay PC for free.
Locally roasted craft coffee‚ÄØby INCAPTO (it‚Äôs very, very good).



Ubisoft is committed to creating an inclusive work environment that reflects the diversity of our player community. We are an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, ethnicity, religion, gender sexual orientation, age or disability status.

  • Highly proficient in SQL as well as Python for data exploratory analysis
  • Experience with cloud-based big data solutions such as Redshift, BigQuery.
  • Solid knowledge of data visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker, Microstrategy, etc.
  • Robust understanding of advanced statistics suitable for analysis of skewed populations.
  • Experience designing effective ways of communicating, visualising and reporting results/analysis.
  • Experience in predictive analytics and segmentation.
  • Excellent problem-solving capabilities with strong attention to details.
  • Work permit for Spain obtained prior to applying for the position is a must.


What can make you stand out:


  • Experience with Agile philosophies (e.g.: Scrum, Kanban, XP) and project management tools (e.g.: JIRA)
  • Software engineering skills, including best practices like CI/CD and Git.
  • Self-motivation, organization skills, team spirit, proactivity.
  • Passion for games. Interest in mobile F2P games.


Additional Information

YOUR LIFE AT UBISOFT BARCELONA MOBILE (and PERKS)


  • Hybrid work model.
  • Possibility for new parents to work from home 80% of the time.
  • Flex working schedule:‚ÄØ40hrs per week with start time between 8 AM ‚Äì 10 AM (possibility to start at 7:30 AM when working from the office) and leave from 4 PM (Fridays from 2 PM).
  • Reduced schedule‚ÄØ(35 hrs per week) in July and August, Easter, Christmas holidays, and special days like Sant Jordi and Revetlla de Sant Joan.
  • Personal Matters Hours:‚ÄØ24 hours paid for by Ubisoft that you can use for personal matters.
  • Holidays:‚ÄØ25 days per year + 1 day in your‚ÄØUbi-Birthday.
  • 5 extra holiday‚ÄØdays‚ÄØon the year you celebrate your 5th/10th/15th/20th year with us.
  • Ticket Restaurant: 210‚Ç¨ per month, and‚ÄØFlexible compensation plan‚ÄØ(Ticket Transport & Ticket Nursery).
  • Health insurance‚ÄØwith Cigna, including‚ÄØPhysiotherapist & Psychology sessions‚ÄØwith a reduced price.
  • Life Insurance‚ÄØwith AXA.
  • Mobile Device‚ÄØGrant‚ÄØof 400 EUR‚ÄØstarting on your 1st year in the company.
  • Language trainings‚ÄØin English, Spanish, and French.
  • Professional development training & programs, based upon request.
  • Ubisoft games with discount‚ÄØand Uplay PC for free.
  • Locally roasted craft coffee‚ÄØby INCAPTO (it‚Äôs very, very good).


Ubisoft is committed to creating an inclusive work environment that reflects the diversity of our player community. We are an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, ethnicity, religion, gender sexual orientation, age or disability status.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
We power people‚Äôs progress.

At Preply, we‚Äôre all about creating life-changing learning experiences. We help people discover the magic of the perfect tutor, craft a personalized learning journey, and stay motivated to keep growing. Our approach is human-led, tech-enabled - and it‚Äôs creating real impact. So far, 90,000 tutors have delivered over 20 million lessons to learners in more than 175 countries. Every Preply lesson sparks change, fuels ambition, and drives progress that matters.

Meet The Team

At Preply, we‚Äôre reimagining the way we support language learning!

Our B2B team is at the forefront of enabling global companies to unlock language skills across their workforces. As our B2B offering continues to grow, we‚Äôre looking for a Junior Data Analyst - Insights to join our team and support our data driven decision-making.

You‚Äôll be part of the Data chapter and embedded in the B2B squad, working alongside a senior data scientist, analytical engineer, and analytics manager. The role is ideal for someone who already has an analytical foundation and is eager to learn, grow, and make an impact in a dynamic and varied business environment.

We have an outstanding data science organization: we work throughout the company - in the product, business, and platform teams - using analysis, experimentation, data visualisation, and machine learning techniques. We are uniquely placed to use data to help make better decisions and improve data literacy across Preply.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing


Discover insights and inform the B2B team by running queries and extracting data using SQL and spreadsheets
Help build, improve and maintain data visualisations and reports to track B2B performance
Collaborate with the team on analyses related to customer success, product usage, and sales goals
Gain a deep understanding of B2B business metrics and use data to identify patterns or areas for improvement
Partner with your manager and peers to build skills and grow your analytical toolkit
Measure the impact of initiatives in order to identify growth opportunities and iterate our strategy
Create reporting that the team can use to evaluate and track business performance and take action upon


What You Need To Succeed


Some experience in the data science & analytics field (around 1-2 years' experience or internships preferably)
Strong working knowledge of SQL for querying and data exploration
Comfortable with spreadsheets (Google Sheets or Excel), including functions, charts, and pivot tables
Some experience with data visualisation (can be in any tool)
Some knowledge of quantitative fields (statistics, mathematics, etc.)
Some coding skills in one or more analytics languages (Python, SQL, etc.)
Strong curiosity, problem solving and problem finding skills, and interest in learning about business context and impact
Good written and verbal communication skills - B1 English is a must


Nice To Have


University degree in statistics, economics, econometrics, or a relevant field (or equivalent business experience).
Experience working in startups, tech, or digital B2B environments
Previous experience in Marketplaces and/or digital businesses (B2B, B2C, B2B2C)
Basic knowledge of business metrics like retention, conversion, or usage patterns
Knowledge of Looker, Tableau, Amplitude or other BI tools;
Knowledge of version controlling tools (GitHub, GitLab, etc.).


Why You‚Äôll Love It At Preply


An open, collaborative, dynamic and diverse culture;
A generous monthly allowance for lessons on Preply.com, Learning & Development budget and time off for your self-development;
A competitive financial package with equity, leave allowance and health insurance;
Access to free mental health support platforms;
Access to Gympass-partnered wellness and gym centers throughout Spain to promote and support well-being and physical health;
The opportunity to unlock the potential of learners and tutors through language learning and teaching in 175 countries (and counting!).


Our Principles


Care to change the world - We are passionate about our work and care deeply about its impact to be life changing.
We do it for learners - For both Preply and tutors, learners are why we do what we do. Every day we focus on empowering tutors to deliver an exceptional learning experience.
Keep perfecting - To create an outstanding customer experience, we focus on simplicity, smoothness, and enjoyment, continually perfecting it as every detail matters.
Now is the time - In a fast-paced world, it matters how quickly we act. Now is the time to make great things happen.
Disciplined execution - What makes us disciplined is the excellence in our execution. We set clear goals, focus on what matters, and utilize our resources efficiently.
Dive deep - We leverage business acumen and curiosity to investigate disparities between numbers and stories, unlocking meaningful insights to guide our decisions.
Growth mindset - We proactively seek growth opportunities and believe today's best performance becomes tomorrow's starting point. We humbly embrace feedback and learn from setbacks.
Raise the bar - We raise our performance standards continuously, alongside each new hire and promotion. We build diverse and high-performing teams that can make a real difference.
Challenge, disagree and commit - We value open and candid communication, even when we don‚Äôt fully agree. We speak our minds, challenge when necessary, and fully commit to decisions once made.
One Preply - We prioritize collaboration, inclusion, and the success of our team over personal ambitions. Together, we support and celebrate each other's progress.


Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

Preply is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive. Different opinions and viewpoints are key ingredients in our success as a multicultural Ed-Tech company.

Preply will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age or veteran status. Together, we are The World Class.

Title: Data Analyst Junior- Control Tower
Description:
Description

The EU External Fulfilment (EF) network consists of circa 35 operations which offer flexible solutions to the CF network operated by external providers (3PL providers). EU EF primarily provides: (1) network capacity solutions (storage/throughput), (2) special operation solutions (Hazmat, BWS, IXD, SDC, ICC, etc) and (3) emerging market penetration solutions. EU EF is currently undergoing an operational transformation, driving demand for enhanced expertise in Outbound (OB).

The goal of EU 3PL Control Tower is to provide an excellent operational end to end, 24/7 support, in 3PL buildings across European/UK External Fulfillment chain. We aim to provide the standardized and optimized process with frustration free communication. This role is for a highly driven and motivated individual with operational experience and innovative, hands-on approach.

This position involves the daily operational tasks resolutions and day to day communication with 3PL and Amazon team of problem solvers and node managers on their KPIs management.

The successful candidate will be responsible for: a- Provide reactive/proactive support to 3PL Providers and Amazon internals, b- Work on internal Projects to improve/automate 3PL Control Tower services. This person has a strong delivery record, attention to details and will be able to work independently with limited supervision.

This job involves 3PL operations monitoring and ops support, within a team that covers 24/7 shift pattern, for 30+ buildings in Europe/UK.

The shift to cover is Night Shift: 10pm CET to 6am CET, Sunday to Thursday (Friday and Saturday: days off).

Key job responsibilities


Providing the operational guidance to 3PL
Being a communication bridge between 3PL and Amazon stakeholders
Mitigating CX risk by CPT management support, resolving OB errors and managing shipment cancellations
Supporting on Transportation escalations.
Uploading critical data for supply chain and transportation visibility
Checking process and Amazon standard compliance
Optimization of actual Control Tower Outbound processes, aiming to automatize the actual tasks of the team, applying BI skills.
Work on Projects to improve actual 3PL Control Tower services, and capture new services that can be scalable to all 3PL sites.


Basic Qualifications


- Relevant experience working with the MS Office suite (Word, Excel, Outlook)
- C1 English level
- Spanish C2 level


Preferred Qualifications


High school or equivalent diploma.
Focus on details and analytical approach.
Expertise in data analysis tools such as SQL, Python, AI, etc.
Experience in logistics.


Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you‚Äôre applying in isn‚Äôt listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

Company - Amazon Spain Fulfillment, S.L.U.

Job ID: A3046653

Title: Data Analyst (They/She/He)
Description:
If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

ü§ù Our culture and strong values.

üí™ Our career development philosophy.

ü§ù Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

THE JOURNEY


Work closely with multi-disciplinary teams to define the business roadmap and strategy, monitor and give visibility of operations metrics and KPIs.
Apply various advanced mathematical and statistical modeling techniques and analyses (experimentation, machine learning, causal inference, etc.) to solve for product and business problems that drive the highest impact.
Translate business questions and hypotheses into analysis and actionable insights.
Develop and maintain scalable and self-service visualization tools and storytelling dashboards.
Foster strong relationships with stakeholders acting as a strategic and supportive link between the technology, business, and product.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


3-5 years of professional experience outside of an academic and internship setting, in a quantitative analysis role.
A higher education in scientific discipline such as Physics, Statistics, Computer Science or Mathematics.
Knowledge or experience in digital product development.
Demonstrable experience with the application of statistical modeling and advanced analytics to provide strategy-shaping insights.
Mastery in SQL and statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown.
Demonstrated experience in designing and analyzing experiments in digital products (A/B test, multivariate, etc).
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, PowerBI.
Excellent spoken and written English.


Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves


üåü An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
üí≥ Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
BELIEVE IN LIFE. Join a company that takes you further!




Galenicum is one of the fastest growing companies in the pharmaceutical sector! We are enthusiastic about life, devoting our talent and effort to providing high-quality affordable pharmaceuticals worldwide.




People are the key to our present and future success, so we carefully select candidates that meet the requirements for each position, however most importantly, who also fit with our cultural DNA and values.




Here‚Äôs the lowdown on what your role will actually look like (spoiler alert: it‚Äôs awesome!)




We are looking for Data Analyst to join our Data & BI team.




What you'll be rocking:




Design and Develop Dashboards: Actively participate in the design, development, and maintenance of interactive business intelligence dashboards and reports using BI tools (TABLEAU), transforming complex data into clear and actionable visualizations for various departments.
Data Transformation and Enrichment: Collaborate in the creation and optimization of data pipelines (ETL/ELT) for extracting, cleaning, transforming, and loading information, ensuring data quality and availability for analysis (TABLEAU-PREP & GOOGLE BIG QUERY).
Strategic Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams (sales, marketing, production, etc.) to understand their information needs, translate business requirements into effective data solutions, and ensure that BI tools meet their expectations.
Data Quality Assurance: Conduct regular data audits to ensure the accuracy and quality of data used in business intelligence initiatives.
Support and Training: Provide training and support to internal users on BI tools and data-driven processes, contributing to the creation of a data-driven culture.
Continuous Improvement: Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in business intelligence and data analytics, proposing and implementing improvements in data management processes and the overall BI strategy.
Technological Adaptation: Actively support the organization during tool changes/updates to ensure




What you bring to the table:




Experience: 1 year of previous experience in business intelligence, data analytics, or a related role is preferred but not required. Candidates with relevant internships or academic projects will also be considered.




Educational milestone:




Education: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, Computer Science, Data Analytics, Information Systems, or a related field.
Languages: Excellent level of scientific and business English, both spoken and written.




Your key superpowers:




Proficiency in SQL and Excel for data manipulation and analysis.
Familiarity with BI tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Looker).
Knowledge of data warehousing concepts and ETL/ELT processes.
Understanding of data visualization techniques and best practices. Eagerness to learn and adapt to new technologies and methodologies.
Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work in multidisciplinary teams.
Strong organizational and time management skills.
Proactive, detail-oriented, and capable of managing multiple tasks simultaneously.
Eagerness to learn and adapt to new technologies and methodologies, and actively contribute to team growth.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Kiwi.com

Kiwi.com is a leading global travel-tech company headquartered in the Czech Republic. Our innovative algorithm enables users to find better route options and prices other search engines can‚Äôt see, daily performing billions of price checks across 95% of global flight content. Are you bold, bright and curious? Join a global business that‚Äôs still got a start-up heart.

About Our Content Analytics Team

Our team is responsible for providing data-centric insights that enable the optimization of our flight content acquisition and processing. We use extensive datasets to support booking channel performance, improve autobooking efficiency and ensure data quality across our systems. Our work directly impacts Kiwi.com 's ability to offer our customers unique travel combinations and a smooth booking experience worldwide. We combine technical expertise with business understanding to build data-informed recommendations across multiple teams and stakeholders.

What You Will Do


You will conduct complex ad-hoc analysis using BigQuery and Looker, delivering insights that support thoughtful decision-making.
By creating and maintaining dashboards for key business metrics, you will help make data accessible and meaningful for stakeholders.
You will work with Looker's analytical layer, defining explores, measures and dimensions to support robust data exploration.
You will collaborate on building data models and support data quality through rigorous QA processes in collaboration with our data engineers.
You will evaluate and improve our complex flight booking and data acquisition systems, identifying opportunities for optimization.
You‚Äôll create data-informed recommendations by sharing practical insights with our flight content ecosystem.
You will help develop monitoring and alerting tools for product operations, enabling proactive incident detection and prevention.


What You Will Need


Your strong SQL skills and experience with BigQuery or similar data warehouses.
You have experience with BI tools (we use Looker) and a solid understanding of data modeling and data quality standards.
You can translate complex analytical findings into actionable insights that drive results.
You bring experience working with large datasets and collaborating with multiple stakeholders across teams.
Your excellent communication skills in English enable you to explain complex concepts to non-technical audiences.
You have an analytical mindset with a strong attention to detail, ensuring accuracy and precision in your work.
You are capable of working independently while aligning with and contributing to team goals.


We offer you


We offer a hybrid and flexible work environment. A lovely, modern office in the center of Barcelona (Passeig de Gracia) with great views and amenities.
Monthly entitlement of 200 Euro redeemable through Cobee. Cobee is a benefits platform offering a range of benefits (meals, transport, nursery, health insurance, and physical wellness) and flexible compensation. It also allows our employees to allocate up to 30% of their gross salary to the consumption of certain products or services, leveraging tax exemption.
We also enjoy benefits, such as flexible working hours, 30 paid vacation days and sick days.
Annual financial bonus based on company and individual performance.
Flight vouchers to celebrate your Kiwi anniversaries.
Relocation package (including visa transfer support).
Dogs are welcome in our offices.


Interested? Join us and help us make travel more accessible to all.

Kiwi.com is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and employer. We review applications for employment without regard to their race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, uniformed services, genetic information, physical or mental disability, medical condition, marital status, or any other basis prohibited by law.

Throughout the recruitment process and for some time after it‚Äôs finished, we‚Äôre going to process your Personal Data. You can find all the necessary information in our Privacy Policy available at: https://jobs.kiwi.com/recruitment-privacy-policy/ .

Experiencia previa trabajando con datos financieros, comerciales u operativos.
Habilidad para parametrizar o trabajar con herramientas internas tipo CRM, backoffice o configuradores de producto.
Capacidad para trabajar en un entorno h√≠brido (oficina y remoto).

Flexibilidad y confianza: nos importan los resultados, no las horas.
Oportunidades reales de crecimiento profesional en una fintech innovadora con impacto directo en el negocio.

Title: Master Data Analyst
Description:
CUSTOMER SERVICE MASTER DATA ANALYST Location: Barcelona, Spain

The Customer Service Master Data Analyst is responsible for ensuring the accuracy, completeness, and timeliness of master data processes within the market. This role plays a key part in maintaining high-quality master data execution and overseeing data execution from the Shared Service Center. The role is critical for driving efficiency in master data management and ensuring seamless customer service operations.

Your main focus:


Ensure Master Data Readiness & Quality: Deliver accurate and timely data setup KPIs for product activation, PIPO management, customer setup, logistics, and pricing conditions. Guarantee data readiness for new product launches and promotional activities. Train Sales and Marketing teams to follow global standards and ensure accurate input using standard templates.
Governance and Execution of Master Data Processes: Own and enforce master data execution processes, ensuring compliance with business standards. Develop protocols and workflows to maintain master data quality and implement continuous improvement practices.
Oversee Shared Service Center Operations: Monitor and validate the quality of master data execution by the Shared Service Center, ensuring SLA adherence.
Conduct quality control checks and provide feedback to improve processes and performance.
Data Insights and Analytics: Consolidate master data insights and share them with the Master Data Leader to support informed decision-making.


Working for Coty means constant opportunities and change. You will be managing a lot of things at the same time, but this is also what makes it exciting!

Key success measures for the Customer Services Master Data Analyst include the following:


Timeliness and Accuracy: Ensure master data updates are completed within SLA timeframes and accurately on the first attempt.
Process and Compliance: Adhere to SLAs, protocols, governance standards, and achieve high audit compliance rates.
Quality and Efficiency: Maintain high QC pass rates, resolve data issues quickly, and ensure data completeness in all entries.
Stakeholder Satisfaction and Reporting: Deliver timely analytics and reports while achieving strong feedback from internal stakeholders.


The Customer Services Master Data Analyst will liaise with various cross-functional and remote teams, such as:


Customer Service Operations
Shared Service Center
Master Data Global Teams
IT CoE


YOU ARE A COTY FIT

You have excellent problem solving skills and have the ability to think quickly & work under tight deadlines. As a CS Master Data Analyst, you get energy from working in a fast-paced, diverse, and challenging environment. You have strong attention to detail and organisation skills, and can communicate effectively and collaborate with various stakeholders.

Other than that, we are looking for candidates who:


Have a Bachelor‚Äôs degree, higher vocational training or vocational training in Data Management, or a related field.
2 to 4 years of experience in master data management, customer service, or related fields.
Proficiency in SAP and data governance tools.
Basic fluency/proficiency in English and proficient or native in any of the following languages: Spanish, French, Italian, Dutch, German
Strong proficiency in data analysis tools will be a plus (e.g., Excel, Power BI, Tableau).
Familiarity with customer and product master data processes in SAP (customer set up, activation, PIPO, pricing conditions).


Our Benefits

As our Customer Service Master Data Analyst, some of the benefits you will receive are:


Competitive remuneration and perks will be matched with your experience and knowledge.
Ticket restaurant (daily diet for meals)
Company products / Access to the company shop
Life and accident insurance


RECRUITMENT PROCESS


A screening call with the recruiters
A first online/in-person interview with hiring managers
A second interview (optionally)
Feedback, verbal offer
Hiring


About Coty

Coty is one of the world‚Äôs largest beauty companies with an iconic portfolio of brands across fragrance, color cosmetics, skincare, and body care. At Coty, we celebrate the entire human kaleidoscope and cultivate a culture of fearless kindness. Therefore, we are proud to be an equal opportunities employer. We do not discriminate against any candidate or employee and strive to be an open, inclusive and diverse workplace where all employees can be their authentic self. Join us in making over the world of beauty!

Title: Data Analyst - Business Performance Analytics
Description:
What You'll Do:

As part of the Business Performance Analytics (BPAX) team within Sales Strategy, your primary mission will be to deliver robust, intuitive, and actionable business insights that empower Criteo‚Äôs CRO and Commercial leaders to shape and drive the company‚Äôs commercial strategy.

You will apply a data-driven approach to uncover insights and explain business performance. This role involves working with large and complex datasets, requiring strong analytical curiosity, creativity in data exploration, and the ability to synthesize findings into a compelling narrative that supports strategic decision-making.

Your Mission


Build advanced analytical views to decode and communicate global performance patterns
Perform in-depth competitive analyses, measuring the business impact of competitors‚Äô activities across key markets
Leverage external and internal data to understand client behavior, identify high-value client clusters (e.g., through CLTV studies), and qualify the potential of clients and prospects across new and existing business areas
Size business growth opportunities and risks, and translating findings into actionable recommendations for multiple levels of stakeholders



Who You Are:


2‚Äì3 years of experience in a similar analytics role (experience in AdTech is a plus)
A Bachelor‚Äôs degree or higher in a quantitative field (e.g., Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, or Business)
Strong analytical skills and intellectual curiosity, with the ability to structure and solve complex problems
Solid understanding of statistical modeling and data interpretation
Hands-on experience with SQL for data manipulation and extraction
Proficiency in Python for data analysis
Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Power BI and/or Tableau
Strong presentation skills (including PowerPoint), with the ability to translate complex data into clear business insights and actionable recommendations
Business acumen and the ability to act as a trusted advisor to commercial stakeholders
Excellent communication skills and fluency in English
A proactive, autonomous mindset, with the ability to manage multiple projects, set milestones, coordinate with cross-functional teams, and drive initiatives forward



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we‚Äôd love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is a leader in commerce media, helping brands, agencies, and publishers create meaningful consumer connections through AI-powered advertising solutions. We‚Äôre shaping a more open and sustainable digital future for advertising.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices across the globe or from the comfort of home, our 3,600 Criteos collaborate together to build an open, impactful, and forward-thinking environment.

We foster a workplace where everyone is valued, and employment decisions are based solely on skills, qualifications, and business needs‚Äînever on non-job-related factors or legally protected characteristics.

What We Offer:

üè† Own your work style ‚Äì Build your work around your life and not the other way around.

üìà Grow with us ‚Äì Learning, mentorship & career development programs.

üí™ Your wellbeing matters ‚Äì Health benefits, wellness perks & mental health support.

ü§ù A team that cares ‚Äì Diverse, inclusive, and globally connected.

üí∏ Fair pay & perks ‚Äì Competitive salary, equity, performance-based rewards and family-friendly policies.

Additional benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo.

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
The Swiss-based DocMorris AG is a leading company in the fields of online pharmacy, marketplace and professional healthcare with strong brands in Germany and other European countries. With its business model, DocMorris offers its patients, customers and partners a broad range of products and services. In doing so, DocMorris is pursuing its vision of creating a digital health ecosystem for everyone to manage their health in one click.

In Spain and France, the company operates the leading marketplace for health and personal care products in Southern Europe. With an innovative business model, our marketplace does not manage stock or warehouses, it integrates the catalog of products, pricing, and stock levels of the most important and trusted off-line pharmacies in a single website, achieving 24h delivery service for more than 200.000 products and 10.000 brands from more than 1.000 pharmacies and health stores. Our business model and service have received several awards like the prize for Best Webshop in Spain as well as the Best Mobile App from the E-Commerce Awards.

We are seeking a Data Analyst to join our Data team, reporting to the Head of Data and working side by side with the business, finance, marketing, and engineering teams, to help extract the full value from our data in order to ask and answer questions, make decisions, and optimize, all to improve the experience for our customers and marketplace sellers by helping our internal teams with the appropriate data and reports.

Tasks and Responsibilities:


Follow-up and analysis of the main KPIs related to marketing, business, operations and finance in order to detect deviations, propose improvement actions, facilitate the decision-making process, and to detect/prevent potential loss of business faster.
Continuous development of efficient/automated reporting dashboards, tools, and processes to support decision-making.
Assisting stakeholders in the usage of the various existing systems and datasets available within the company and driving the development of new solutions.
Ad-hoc analysis to assist different teams in the decision making process, such as evaluating the performance of A/B Tests.
Prepare the monthly presentations for Business review meetings and Boards.
Support CFO, CMO, Marketing managers and SEO manager in the process of preparing the annual Budget and Rolling forecast.
Collaborate with and support the different teams inside the company, serving as the link and translator between these stakeholders and the data team, managing, clarifying, and defining their requests.


What we are looking for:


Professional Experience:
Minimum 2 year experience as a Data Analyst.
Experience in a customer-centric company, preferably e-commerce, transactional marketplace, or e-health, is a plus.
People Skills:
Excellence: in organization, planning and execution. Focus on details and ability to work under pressure and prioritize. Experience with Agile is a plus.
Proactivity: proposes new ideas and is able to work independently.
Ownership: takes on every challenge with responsibility until we find the solution. Problem solving mind-set.
Team: accustomed to collaborating with many stakeholders from multiple departments, solving problems together and sharing in achievements, failures, successes.
Highly analytical skills: obsession with data and continuous improvement.
Professional Skills:
Proficiency in the use of Excel.
Experience using a BI tool. Qlik Sense is a plus.
Good command of SQL.
Knowledge of Python or similar programming language.
Languages: Spanish and English (proficiency).
Domain knowledge (marketing, business, finance, operations, logistics) is a plus.


Our Benefits


Ticket restaurant 11‚Ç¨/day worked
25 days of holiday
Birthday day-off + 50‚Ç¨ voucher to spend on our website!
Health insurance with Sanitas is paid by PromoFarma (for those who want it!)
Social benefits package. You can dedicate a part of your gross salary to Ticket Transport or Nursery.
Opportunity to participate in the employee participation program (stock options)
10% discount on our website on each purchase and up to 30% discount on DocMorris branded products
Access to eLearning platforms such as LinkedIn Learning
Individual training opportunities and budget for personal development
Access to corporate wellness plattform "Wellhub" (ex Gympass) with various offers on gyms, studios, guided classes, workouts and wellness app
Access to mobile consultations with medical specialists, lawyers or veterinarians via "Doctor i "
Great employee events and annual company celebrations


Show more
HTML:
The Swiss-based DocMorris AG is a leading company in the fields of online pharmacy, marketplace and professional healthcare with strong brands in Germany and other European countries. With its business model, DocMorris offers its patients, customers and partners a broad range of products and services. In doing so, DocMorris is pursuing its vision of creating a digital health ecosystem for everyone to manage their health in one click.

In Spain and France, the company operates the leading marketplace for health and personal care products in Southern Europe. With an innovative business model, our marketplace does not manage stock or warehouses, it integrates the catalog of products, pricing, and stock levels of the most important and trusted off-line pharmacies in a single website, achieving 24h delivery service for more than 200.000 products and 10.000 brands from more than 1.000 pharmacies and health stores. Our business model and service have received several awards like the prize for Best Webshop in Spain as well as the Best Mobile App from the E-Commerce Awards.

We are seeking a Data Analyst to join our Data team, reporting to the Head of Data and working side by side with the business, finance, marketing, and engineering teams, to help extract the full value from our data in order to ask and answer questions, make decisions, and optimize, all to improve the experience for our customers and marketplace sellers by helping our internal teams with the appropriate data and reports.

Tasks and Responsibilities:

  • Follow-up and analysis of the main KPIs related to marketing, business, operations and finance in order to detect deviations, propose improvement actions, facilitate the decision-making process, and to detect/prevent potential loss of business faster.
  • Continuous development of efficient/automated reporting dashboards, tools, and processes to support decision-making.
  • Assisting stakeholders in the usage of the various existing systems and datasets available within the company and driving the development of new solutions.
  • Ad-hoc analysis to assist different teams in the decision making process, such as evaluating the performance of A/B Tests.
  • Prepare the monthly presentations for Business review meetings and Boards.
  • Support CFO, CMO, Marketing managers and SEO manager in the process of preparing the annual Budget and Rolling forecast.
  • Collaborate with and support the different teams inside the company, serving as the link and translator between these stakeholders and the data team, managing, clarifying, and defining their requests.

What we are looking for:

  • Professional Experience:
  • Minimum 2 year experience as a Data Analyst.
  • Experience in a customer-centric company, preferably e-commerce, transactional marketplace, or e-health, is a plus.
  • People Skills:
  • Excellence: in organization, planning and execution. Focus on details and ability to work under pressure and prioritize. Experience with Agile is a plus.
  • Proactivity: proposes new ideas and is able to work independently.
  • Ownership: takes on every challenge with responsibility until we find the solution. Problem solving mind-set.
  • Team: accustomed to collaborating with many stakeholders from multiple departments, solving problems together and sharing in achievements, failures, successes.
  • Highly analytical skills: obsession with data and continuous improvement.
  • Professional Skills:
  • Proficiency in the use of Excel.
  • Experience using a BI tool. Qlik Sense is a plus.
  • Good command of SQL.
  • Knowledge of Python or similar programming language.
  • Languages: Spanish and English (proficiency).
  • Domain knowledge (marketing, business, finance, operations, logistics) is a plus.

Our Benefits

  • Ticket restaurant 11‚Ç¨/day worked
  • 25 days of holiday
  • Birthday day-off + 50‚Ç¨ voucher to spend on our website!
  • Health insurance with Sanitas is paid by PromoFarma (for those who want it!)
  • Social benefits package. You can dedicate a part of your gross salary to Ticket Transport or Nursery.
  • Opportunity to participate in the employee participation program (stock options)
  • 10% discount on our website on each purchase and up to 30% discount on DocMorris branded products
  • Access to eLearning platforms such as LinkedIn Learning
  • Individual training opportunities and budget for personal development
  • Access to corporate wellness plattform "Wellhub" (ex Gympass) with various offers on gyms, studios, guided classes, workouts and wellness app
  • Access to mobile consultations with medical specialists, lawyers or veterinarians via "Doctor i "
  • Great employee events and annual company celebrations

Title: Data Analyst, Solutions & Innovation
Description:
What You'll Do:

As a member of our Analytics Solutions & Innovation (AXSI) team, you will act as a key analytical partner to our commercial organization, helping to steer innovation from the ground up. Your role will be crucial in developing new ways to measure and demonstrate value for our clients.


Solution Prototyping & Development: Translate complex business questions into scalable data analyses, prototyping new measurement methodologies for Criteo‚Äôs latest upper-funnel solutions using our rich shopper graph dataset.
Client & Internal Collaboration: Collaborate with internal teams and clients to deeply understand their business needs and how they measure the value of upper-funnel marketing activities.
Iterative Analysis & Validation: Design and execute analyses to validate new measurement approaches, iterating on prototypes with internal partners to refine them for production readiness.
Product Innovation & Scalability: Partner with Product and R&D teams to develop feature requests, transforming your successful analytical prototypes into scalable, fully-fledged Criteo products.
Data-Driven Innovation: Leverage cutting-edge tech like Hadoop, Vertica, Tableau, Git, Python, and SQL to build innovative analytical solutions from the ground up.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with commercial and product teams to deliver insights that drive the development of new, revenue-generating solutions.



Who You Are:


You have at least 1 year of hands-on data analysis experience, with proficiency in SQL and Python.
A natural problem-solver with a passion for analytics and a logical approach to challenges.
Business-minded with a talent for turning data insights into actionable product strategies.
Passionate about product development and turning analytical prototypes into real-world solutions.
Excellent ability to synthesize complex information and present clear, actionable recommendations.
A team player who thrives in a collaborative, inclusive, and vibrant workspace.
Fluent in English and skilled at simplifying complex concepts for diverse audiences.
Eligible to work in Spain with no restrictions.



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we‚Äôd love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform. üåü

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world‚Äôs marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

Title: BI Analyst Intern (6-month full time)
Description:
What You'll Do:

The Global Reporting Team's mission is to identify, define, produce, and automate sales/business/finance performance reporting portfolio. As the scope of the GRT is so wide, this is a unique opportunity not only to develop your technical skills, but also to learn more about different areas of our business and make an impact, while working in a fast paced environment.

Criteo and our stakeholders are constantly finding new ways to innovate, and our reporting suite is critical for tracking progress. As an intern, alongside the rest of the team you will be responsible for :


Working with stakeholder to analyze and understand their business needs to translate them into technical requirements
Building, running and updating existing reports based on the company needs and transformations
Exploring, validating and fixing data issues to provide high quality service to Criteos
Maintaining and improving processes (specification, procedures, and user training material).



Our objective is that by the end of the internship, you have developed the skills and experience to work in data.

Who You Are:


Degree from a business or quantitative field
Must be eager to learn, proactive and analytical
Excellent communication skills in English (spoken and written)
You are versatile, self-driven, detail-oriented, and hands-on
You value teamwork and building rapport with individuals
You have a demonstrated interest in Internet and technology
Bonus: experience in Excel (pivot tables, vlookup, etc.), PowerPoint, SQL, and BI restitution tools such Power BI (or equivalent)



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we‚Äôd love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world‚Äôs marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

Title: Finance Data Analyst
Description:
About Us

At Docplanner Group, we‚Äôre on a mission to help people live longer, healthier lives. As the world‚Äôs largest healthcare platform, each month, we connect 24 million patients with 280k doctors across 13 countries (through brands like ZnanyLekarz, Doctoralia, MioDottore, DoktorTakvimi, and jameda). Our marketplaces, SaaS and AI tools simplify daily tasks and help doctors, clinics and hospitals work more efficiently, so they can focus on what really matters: caring for their patients.

Learn more about our products here: pro.doctoralia.es

Why Join Us?


üìä Real impact ‚Äì We help doctors help patients. Your work truly makes a difference.
üìà At scale, yet agile ‚Äì 3,000+ employees, but still fast, flexible, and hands-on.
üí∞ Pre-IPO & growing ‚Äì We‚Äôre backed by leading VC funds including One Peak Partners, Goldman Sachs Asset Management, and Point Nine Capital, raising a total of approx. ‚Ç¨400m to date. Now, we‚Äôre focused on profitability and IPO preparation. It‚Äôs an exciting time to join us.
‚ú® Shape the future, sustain growth ‚Äì Make a difference now *and* build for long-term success.


Job Description

The new team member, working within the Financial Reporting team, will play a key role in supporting the evolution of financial reporting in a challenging and stimulating environment. You will help bridge the gap between finance and BI. Our primary objective is to assist the business in making decisions based on data, with a particular emphasis on producing reports as the primary and most reliable source of information.

A team of 12 experts provides support to various departments, including marketing, sales, customer success, finance, and people experience, for both short-term and long-term projects. Collaborating closely with stakeholders, we strive to develop reports, analyses, models, and recommendations that enable us to gain a deep understanding of how we can enhance the satisfaction of both doctors and patients.

You will be an integral part of the Financial Reporting team, working closely with the Data Analytics team to support business decisions based on data.

How would you be impacting our mission


Financial Reporting and Analysis: Track key financial metrics and KPIs, ensuring they align with organizational goals; Develop and maintain comprehensive financial dashboards using advanced BI tools; Provide detailed insights into financial performance, trends, and variances; Provide insights for long-term strategic decisions;
Data Management and Integration: Ensure accurate and timely collection of financial data from systems like Oracle NetSuite; Integrate data from multiple sources for a unified financial view;
Performance Measurement: Analyze profitability and cost efficiency to identify improvement areas;
Regulatory and Compliance Reporting: Support audits and for regulatory documentation;
Automation and Process Improvement: Automate repetitive financial tasks to improve efficiency; Implement process improvements to reduce manual efforts and errors;
Enhanced Reporting and Visualization: Utilize BI tools like Tableau for dynamic, interactive reports and dashboards; Enhance report quality and accessibility beyond traditional spreadsheets.


Qualifications

What will help you thrive?


Bachelor's degree in Economics, Statistics, Econometrics or a related field.
Demonstrable experience in using SQL to derive actionable insights, either in commercial or academic setting (must have).
Knowledge of Python/R and desire to expand your knowledge.
Experience with statistical modeling and descriptive statistics.
Experience in partnership with internal stakeholders.
Experience in leading and executing end to end BI projects.
Strong written and oral communication skills in English; proficiency in other languages such as German, Spanish, and Italian is a plus.
Ability to gather, organize, analyze, and report large volumes of financial data with speed and accuracy.
Strong attention to detail with the ability to provide high-quality work efficiently.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to adapt and work in a quickly changing environment, managing competing demands.


Which skills are ‚Äòbonus points‚Äô?


Master's degree in Economics, Statistics, Econometrics or a related field.
Able to take a step back from the technicalities and examine them through a business lens.
Open to cooperating with a lot of people from many teams in different countries.
Like to see the instant effects of your work.
Knowledge of ERP finance applications (Oracle, Oracle - NetSuite, SAP).
Relevant experience in accounting and financial reporting.


Additional Information

What to Expect from Our Hiring Process

Role

We like to keep things transparent and efficient! Here‚Äôs what the process usually looks like (though it might vary slightly depending on the role):

1Ô∏è‚É£ Intro Chat ‚Äì A first call with our Talent Acquisition Partner to explore mutual fit around relevant skills, value alignment, and motivation.

2Ô∏è‚É£ Hiring Manager Interview ‚Äì A deeper dive into your experience and aspirations with your future manager, who you‚Äôll be reporting to in this role. Take this chance to ask anything on your mind‚Äîit‚Äôs just as much about making sure we‚Äôre the right fit for you, too.

3Ô∏è‚É£ Second Hiring Manager Interview

4Ô∏è‚É£ Business Case Presentation & Team Meeting

Why You‚Äôll Love It Here

üíô Global Benefits ‚Äì No matter where you are, you‚Äôll have access to:


Healthcare insurance ‚Äì so you can focus on what matters.
Wellness that works for you ‚Äì from gym memberships to mental health support, we‚Äôve got you covered.
Time off that counts ‚Äì whether it‚Äôs a vacation, your birthday, or just a day to recharge, we believe in balance.
ESOP (Employee Share Ownership Plan) after 6 months with us‚Äîbecause we believe in sharing our success!


üìç Local Perks ‚Äì Depending on your location, you will be entitled to local benefits like meal vouchers (ticket restaurant), transport allowances, or extended parental leave.

üöÄ Career Growth ‚Äì We‚Äôre growing, and so can you! You‚Äôll find lots of chances to learn, develop, and explore new paths‚Äîwhether within your team or through cross-functional projects.

üåé A Truly Global Team ‚Äì Work with talented people from all over the world in a diverse and inclusive environment.

‚è≥ Flexibility That Works for You ‚Äì Remote work and flexible hours aren‚Äôt just buzzwords here. While the extent of flexibility depends on your role and team, we value results over rigid schedules. Prefer an office setting? You're welcome at any of our hubs in Barcelona, Warsaw, Curitiba, Rio de Janeiro, Mexico City, Bogot√°, Munich, Rome or Bologna.

Please note: At this time, we are not able to sponsor visas for this position. To apply, you must already have the legal right to work in your country of residence or the location of the role.

What We Believe In

At Docplanner, our values guide everything we do:

üìä Focus on results ‚Äì we're here to make an impact.

üß† Think like an owner ‚Äì take responsibility, drive outcomes.

‚úÇÔ∏è Keep it simple, keep it lean ‚Äì smart solutions over complexity.

üîä Be respectful and radically honest ‚Äì openness builds trust.

üìö Learn and be curious ‚Äì growth is part of the job.

Don‚Äôt just take our word for it‚Äîcheck out our Glassdoor to hear what our people say!

_________________________________________________________________________

We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We welcome applicants from all walks of life, regardless of gender, disability, or background, and are dedicated to fostering an inclusive workplace where everyone feels valued and empowered to contribute.

Title: Advanced Analytics Analyst
Description:
About The Job

Sanofi has recently embarked into a vast and ambitious digital transformation program. A cornerstone of this roadmap is the acceleration of its data transformation and of the adoption of artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML) solutions, to accelerate R&D, manufacturing and commercial performance and bring better drugs and vaccines to patients faster, to improve health and save lives.

We are looking for a dynamic Advanced Analytics Analyst interested in challenging the status quo on deploying enterprise data products, with AI models and underlying data visualizations for data consumption. You are a valued influencer and a thought leader who is motivated to contribute to an AI focused Digital data organization. You have a keen eye for improvement opportunities and the demonstrated ability to deliver solutions that would enable data visualization, analytics, and data sciences.

Main Responsibilities


As a data champion, look to implement analytical models on data sets to uncover insights
Validate business requirements, defining global standards for data models, key performance indicators and measures, then implementing the global standards within our products for business units and markets
Create and implement repeatable analytics models in order to assess to measure performance or assess quality of data
Tell a story with data, hosting co-creation sessions to ensure needs are well understood and features are well articulated, producing mock-ups as required to quickly iterate on user feedback
Understand the data landscape that enables the enterprise solutions, with the ability to align on global standards across multiple stakeholder groups
A critical and analytical thinker, and a creative problem solver who can navigate difficult discussions and ambiguity to arrive at design solutions
Understand and implement enterprise data governance, data architecture and data management standards
Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand the business requirements, translating them to data, analytics and AI capabilities
Partner with Product Owners and Scrum Masters and be able to work in agile pods
Partner with Data Engineers and Data scientists to create data products


About You

Key Functional Requirements & Qualifications:


Strong knowledge working within an Agile environment
Strong knowledge and experience deploying analytical models using software development tools like GitHub
Experience in data visualization and analytics solutions deployment
Experience in building data pipelines with data quality metrics in place
Interest and/or experience in healthcare and pharmaceutical data


Key Technical Requirements & Qualifications


A university / college degree graduate in disciplines of engineering, computer science, mathematics, data science or related fields
Strong technical knowledge coupled with extensive experience in building analytical models, using scripting languages like python, and querying languages like SQL
Knowledge and experience of data platform tools like Snowflake and cloud platforms like AWS
Knowledge in UX and UI design and visualization tools like PowerBI and Tableau


Why choose us?


An international work environment, in which you can develop your talent and realize ideas and innovations within a competent team
An environment based on last technologies and frequent training to reinforce your profile
Flexible home office policy, with a possibility to work up to 60% of time from home / where you can easily schedule your office days
Work from an "Office of the Year 2024" finalist office


Pursue Progress. Discover Extraordinary.

Progress doesn‚Äôt happen without people ‚Äì people from different backgrounds, in different locations, doing different roles, all united by one thing: a desire to make miracles happen. You can be one of those people. Chasing change, embracing new ideas and exploring all the opportunities we have to offer. Let‚Äôs pursue progress. And let‚Äôs discover extraordinary together.

At Sanofi, we provide equal opportunities to all regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or gender identity.

Watch our ALL IN video and check out our Diversity Equity and Inclusion actions at sanofi.com!

#BarcelonaHub #SanofiHubs

nullPursue Progress. Discover Extraordinary.

Join Sanofi and step into a new era of science - where your growth can be just as transformative as the work we do. We invest in you to reach further, think faster, and do what‚Äôs never-been-done-before. You‚Äôll help push boundaries, challenge convention, and build smarter solutions that reach the communities we serve. Ready to chase the miracles of science and improve people‚Äôs lives? Let‚Äôs Pursue Progress and Discover Extraordinary ‚Äì together.

At Sanofi, we provide equal opportunities to all regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

  • Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand the business requirements, translating them to data, analytics and AI capabilities
  • Partner with Product Owners and Scrum Masters and be able to work in agile pods
  • Partner with Data Engineers and Data scientists to create data products

About You

Key Functional Requirements & Qualifications:

  • Strong knowledge working within an Agile environment
  • Strong knowledge and experience deploying analytical models using software development tools like GitHub
  • Experience in data visualization and analytics solutions deployment
  • Experience in building data pipelines with data quality metrics in place
  • Interest and/or experience in healthcare and pharmaceutical data

Key Technical Requirements & Qualifications

  • A university / college degree graduate in disciplines of engineering, computer science, mathematics, data science or related fields
  • Strong technical knowledge coupled with extensive experience in building analytical models, using scripting languages like python, and querying languages like SQL
  • Knowledge and experience of data platform tools like Snowflake and cloud platforms like AWS
  • Knowledge in UX and UI design and visualization tools like PowerBI and Tableau

Why choose us?

  • An international work environment, in which you can develop your talent and realize ideas and innovations within a competent team
  • An environment based on last technologies and frequent training to reinforce your profile
  • Flexible home office policy, with a possibility to work up to 60% of time from home / where you can easily schedule your office days
  • Work from an "Office of the Year 2024" finalist office

Pursue Progress. Discover Extraordinary.

Progress doesn‚Äôt happen without people ‚Äì people from different backgrounds, in different locations, doing different roles, all united by one thing: a desire to make miracles happen. You can be one of those people. Chasing change, embracing new ideas and exploring all the opportunities we have to offer. Let‚Äôs pursue progress. And let‚Äôs discover extraordinary together.

At Sanofi, we provide equal opportunities to all regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or gender identity.

Watch our ALL IN video and check out our Diversity Equity and Inclusion actions at sanofi.com!

#BarcelonaHub #SanofiHubs

nullPursue Progress. Discover Extraordinary.

Join Sanofi and step into a new era of science - where your growth can be just as transformative as the work we do. We invest in you to reach further, think faster, and do what‚Äôs never-been-done-before. You‚Äôll help push boundaries, challenge convention, and build smarter solutions that reach the communities we serve. Ready to chase the miracles of science and improve people‚Äôs lives? Let‚Äôs Pursue Progress and Discover Extraordinary ‚Äì together.

At Sanofi, we provide equal opportunities to all regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
We‚Äôre Adevinta, a global leader in digital marketplaces. Our household name brands, including Marktplaats in the Netherlands, mobile.de in Germany and leboncoin in France, reach hundreds of millions of people every month.

We‚Äôre all about matchmaking, and our sites help people find whatever they‚Äôre looking for in their local communities ‚Äì whether it‚Äôs a car, an apartment, a sofa or a new job. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less.

Our brands are supported by global Tech Hubs in Barcelona, Amsterdam, Paris and Berlin. Their goal is to develop common global products and innovation platforms which all of our brands can use. This means using cutting edge technology to create highly scalable, customisable and secure products and components that free up development time and leverage our access to global data.

What You‚Äôll Do & Who You Are

We are looking for an exceptional Data Analyst to join the Coches.Net, Motos.Net and Milanuncios.com team.

You will work as a member of multidisciplinary team, collaborating closely with Product owners, cluster teams, data engineers and management team stake-holders (Marketing, Sales, Product, BizDev and other Operations teams).Your main mission is to define and execute analyses of several business context to identify trends, opportunities and problems to improve the offering and services we offer.

These Will Be Your Functions


Identify, analyse and interpret KPIs and Health Metrics related to our users and customers, creating dashboard and visualisation to monitor them.
Identifying trends, risks and opportunities to provide insights that can make recommendations on how to improve the different initiatives of the vertical.
Create powerful Insights using Advanced analytics to improve the knowledge of our users and customers.
Actively participate in the discovery, and development of advanced analytical models (such as clustering, and predictive models), into their implementation in business use cases, such as customer segmentation, and propensity models for upselling, downselling, and churn prediction.


Qualifications


3+ years of experience in eCommerce, an online company.
Advanced knowledge of SQL and relational databases
Advanced knowledge of Python and/or R for data analysis (e.g. pandas, numpy, matplotlib), and advanced analytics (e.g. scikit-learn)
Advanced user of at least one visualisation tool such as Tableau and/or QlikSense.
Analytical skills: know how to interpret data, to extract relevant insights and be able to translate business questions into analytical needs Nice-to-have
Experience working with sales, operations, and strategy teams.
Good knowledge of basic machine learning algorithms (e.g. clustering, classification, regressions)
Some experience with big data technology (e.g. databricks, datalakes)
Some knowledge of data engineering tools (e.g. Airflow, DBT)Nice-to-have
Experience working with sales, operations, and strategy teams.
Good knowledge of basic machine learning algorithms (e.g. clustering, classification, regressions)
Some experience with big data technology (e.g. databricks, datalakes)
Some knowledge of data engineering tools (e.g. Airflow, DBT)


Benefits

Life at Adevinta comes with its perks! Our Adevintans enjoy the following benefits:


An attractive Base Salary üí∏
Participation in our Short Term Incentive plan (annual bonus) üèÜ
Work From Anywhere: Enjoy up to 20 days a year of working from anywhere! Maybe not from the moonüåõwell why not! just make sure you have internet connection! üåç
A 24/7 Employee Assistance Program for you and your family, because we care ‚ù§Ô∏è
Win together, lose together is one of our key behaviours. At Adevinta you will find a collaborative environment with an opportunity to explore your potential and grow üå±


On top of these, we also provide a range of locally relevant benefits. Wanna know more? Apply and ask our recruiters! ‚ú®

Adevinta is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

If you feel like you don‚Äôt meet all of the requirements for this role but are interested, please consider applying anyway. Research suggests that women and individuals from underrepresented groups may self-select out of opportunities if they don‚Äôt meet 100% of the job requirements. We strongly encourage people from historically excluded groups to apply and look forward to speaking with you.
