Title: Data Analyst - Supply Operations - ECA (They/He/She)
Description:
If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 23 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

ü§ù Our culture and strong values.

üí™ Our career development philosophy.

ü§ù Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: Building the largest marketplace in your city, to give access to anything in minutes. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

We are looking for a person with a positive attitude, lots of gas, creativity to think out of the box and passion for the work you will develop.

THE JOURNEY


Track courier performance and KPIs by analyzing historical operational metrics with a focus on company targets.
Develop and maintain scalable and self-service visualization tools and storytelling dashboards.
Propose (be an enthusiast), track and consolidate new ideas to improve the operations by being obsessed with Glovo's KPIs.
Conduct A/B tests, analyze the results of each project and be able to easily replicate them in the rest of the countries.
Actively collaborate with other analysts in Glovo and learn from each other in a supportive environment that allows you to grow, develop and make a difference.
Build robust relationships with Data Analysts in the ECA region acting as a strategic and supportive link between the HQ and local markets.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


Minimum 1 year of experience outside of an academic and internship setting in a quantitative analysis role within start-ups, consulting firms, or large companies, ideally in Tech or FMCG
Bachelor Degree in Economics, Engineering or any business or technological domain
Excellent SQL and Excel/GoogleSheets skills
Knowledge of visualisation tools like Tableau, Looker and/or PowerBI
Passion about analytics: you enjoy deep diving into problems to find the root cause
Ability to manage multiple tasks, prioritize workload, and handle a fast-paced environment
High motivation to contribute to a fast-growing startup
Ability to work both independently and within a team
Capability of executing tasks quickly while maintaining a high standard of quality
Great spoken and written English
An empathetic, inclusive and curious attitude


Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves


üåü An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
üí≥ Discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Title: Networks Data Analyst F/M
Description:
What You‚Äôll Be Doing

At Axa Partners, we are looking for our next Networks Data Analyst to be part of our data transformation journey and be part of the Motor Networks Cost Control department.

Data is a key part of AXA‚Äôs journey ‚Äúfrom Payer to Partner‚Äù, and its transformation to a Data Driven company. To succeed in this journey, AXA Partners data strategy has been organised around 6 dimensions: Data Value, Data Usage, Data Protection & Quality, Data Platform, Data Governance and Data Culture.

The Networks Data Analyst is therefore a cornerstone of the data transformation journey and he/she has to assist in the maintenance and creation of new reporting and analysis for both existing, new clients and internal clients from the existing MI database, ensuring throughout all performed analysis of the reliability and the business sense of the data. Networks Data Analyst interprets data and turns it into information which can offer ways to ease and improve business decisions. Networks Data Analysts gather information from various sources and interpret patterns and trends. Once data has been gathered and interpreted, the Data Analyst will report back what has been found in a comprehensive study to the wider business/relevant colleagues.

The post-holder will work closely with the Networks team, the Data teams and other teams to understand and define the report requirements and produce timely reports in a high quality format that can lead to decision making and partner discussions.

How Would Your Day To Day Be With Us


Provide business analysis and solutions for reporting requirements
Follow-up of Networks KPI‚Äôs and deviations alerts
Provide quality assurance of imported data
Commissioning and decommissioning of data sets
Processing confidential data and information according to guidelines
Helping develop reports and analysis
Managing and designing the reporting environment, including data sources
Supporting the data warehouse in identifying and revising reporting requirements
Supporting initiatives for data integrity and normalization
Generating reports from single or multiple systems
Training end-users on new reports and dashboards
Develop adhoc reports and analysis




What You‚Äôll Bring

You could be perfect for this role if you have :


Excellent knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite, especially Excel and PowerPoint
Degree in either Finance, Insurance, IT or Economics
Databases structures, Data Warehouse concepts, SQL knowledge
Experience with any visualisation tool such as Powerpivot, Power BI
Quickly understands the business issues and data challenges of clients organisation and industry
Ability to translate business requirements into non-technical, lay terms
Results orientated with good communication and interpersonal skills
Ability and willingness to take complex business requirements and progress them through analysis, development and final output
Clear analytical approach, with ability to manage financial data and statistics to deliver sophisticated outcomes
Excellent interpersonal and team-working skills with a helpful, flexible and solution-oriented approach
Able to maintain a calm and positive approach even under pressure or in conflicted situations


Desirable


Experience within Financial Services environment, Insurance specifically


To apply, click on the ‚Äòapply for this job‚Äô button, you‚Äôll then need to log in or create a profile to submit your CV. We‚Äôre proud to be an Equal Opportunities Employer and don‚Äôt discriminate against employees or potential employees based on protected characteristics.

Who We Are

We‚Äôre AXA Partners, experts at designing and delivering assistance solutions and specialised insurance, credit, and lifestyle protection - with and for our partners worldwide. What sets us apart? The expertise and passion of our 8,500+ people, and a strong network of over 55,000 professionals all over the world. Powered by them and our sector-leading technology, we continuously evolve, adapt and thrive - offering solutions and services that make sure we‚Äôre always at people‚Äôs side, no matter what. Helping others is our passion. Combining the best digital technology with our warm, human touch, we‚Äôre always looking at new ways to offer seamless and reassuring experiences when it really matters.

Join a company that helps protect the forests! At AXA Partners, we plant a tree for every new recruit (with a permanent contract)

Title: Data Analyst - Travel Industry
Description:
AIC Travel Group SAis a B2B travel company headquartered in Geneva, Switzerland, with over 20 years of experience in the tourism sector.

We are seeking a skilledData Analystwith proven expertise in thetravel and hospitality industry.


Responsibilities:


Drive data-led decisions forB2B travel partners(bedbanks, OTAs, DMCs) by analyzing hotel performance, market trends, and sales pipelines.

Build and manage dashboards inLooker Studio / Google Data Studio

Segment and automate campaigns and reports inHubSpot CRM

Provide actionable insights to support sales and marketing teams

Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and business intelligence metrics

Direct exposure to the CEO/management, offering visibility into strategic decision-making


Requirements:


2+ years of experience in the travel industry, ideally in a B2B environment (bedbanks, OTAs, DMCs, tour operators)

Proficiency withLooker Studio (Google Data Studio), Google Sheets, and advanced Excel

Hands-on experience withHubSpot CRM(reports, segmentation, workflows)

Strong analytical mindset and problem-solving skills

Self-driven, analytical mindset, remote collaboration fluency

Fluent inEnglish(mandatory); Italian/French/Spanish/German advantageous for EU market alignment


What We Offer:


A supportive and professional working environment

100% remote role, ideal for professionals seeking EU market access without relocation

A strategic position in a solid, fast-scaling Swiss company

Competitive compensation and motivational development aligned with your capabilities and responsibilities


If you are interested and possess the above qualities, please send your CV and motivation letter in English ****** the subject line: CV - Data Analyst - [Your Name].


Important Note:Only applications from candidates residing in the specified region and strictly meeting the above criteria will be considered for this position.

Title: Data Science Sr Analyst
Description:
Overview

Your role will be to be part of growing team based in Barcelona, to create and support global digital developments for PepsiCo. As a Data Science Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in leveraging advanced analytics and machine learning to deliver impactful solutions across critical business topics such as Consumer Insights, Revenue Management, Supply Chain, Manufacturing, and Logistics.

You will be part of a collaborative interdisciplinary team around data, where you will be responsible of building deployable statistical/machine learning models, beginning from the discovery phase through to implementation. You‚Äôll collaborate closely with process owners, product managers, and end-users to ensure your developments are aligned with business priorities and drive measurable outcomes.

You will be an internal ambassador of the team‚Äôs culture around data and analytics fostering a culture of innovation, analytics, and collaboration fostering a culture of innovation, analytics, collaboration, and being a data driven leader . You will provide stewardship to colleagues in the areas that you are a specialist or you are specializing contributing to the team‚Äôs growth and success in data and analytics.

Responsibilities


Contributing member in a digital project acting as tech lead for the project.
Act as a subject matter expert in one other digital project.
Support lead contributor in innovation activities
Partner with product managers in taking DS requirements and assessing DS components in roadmaps.
Partner with data engineers to ensure data access for discovery and proper data is prepared for model consumption.
Partner with ML engineers to industrialize solutions.
Contribute with work activities that involve Business teams, other IT services and as required.
Drive the use of the Platform toolset and to also focus on 'the art of the possible' demonstrations to the business as needed.
Communicate with business stakeholders in the process of service design, training and knowledge transfer.
Support large-scale experimentation and build data-driven models.
Set KPIs and metrics to evaluate analytics solution given a particular use case.
Refine requirements into modelling problems.
Influence product teams through data-based recommendations.
Research in state-of-the-art methodologies.
Create documentation for learnings and knowledge transfer.
Support in creation reusable packages or libraries.


Qualifications


4+ years‚Äô experience building solutions in the commercial or in the supply chain space.
4+ years working in a team to deliver production level analytic solutions. Fluent in git (version control). Understanding of Jenkins, Docker are a plus.
4+ years‚Äô experience in ETL and/or data wrangling techniques. Fluent in SQL syntaxis.
2+ years‚Äô experience in Statistical/ML techniques to solve supervised (regression, classification) and unsupervised problems. Experiences with Deep Learning are a plus.
2+ years‚Äô experience in developing business problem related statistical/ML modeling with industry tools with primary focus on Python or Scala development.
Business storytelling and communicating data insights in business consumable format. Fluent in one Visualization tool.
Strong communications and organizational skills with the ability to deal with ambiguity while juggling multiple priorities
Experience with Agile methodology for team work and analytics ‚Äòproduct‚Äô creation. Fluent in Jira, Confluence.
Experience with Azure cloud services is a must.
Experience in Reinforcement Learning is a plus.
Experience in Simulation and Optimization problems in any space is a plus.
Experience with Bayesian methods is a plus.
Experience with Causal inference is a plus.
Experience with NLP is a plus.
Experience with working with FAIR data is a plus.
Experience with Responsible AI is a plus.
Experience with distributed machine learning is a plus
Show more

Title: Data Analyst - Travel Industry
Description:
AIC Travel Group SAis a B2B travel company headquartered in Geneva, Switzerland, with over 20 years of experience in the tourism sector.

We are seeking a skilledData Analystwith proven expertise in thetravel and hospitality industry.


Responsibilities:


Drive data-led decisions forB2B travel partners(bedbanks, OTAs, DMCs) by analyzing hotel performance, market trends, and sales pipelines.

Build and manage dashboards inLooker Studio / Google Data Studio

Segment and automate campaigns and reports inHubSpot CRM

Provide actionable insights to support sales and marketing teams

Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and business intelligence metrics

Direct exposure to the CEO/management, offering visibility into strategic decision-making


Requirements:


2+ years of experience in the travel industry, ideally in a B2B environment (bedbanks, OTAs, DMCs, tour operators)

Proficiency withLooker Studio (Google Data Studio), Google Sheets, and advanced Excel

Hands-on experience withHubSpot CRM(reports, segmentation, workflows)

Strong analytical mindset and problem-solving skills

Self-driven, analytical mindset, remote collaboration fluency

Fluent inEnglish(mandatory); Italian/French/Spanish/German advantageous for EU market alignment


What We Offer:


A supportive and professional working environment

100% remote role, ideal for professionals seeking EU market access without relocation

A strategic position in a solid, fast-scaling Swiss company

Competitive compensation and motivational development aligned with your capabilities and responsibilities


If you are interested and possess the above qualities, please send your CV and motivation letter in English ****** the subject line: CV - Data Analyst - [Your Name].


Important Note:Only applications from candidates residing in the specified region and strictly meeting the above criteria will be considered for this position.

Title: Senior Data Analyst I
Description:
About The Team

Within the Global Operations organisation, our mission is to build the best customer experience in the fintech industry by delivering an effortless journey to all our merchants. We are looking for a skilled and passionate Senior Data Analyst to join our talented Data & Insights Team.

As a Senior Data Analyst at SumUp, you will be responsible for pushing forward a data-driven culture within the Operations organisation. You will be the primary point of contact for the Customer Support teams, working alongside them to define KPIs for evaluating the efficiency of our Service Models as well as evaluating the productivity and quality of our support agents. You will work with other data analysts, analytics engineers and data scientists to leverage business knowledge into impactful insights and recommendations.

What You Do


Develop advanced dashboards to facilitate self-service analytics for the Customer Support and Operations Leadership teams.
Partner up with Operations Leadership to develop strategies based on data-driven insights and qualitative analysis, focusing on Agent Performance.
Visualise insights and interpret results to present findings to stakeholders across the organisation, providing actionable recommendations based on your analysis.
Help define and implement KPIs to measure the success of our Support Service Model and the productivity of our agents.
Leverage SQL and data modelling best practices to manage and transform high volumes of data into actionable insights.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement data-driven strategies.


You‚Äôll be great for this position if you have:


5+ years of experience working as a Data Analyst, preferably with knowledge of customer support.
Proficiency in developing, optimising, and validating SQL queries and data models.
Hands-on experience developing advanced dashboards following industry best practices, preferably using Tableau.
The capacity to examine business requirements across various functional areas and translate them into KPIs, insights, data models and dashboards.
Effective communication and presentation skills to convey complex data findings and insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Can lead work independently as well as play a key role in mentoring and guiding others in a team


Why you should join SumUp:


Opportunity to work with SumUppers globally on large-scale fintech products used by millions of businesses worldwide.
Restaurant Ticket
Subsidize public transport ticket (50%)
Health Insurance (50%)
Free Babbel Professional Subscription
Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion: Be part of a workplace that values and promotes diversity, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone's perspectives are respected and embraced
A dedicated annual L&D budget of ‚Ç¨2000 for attending conferences and/or advancing your career through further education
30 Days Sabbatical: Enjoy the unique opportunity to take a well-deserved break with our 30-day sabbatical benefit after completing 3 years of employment with SumUp
Referral Bonus: Earn additional rewards by referring talented individuals to join the SumUp team


About SumUp

We believe in the everyday hero.

Small business owners are at the heart of all we do, so we create powerful, easy-to-use financial solutions to help them run their businesses. With a founder‚Äôs mentality and a 'team-first‚Äô attitude, our diverse teams across Europe, South America and the United States work together to ensure that the small business owners we partner with can be successful doing what they love.

SumUp is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer that proudly pursues and hires a diverse workforce. SumUp does not make hiring or employment decisions on the basis of race, colour, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, sex, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age or any other basis protected by applicable laws or prohibited by company policy. SumUp also strives for a healthy and safe workplace and strictly prohibits harassment of any kind.

SumUp will not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate.

Job Application Tip

We recognise that candidates feel they need to meet 100% of the job criteria in order to apply for a job. Please note that this is only a guide. If you don‚Äôt tick every box, it‚Äôs ok too because it means you have room to learn and develop your career at SumUp.

Title: Electronics & Data Analysis Internship
Description:
Are you an analytical person who enjoys Big Data analysis? Do you have an electronics background and want to grow in this area? HP Inc and be part of one of the most recognized supply chains in the industry!

We are the Procurement team for electromechanical parts within the Large Format Printing Business and 3D Business (aka LFP & 3D). We take care of direct materials procurement, and our deliverables are directly linked with the parts specifications, availability and suitability for all our needs.

PPSC is the acronym for the whole HP Procurement team and concerns the supply chain inbound.

Main Responsibilities


Support PPSC Large Format Printing and 3D EMECH team in the development of analysis tools to support Printed Circuit Assembly industrialization, design, and production.
Focus in the spend analytics, tracking and impact analysis for the various Manufacturer Partners.
Help the PPSC senior engineers with the different guidelines to be developed, maintained and communication WITH R&D and Operations Communities.
Be part of the PPSC electronics team, working closely to RD and operations to optimize Electronics design in terms of EE components selection, and cost analysis
Develop the data analysis layer for tracking Quality Data to improve industrialization activities, test coverage and faster TAT for corrective actions.


What are we looking for?


Fourth-year student, as well as master‚Äôs, currently enrolled in electronics or industrial engineering. Other related disciplines may be acceptable, depending on the technical knowledge. Academic agreement is required. Interest in Data Mining and Big Data would be a plus.
Tools needed: MS Office (PowerPoint, Excel, etc.), Power BI. Knowledge in coding would be a plus.
Strong data analytics and reporting skills: ability to analyze data and interpret it accurately to get conclusions.
Proactive, curious, and dynamic personality: Capacity and eagerness to learn quickly new tools, processes, methods, etc.
Autonomous and self-sufficient person: availability to work on your own and take risks on decisions and new solutions that need to be created.
Fluent in English.


Experience Our Benefits

Being part of HP means access to an international community with lots of growth opportunities within the company, professional development resources, networking opportunities, while enjoying in a great atmosphere making an impact.


You will be able to choose to either work office-based or hybrid work style.
Flexible schedule for part time (4h/day) or full time (8h/day) for a 3 to12 months agreement.
Lunch in the cafeteria.
Love sports? Then take advantage of our sports center (indoor and outdoor); gym, squash courts, tennis courts, basketball courts and with 25+ regular coordinated activities / sports , such as HIIT training, squash,‚ÄØbasketball and yoga.
A Young employee Network (YEN) which host fun events on a regular basis, such as ‚Äúbeer bust‚Äù Fridays at different venues including the beach in the summertime.
We have an onsite Doctor and medical team for our employees, including services such as: nutrition, physiotherapy and general health.
Free printing Happy hour ‚Äì from photographs to large posters. And Hands-on‚ÄØworkshops‚ÄØto print with the latest technology ‚Äì from wall covers to 3D printed models.


Sounds like you? Please apply and let‚Äôs talk!

Title: Transport Master Data Analyst
Description:
Master Data Analyst (Transport)

Master Data Analyst would be part of a team, in charge of transport MD process, running enrichment processes and maintenance of master data for Coty worldwide on a global SAP platform.

Responsibilities

You would be responsible for ensuring that the Transport Master Data is created on time and accurate as per briefing from Logistics/Transport department. You are following the Global Data Standards provided by our Data Governance Team and contributing to adjust them to changing needs. As Coty‚Äôs growth builds on constant new product developments, this position plays a key role delivering ‚ÄúData Readiness‚Äù during different stages of the Innovation and leading the work across.

Your main focus:


Coordination of the daily Transport Master Data communications
Daily Transport Master Data alignment with the 4PL (new lanes, lane changes, new locations, location terminations and Data alignment)
Data gathering, alignment and validation with source data owners for creation and maintenance of lanes in the Transportation master data database (SAP cloud-BTP)
Data requests to source data owner to ensure transport master data availability
Reporting on lane data to several internal parties
Support on reporting improvements
Follow up on Data quality topics
Deliver Key Performance Indicators, making sure to reach the Service Level Agreement targets.
Root cause and log.


Working for Coty means being part of one of the largest beauty companies with an iconic portfolio of brands across fragrance, color cosmetics, skin care and body care. We are a global leader in fragrance and number three in color cosmetics and our products are sold in over 150 countries around the world. COTY and its brands are committed to a range of social causes, embraces diversity as well as seeking to minimize its impact on the environment. You can work in a truly international and dynamic work environment, in a culture based on trust and cooperation with opportunities of continues improvement and learning with the freedom to be yourself.

The team consists today of nine Master Data Analyst. You will work closely together with several departments such as Master Data Governance, Initiative leaders, Logistics, Planning, etc. All your colleagues are dedicated experts and ready to drive Coty to the next level. Working with a team environment with can do attitude, optimistic, focus on finding solutions. The team has a continuous improvement mindset, committed to resolving upcoming challenges and opportunities, to make processes more efficient. Master data community main characteristics are team spirit, collaboration and working together cohesively toward common goals. They willingly share knowledge and resources, help when needed, and celebrate each other's successes.

YOU ARE A COTY FIT

You like to focus on the results and be able to react to the business‚Äôs need with sensibility. As a/an experienced Master Data Analyst, you collaborate and work together with other teams, and you get energy from working in a fast-paced, diverse, and international environment.

Other than that, you:


Bachelor‚Äôs degree (Engineering, BA and/or similar academic background).
Good technical skills in Excel and SAP. Knowledge in Microsoft Access, Visual Basic will be considered.
Root Cause Analysis (RCA) mentality, with ability to propose and deliver improvements.
Team Player mindset.
Strong sense of individual accountability ‚Äì personal drive to improve and passionate ownership of performance.
Autonomous motivation to implement changes and challenge the current process / system to deliver improved results.
Good English level and communication skills.


Our Benefits

As our Master Data Analyst some of the benefits you will receive are:


A salary that matches your knowledge and experience
Omni-Working: Hybrid flexible working model enabling employees to balance remote and office-based work and promote work / life balance.
Flexible working hours
Meal voucher
Medical & Physiotherapy Service


RECRUITMENT PROCESS


A telephone/online introductory meeting.
A first online/in-person interview
A second interview
You will receive a proposal with the terms of employment.


About Coty

Coty is one of the world‚Äôs largest beauty companies with an iconic portfolio of brands across fragrance, color cosmetics, skincare, and body care. At Coty, we celebrate the entire human kaleidoscope and cultivate a culture of fearless kindness. Therefore, we are proud to be an equal opportunities employer. We do not discriminate against any candidate or employee and strive to be an open, inclusive and diverse workplace where all employees can be their authentic self. Join us in making over the world of beauty!

We do not discriminate against any candidate or employee and strive to be an open, inclusive and diverse workplace where all employees can be their authentic self. Join us in making over the world of beauty!

Title: Sr. Data Analyst
Description:
Job Requisition ID #

25WD88843

Position Overview

Data is central to measuring all aspects of our business and critical to our growth. We‚Äôre looking for someone to join Autodesk‚Äôs Product Development & Manufacturing Services organization as a Sr. Data Analyst.

Collaborate with business partners across Finance, Sales, Marketing and Product as a key member of our analytics team.

As a motivated self-starter you will be able to work in a fast paced, ambiguous environment. Proven attention to detail and an extensive eye for business will allow you to work efficiently with business partners across Finance, Sales, Product and Marketing to build business narratives and metrics for success. Additionally, you will define and test hypotheses, and deliver practical insights through data visualizations. You will succeed by having an eye on the big picture and challenge the status quo. Ask the hard questions to ensure investment of time and resources is warranted.

Responsibilities


Design and instrument key performance metrics, in partnership with the business growth and strategy teams. Deliver weekly and quarterly analysis of leading indicators and results
Define data model requirements that are scalable and focus on immediate business outcomes and results
Build self-serve tools and advanced visualizations that democratize access to data insights
Conduct in-depth ecosystem analyses that tell the story of what happened and how to improve
Improve internal process and stakeholder documentation guides


Minimum Qualifications


5+ years industry experience in data analytics / data visualization role, including 3+ years experience communicating analytical findings to executives. Experience includes metric dashboarding, storytelling, and presentation skills, and making recommendations based on data backed insights
Mastery of SQL in a cloud data warehouse environment
Mastery of data visualization software and design skills (PowerBI required; Looker or Tableau is a bonus)
Experience with data pipelines, ETL processes and a demonstrable understanding of database design principles (e.g. GitHub, DBT, Airflow, etc.)
Reporting experience across Sales, Marketing and Product (e.g. Salesforce, Marketo, Amplitude, etc.)
Degree in quantitative field or equivalent experience


Preferred Qualifications


Familiarity with product analytics, clickstream datasets, or UX-related framework and tools


#AC-1

Learn More

About Autodesk

Welcome to Autodesk! Amazing things are created every day with our software ‚Äì from the greenest buildings and cleanest cars to the smartest factories and biggest hit movies. We help innovators turn their ideas into reality, transforming not only how things are made, but what can be made.

We take great pride in our culture here at Autodesk ‚Äì it‚Äôs at the core of everything we do. Our culture guides the way we work and treat each other, informs how we connect with customers and partners, and defines how we show up in the world.

When you‚Äôre an Autodesker, you can do meaningful work that helps build a better world designed and made for all. Ready to shape the world and your future? Join us!

Salary transparency

Salary is one part of Autodesk‚Äôs competitive compensation package. Offers are based on the candidate‚Äôs experience and geographic location. In addition to base salaries, our compensation package may include annual cash bonuses, commissions for sales roles, stock grants, and a comprehensive benefits package.

Diversity & Belonging

We take pride in cultivating a culture of belonging where everyone can thrive. Learn more here: https://www.autodesk.com/company/diversity-and-belonging

Title: Data Analyst - Business Performance Analytics
Description:
This job is with Criteo, an inclusive employer and a member of myGwork ‚Äì the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community. Please do not contact the recruiter directly.

What You'll Do

As part of the Business Performance Analytics (BPAX) team within Sales Strategy, your primary mission will be to deliver robust, intuitive, and actionable business insights that empower Criteo's CRO and Commercial leaders to shape and drive the company's commercial strategy.

You will apply a data-driven approach to uncover insights and explain business performance. This role involves working with large and complex datasets, requiring strong analytical curiosity, creativity in data exploration, and the ability to synthesize findings into a compelling narrative that supports strategic decision-making.

Your Mission


Build advanced analytical views to decode and communicate global performance patterns
Perform in-depth competitive analyses, measuring the business impact of competitors' activities across key markets
Leverage external and internal data to understand client behavior, identify high-value client clusters (e.g., through CLTV studies), and qualify the potential of clients and prospects across new and existing business areas
Size business growth opportunities and risks, and translating findings into actionable recommendations for multiple levels of stakeholders


Who You Are


2-3 years of experience in a similar analytics role (experience in AdTech is a plus)
A Bachelor's degree or higher in a quantitative field (e.g., Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, or Business)
Strong analytical skills and intellectual curiosity, with the ability to structure and solve complex problems
Solid understanding of statistical modeling and data interpretation
Hands-on experience with SQL for data manipulation and extraction
Proficiency in Python for data analysis
Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Power BI and/or Tableau
Strong presentation skills (including PowerPoint), with the ability to translate complex data into clear business insights and actionable recommendations
Business acumen and the ability to act as a trusted advisor to commercial stakeholders
Excellent communication skills and fluency in English
A proactive, autonomous mindset, with the ability to manage multiple projects, set milestones, coordinate with cross-functional teams, and drive initiatives forward


We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we'd love to see your application!

Who We Are

Criteo is a leader in commerce media, helping brands, agencies, and publishers create meaningful consumer connections through AI-powered advertising solutions. We're shaping a more open and sustainable digital future for advertising.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices across the globe or from the comfort of home, our 3,600 Criteos collaborate together to build an open, impactful, and forward-thinking environment.

We foster a workplace where everyone is valued, and employment decisions are based solely on skills, qualifications, and business needs-never on non-job-related factors or legally protected characteristics.

What We Offer

üè† Own your work style - Build your work around your life and not the other way around.

üìà Grow with us - Learning, mentorship & career development programs.

üí™ Your wellbeing matters - Health benefits, wellness perks & mental health support.

ü§ù A team that cares - Diverse, inclusive, and globally connected.

üí∏ Fair pay & perks - Competitive salary, equity, performance-based rewards and family-friendly policies.

Additional benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Techsoulogy is our way of doing things and our corporate brand that unifies a broad portfolio of specialist advertising, media, and entertainment firms. It combines the latest technology with a human-first approach and a constant exploration of knowledge in order to shape the media landscape.

At Techsoulogy we aim to provide a technology and human service that guarantee all areas of the advertising industry throughout the world achieving their goals profitably, effectively and ethically.

Our values drive our culture, which is the most important asset of our company.


We're fair
We're dedicated
We're honest
We're courageous
We're Team lovers


TAPPX with Techsoulogy

Tappx is a fast-growth AdTech company inside the Techsoulogy family. It delivers digital advertising solutions for multiple platforms including mobile, OTT/CTV and desktop.

Tappx‚Äô proprietary technology empowers publishers to maximize ad revenues across mobile and OTT channels. It offers a distinct point of difference, technology which has been specifically engineered for mobile and OTT markets, thereby offering brands and agencies increased trust and transparency.

Tappx has headlined across numerous high profile competitive growth rankings such as Red Herring in 2016, TECH5 in 2018 and in 2020 Tappx was featured as Europe‚Äôs 2nd fastest growing advertising company in The Financial Times FT1000.

In Tappx we keep growing and, therefore, we are looking for new talented people to join our Data team in our IT department.

Your mission will be:


Manage, analyze, and exploit large volumes of data to create predictive models and provide insights and strategic recommendations that support decision-making at the enterprise level.
Identify trends, search for behavior patterns, and build models that enable different lines of business to build new algorithms and optimize costs and margins.
Implement and optimize reporting solutions through programming and business intelligence (BI) tools such as Looker Studio.


And, as a Senior Data Analyst your main tasks will be:


Advanced data analysis: Accurately and reliably explore, clean, and transform large volumes of structured and unstructured data from different sources to discover key patterns and insights that will drive our business strategy.
Dashboard and report development: Design and create clear, interactive visualizations that enable business teams (suitable for all audiences) to easily understand performance and trends, as well as new findings that can be transformed into new business projects.
Modeling and prediction: Develop statistical and machine learning models to predict customer behavior, optimize processes, reduce costs, anticipate market trends, and even detect anomalies in the data.
Process Optimization: Develop and maintain efficient data pipelines that facilitate the automation of analysis and reporting.
Team Collaboration: Work closely with other departments (such as marketing, product, and technology) to understand business needs and provide data-driven solutions.
Communication of results: Present findings clearly and concisely to stakeholders and internal teams, translating complex data into actionable business recommendations.
Research and Continuous Improvement: Keep up to date with the latest trends and technologies in the field of data science, implementing improvements when necessary.
Think collaboratively about how to keep the costs associated with the Data team in check so that they remain affordable.
I+D: We have products with different AIs that are currently on standby, such as data contextualization, video analysis, object detection, etc. If they are reactivated in the future, you will be responsible for these services.


Your Dream Job Awaits at Techsoulogy! üöÄ

üìÑ Indefinite Contract with Competitive Conditions

‚è∞Flexible Working Hours (Take Control of Your Schedule) with core time

üè¢ Hybrid Model in Barcelona (1 day in the office and the rest teleworking) or 100% Remote Work Anywhere in Spain

üèô Cool HQ Offices in Barcelona and Co-Working in Madrid

Elevate Your Work Experience with Techsoulogy! üåü

üè• Private Health Insurance

üß† Mental Health Care with 20 Free Hours of Psychologist Support

üó£ 1&1 English or Spanish Language Lessons

üìö Continuous Training & Development Budget

ü•ó Healthy Snacks, Coffee and (a lot of) Tea (HQ)

üéÆ Fun-Filled Arcade Room (HQ)

üéâ Team Building Activities

üé§ Inspiring Internal Talks and Events

üéÅ Interesting Employee Referral Program

üå± Engage in Techsoulogy‚Äôs CSR Initiatives

üí≥ Flexible Compensation for Transport, Meals, and Kindergartens

Ready to shape your future? Join us! üöÄ

#Techsoulogy #CareerPerks #JoinUsNow #WorkPerks #CareerGrowth

Requirements:

We are looking for if you:


Demonstrable experience: At least 4 years of professional experience in Data Science, Data Analysis, or related areas.
Experience in preparing, managing, and analyzing large volumes of data in complex environments and from different data sources.
Experience in developing machine learning models, both supervised and unsupervised.
Programming: Work with tools such as Python (pandas, scikit-learn, etc.), R, and SQL.
Databases: Experience with relational and NoSQL databases (e.g., MongoDB, Hadoop, Spark).
Visualization tools: Familiarity with data visualization tools such as LookerStudio, Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
AI: Experience in implementing AI solutions is a plus.


Desirable:


Autonomy and proactivity: Ability to manage projects from start to finish, take initiative, and propose new areas of analysis without the need for constant supervision.
Analytical thinking: Ability to ask the right questions and break down complex problems into logical steps.
Excellent communication skills: Ability to explain technical concepts to a non-technical audience and build trust through your analysis and recommendations.
Problem solving: Ability to analyze and solve problems
Results-oriented: Ability to obtain results and conclusions; we don't want analyses to remain on paper, we want you to always go the extra mile.
Education: University degree in a quantitative field such as Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, or similar.
Desirable: Familiarity with PHP, MySQL, Java, and GCP is desirable.

HTML:
Techsoulogy is our way of doing things and our corporate brand that unifies a broad portfolio of specialist advertising, media, and entertainment firms. It combines the latest technology with a human-first approach and a constant exploration of knowledge in order to shape the media landscape.

At Techsoulogy we aim to provide a technology and human service that guarantee all areas of the advertising industry throughout the world achieving their goals profitably, effectively and ethically.

Our values drive our culture, which is the most important asset of our company.

  • We're fair
  • We're dedicated
  • We're honest
  • We're courageous
  • We're Team lovers

TAPPX with Techsoulogy

Tappx is a fast-growth AdTech company inside the Techsoulogy family. It delivers digital advertising solutions for multiple platforms including mobile, OTT/CTV and desktop.

Tappx‚Äô proprietary technology empowers publishers to maximize ad revenues across mobile and OTT channels. It offers a distinct point of difference, technology which has been specifically engineered for mobile and OTT markets, thereby offering brands and agencies increased trust and transparency.

Tappx has headlined across numerous high profile competitive growth rankings such as Red Herring in 2016, TECH5 in 2018 and in 2020 Tappx was featured as Europe‚Äôs 2nd fastest growing advertising company in The Financial Times FT1000.

In Tappx we keep growing and, therefore, we are looking for new talented people to join our Data team in our IT department.

Your mission will be:

  • Manage, analyze, and exploit large volumes of data to create predictive models and provide insights and strategic recommendations that support decision-making at the enterprise level.
  • Identify trends, search for behavior patterns, and build models that enable different lines of business to build new algorithms and optimize costs and margins.
  • Implement and optimize reporting solutions through programming and business intelligence (BI) tools such as Looker Studio.

And, as a Senior Data Analyst your main tasks will be:

  • Advanced data analysis: Accurately and reliably explore, clean, and transform large volumes of structured and unstructured data from different sources to discover key patterns and insights that will drive our business strategy.
  • Dashboard and report development: Design and create clear, interactive visualizations that enable business teams (suitable for all audiences) to easily understand performance and trends, as well as new findings that can be transformed into new business projects.
  • Modeling and prediction: Develop statistical and machine learning models to predict customer behavior, optimize processes, reduce costs, anticipate market trends, and even detect anomalies in the data.
  • Process Optimization: Develop and maintain efficient data pipelines that facilitate the automation of analysis and reporting.
  • Team Collaboration: Work closely with other departments (such as marketing, product, and technology) to understand business needs and provide data-driven solutions.
  • Communication of results: Present findings clearly and concisely to stakeholders and internal teams, translating complex data into actionable business recommendations.
  • Research and Continuous Improvement: Keep up to date with the latest trends and technologies in the field of data science, implementing improvements when necessary.
  • Think collaboratively about how to keep the costs associated with the Data team in check so that they remain affordable.
  • I+D: We have products with different AIs that are currently on standby, such as data contextualization, video analysis, object detection, etc. If they are reactivated in the future, you will be responsible for these services.

Your Dream Job Awaits at Techsoulogy! üöÄ

üìÑ Indefinite Contract with Competitive Conditions

‚è∞Flexible Working Hours (Take Control of Your Schedule) with core time

üè¢ Hybrid Model in Barcelona (1 day in the office and the rest teleworking) or 100% Remote Work Anywhere in Spain

üèô Cool HQ Offices in Barcelona and Co-Working in Madrid

Elevate Your Work Experience with Techsoulogy! üåü

üè• Private Health Insurance

üß† Mental Health Care with 20 Free Hours of Psychologist Support

üó£ 1&1 English or Spanish Language Lessons

üìö Continuous Training & Development Budget

ü•ó Healthy Snacks, Coffee and (a lot of) Tea (HQ)

üéÆ Fun-Filled Arcade Room (HQ)

üéâ Team Building Activities

üé§ Inspiring Internal Talks and Events

üéÅ Interesting Employee Referral Program

üå± Engage in Techsoulogy‚Äôs CSR Initiatives

üí≥ Flexible Compensation for Transport, Meals, and Kindergartens

Ready to shape your future? Join us! üöÄ

#Techsoulogy #CareerPerks #JoinUsNow #WorkPerks #CareerGrowth

Requirements:

We are looking for if you:

  • Demonstrable experience: At least 4 years of professional experience in Data Science, Data Analysis, or related areas.
  • Experience in preparing, managing, and analyzing large volumes of data in complex environments and from different data sources.
  • Experience in developing machine learning models, both supervised and unsupervised.
  • Programming: Work with tools such as Python (pandas, scikit-learn, etc.), R, and SQL.
  • Databases: Experience with relational and NoSQL databases (e.g., MongoDB, Hadoop, Spark).
  • Visualization tools: Familiarity with data visualization tools such as LookerStudio, Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
  • AI: Experience in implementing AI solutions is a plus.

Desirable:

  • Autonomy and proactivity: Ability to manage projects from start to finish, take initiative, and propose new areas of analysis without the need for constant supervision.
  • Analytical thinking: Ability to ask the right questions and break down complex problems into logical steps.
  • Excellent communication skills: Ability to explain technical concepts to a non-technical audience and build trust through your analysis and recommendations.
  • Problem solving: Ability to analyze and solve problems
  • Results-oriented: Ability to obtain results and conclusions; we don't want analyses to remain on paper, we want you to always go the extra mile.
  • Education: University degree in a quantitative field such as Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, or similar.
  • Desirable: Familiarity with PHP, MySQL, Java, and GCP is desirable.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
About Kiwi.com

Kiwi.com is a leading global travel-tech company headquartered in the Czech Republic. Our innovative algorithm enables users to find better route options and prices other search engines can‚Äôt see, daily performing billions of price checks across 95% of global flight content. Are you bold, bright and curious? Join a global business that‚Äôs still got a start-up heart.

About Our Content Analytics Team

Our team is responsible for providing data-centric insights that enable the optimization of our flight content acquisition and processing. We use extensive datasets to support booking channel performance, improve autobooking efficiency and ensure data quality across our systems. Our work directly impacts Kiwi.com 's ability to offer our customers unique travel combinations and a smooth booking experience worldwide. We combine technical expertise with business understanding to build data-informed recommendations across multiple teams and stakeholders.

What You Will Do


You will conduct complex ad-hoc analysis using BigQuery and Looker, delivering insights that support thoughtful decision-making.
By creating and maintaining dashboards for key business metrics, you will help make data accessible and meaningful for stakeholders.
You will work with Looker's analytical layer, defining explores, measures and dimensions to support robust data exploration.
You will collaborate on building data models and support data quality through rigorous QA processes in collaboration with our data engineers.
You will evaluate and improve our complex flight booking and data acquisition systems, identifying opportunities for optimization.
You‚Äôll create data-informed recommendations by sharing practical insights with our flight content ecosystem.
You will help develop monitoring and alerting tools for product operations, enabling proactive incident detection and prevention.


What You Will Need


Your strong SQL skills and experience with BigQuery or similar data warehouses.
You have experience with BI tools (we use Looker) and a solid understanding of data modeling and data quality standards.
You can translate complex analytical findings into actionable insights that drive results.
You bring experience working with large datasets and collaborating with multiple stakeholders across teams.
Your excellent communication skills in English enable you to explain complex concepts to non-technical audiences.
You have an analytical mindset with a strong attention to detail, ensuring accuracy and precision in your work.
You are capable of working independently while aligning with and contributing to team goals.


We offer you


We offer a hybrid and flexible work environment. A lovely, modern office in the center of Barcelona (Passeig de Gracia) with great views and amenities.
Monthly entitlement of 200 Euro redeemable through Cobee. Cobee is a benefits platform offering a range of benefits (meals, transport, nursery, health insurance, and physical wellness) and flexible compensation. It also allows our employees to allocate up to 30% of their gross salary to the consumption of certain products or services, leveraging tax exemption.
We also enjoy benefits, such as flexible working hours, 30 paid vacation days and sick days.
Annual financial bonus based on company and individual performance.
Flight vouchers to celebrate your Kiwi anniversaries.
Relocation package (including visa transfer support).
Dogs are welcome in our offices.


Interested? Join us and help us make travel more accessible to all.

Kiwi.com is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and employer. We review applications for employment without regard to their race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, uniformed services, genetic information, physical or mental disability, medical condition, marital status, or any other basis prohibited by law.

Throughout the recruitment process and for some time after it‚Äôs finished, we‚Äôre going to process your Personal Data. You can find all the necessary information in our Privacy Policy available at: https://jobs.kiwi.com/recruitment-privacy-policy/ .

Title: Data Internship Program (They/She/He)
Description:
If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 23 countries.

Together we revolutionize the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

ü§ù Our strong culture and non-vanilla personality.

üí™ A Talent House.

ü§ù Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. Our vision is ambitious, for that we need driven talent! And this is where your ride starts‚Ä¶

YOUR MISSION

You will join one of our cross-functional teams in the Data department in Barcelona, where you will learn from top Analytics Engineers, Product Data Scientists, and Data Analysts and collaborate with Business and Product stakeholders. You will work on end-to-end data solutions that drive business impact! During this internship, you will have the opportunity to work on cutting-edge data projects, learn about advanced analytics, and develop data modeling, visualization, statistics, and automation skills.

THE JOURNEY


Develop Data-Driven Insights: Learn how to analyze and interpret data to provide valuable insights that contribute to decision-making across different business areas.
Collaborate Across Teams: Work closely with product, engineering, and operations teams to understand their data needs and help translate them into meaningful solutions.
Enhance Your Technical Skills: Gain hands-on experience with data modeling, statistical analysis, and visualization tools, while following industry best practices.
Support Key Business Metrics: Help monitor, analyze, and optimize business and product and operational metrics, making data more accessible and actionable.
Experiment & Innovate: Engage in exploratory analyses, hypothesis testing, and experimentation to improve products and business strategies.
Improve Data Quality: Assist in building and maintaining data pipelines, ensuring data accuracy, consistency, and reliability.
Communicate Findings Effectively: Develop storytelling and visualization skills to present complex data in a clear and impactful way for diverse stakeholders.
Stay Curious & Keep Learning: Continuously explore new data methodologies, technologies, and industry trends to expand your knowledge and skills.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


Your eagerness and enthusiasm to start a journey in the data industry and embrace new challenges!
Effective Communication (English)
You're currently on an exciting STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math) journey.
Strong Computer Science and Data Analytics knowledge.
Knowledge of SQL, Python, or other data-related programming languages.
Problem-Solving Acumen and a proactive approach to innovation.
Willingness to learn and adapt to various data roles.
Cross-Cultural Awareness - appreciation of diverse perspectives.
You are available for a 6-month full-time internship.


DATA INTERNSHIP OPPORTUNITIES We offer internships in three key data roles:

Data Analysts: Specialists in descriptive and diagnostic analytics, DAs excel in data visualization and storytelling, transforming raw data into actionable insights. They communicate trends effectively and enable teams across the company to make data-driven decisions. DAs also automate decision-making processes using Python scripting.

Analytics Engineers: Driving our strong data foundation, AEs are experts in data modeling and creating scalable data pipelines. They understand business challenges, build efficient ETL processes, and generalize use cases into common data models. Their work extends to data visualization, ensuring end-users can leverage insights effectively.

Product Data Scientists: These DSs go beyond descriptive analytics to specialize in prescriptive analysis and modeling. With a strong product mindset, they ensure their analyses are statistically rigorous and apply their expertise to complex business challenges. By navigating the discovery > hypothesis generation > testing > analysis loop, they optimize decision-making processes across the organization while tackling standardized data science problems.

If you're passionate about data and ready to make an impact, join us on this exciting journey!

Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves


üçî Monthly Glovo credits to satisfy your cravings!
üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Title: Associate Game Data Analyst / Scientist / Economist
Description:
The Opportunity:

We are seeking hardworking and data-driven individuals to join our growing data teams in Barcelona. This role offers the chance to initiate your data career and gain experience across a variety of data departments:
Data Analytics
Data Science
Game Economy
The offer includes a full-time training program covering analytics, data science, and economics, including both the soft and hard skills required by these roles.

Potential Focus Areas & Key Responsibilities:

As a Game Data Analyst / Scientist / Economist, your responsibilities will vary based on your specialization and the team's current needs. Potential areas of focus include:
Player Behavior Analysis & Insights:
Analyze player behavior, engagement patterns, and user experience data using statistical techniques, machine learning, and exploratory data analysis.
Identify trends, uncover user segments, and provide actionable insights to optimize existing features and inform new game development.
Develop and monitor critical metrics related to player engagement, retention, and monetization.






Game Economy Design & Management:
Design, configure, monitor, and optimize the economy of game features and events, including defining pricing for purchasable items and collectibles.
Provide economic insights to product and game operations teams to encourage growth and **improve** player experience.
Share game economy standard methodologies and knowledge across the company.






Data Science & Analytical Solutions:
Develop and implement analytical techniques, statistical models, causal inference, or machine learning models to answer complicated business questions and address exciting problems.
Develop simulations of player behavior to improve game design and feature development.
Collaborate with data engineering to implement in-game tracking and build end-to-end data pipelines.







Regardless of focus, you will be encouraged to:
Work closely with game teams to support their day-to-day data needs and the wider Product Madness community.
Investigate arising in-game issues and data anomalies.
Communicate results clearly and efficiently to varied audiences.
Qualifications:

Required Skills and Qualifications:
Academic Background: A degree or equivalent work experience in a quantitative field, including but not limited to:
Economics
Statistics
Mathematics
Computer Engineering / Computer Science
Data Science
Finance
Sciences (especially Physics)
Other fields with a strong quantitative aspect.
Analytical Prowess: Passion for quantitative analysis, with the ability to interpret data, generate actionable business insights, and translate complex problems into clear recommendations. Experience in understanding context and looking after ambiguous requirements.








Technical Skills:
Excel skills
Basic understanding of statistics
Confirmed Experience (Preferred): Curiosity about the mobile games industry.
Communication & Collaboration: Good communication skills, capable of presenting insights and ideas clearly to various audiences. Ability to work collaboratively with individuals and teams, and reach out for help and support.
Pro activeness & Learning: Intuitive and proactive with regards to data interpretation. Eagerness to learn new skills and explore different approaches, whether it is in collaborating, communicating, or data analysis.
Meriting Skills:
Proficient in English both written and Verbal
An advanced degree or equivalent experience in Economics, Finance, Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics, or a related field.
Experience with machine learning model development.
Experience in econometrics, causal inference, or simulation modeling (e.g., Monte-Carlo modeling).
Experience with data processing / data-heavy research projects.
Experience coding in SQL, Python, and/or R.


Why Product Madness?

As part of the Aristocrat family, we share their mission of bringing joy to life through the power of play, with a world-class team who creates top-grossing, leading titles in the social casino genre, including Heart of Vegas, Lightning Link, Cashman Casino. With 800 team members across the globe, Product Madness is headquartered in London, with offices in Barcelona, Gda≈Ñsk, Lviv, Montreal and a remote team spanning the USA, making us a truly global powerhouse.

We live by our People First principle. Regardless of where, when, or how they work, our team members have opportunities to elevate their careers, and grow alongside us. We take pride in fostering an inclusive culture, where our people are encouraged to be their very best, every day. But don‚Äôt just take our word for it. In 2024, we made the Global Inspiring Workplace Awards list, and won a bronze award at the Stevies for Great Employers in the ‚ÄòEmployer of the Year - Media and Entertainment‚Äô category.

So, what‚Äôs stopping you?

Travel Expectations

None

Additional Information

At this time, we are unable to sponsor work visas for this position. Candidates must be authorized to work in the job posting location for this position on a full-time basis without the need for current or future visa sponsorship.

  • Work closely with game teams to support their day-to-day data needs and the wider Product Madness community.
  • Investigate arising in-game issues and data anomalies.
  • Communicate results clearly and efficiently to varied audiences.
Qualifications:

Required Skills and Qualifications:
  • Academic Background: A degree or equivalent work experience in a quantitative field, including but not limited to:
    • Economics
    • Statistics
    • Mathematics
    • Computer Engineering / Computer Science
    • Data Science
    • Finance
    • Sciences (especially Physics)
    • Other fields with a strong quantitative aspect.
    • Analytical Prowess: Passion for quantitative analysis, with the ability to interpret data, generate actionable business insights, and translate complex problems into clear recommendations. Experience in understanding context and looking after ambiguous requirements.







  • Technical Skills:
    • Excel skills
    • Basic understanding of statistics
    • Confirmed Experience (Preferred): Curiosity about the mobile games industry.
    • Communication & Collaboration: Good communication skills, capable of presenting insights and ideas clearly to various audiences. Ability to work collaboratively with individuals and teams, and reach out for help and support.
    • Pro activeness & Learning: Intuitive and proactive with regards to data interpretation. Eagerness to learn new skills and explore different approaches, whether it is in collaborating, communicating, or data analysis.
    Meriting Skills:
    • Proficient in English both written and Verbal
    • An advanced degree or equivalent experience in Economics, Finance, Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics, or a related field.
    • Experience with machine learning model development.
    • Experience in econometrics, causal inference, or simulation modeling (e.g., Monte-Carlo modeling).
    • Experience with data processing / data-heavy research projects.
    • Experience coding in SQL, Python, and/or R.

    Why Product Madness?

    As part of the Aristocrat family, we share their mission of bringing joy to life through the power of play, with a world-class team who creates top-grossing, leading titles in the social casino genre, including Heart of Vegas, Lightning Link, Cashman Casino. With 800 team members across the globe, Product Madness is headquartered in London, with offices in Barcelona, Gda≈Ñsk, Lviv, Montreal and a remote team spanning the USA, making us a truly global powerhouse.

    We live by our People First principle. Regardless of where, when, or how they work, our team members have opportunities to elevate their careers, and grow alongside us. We take pride in fostering an inclusive culture, where our people are encouraged to be their very best, every day. But don‚Äôt just take our word for it. In 2024, we made the Global Inspiring Workplace Awards list, and won a bronze award at the Stevies for Great Employers in the ‚ÄòEmployer of the Year - Media and Entertainment‚Äô category.

    So, what‚Äôs stopping you?

    Travel Expectations

    None

    Additional Information

    At this time, we are unable to sponsor work visas for this position. Candidates must be authorized to work in the job posting location for this position on a full-time basis without the need for current or future visa sponsorship.

Title: Data Strategist
Description:

Ayudamos a nuestros clientes a ser l√≠deres.

No se trata solo de manejar herramientas o informes, sino de convertir los datos en ideas, oportunidades y recomendaciones estrat√©gicas para todas las √°reas de la agencia: creatividad, social, CRM, experiencia digital, etc.

Responsabilidades

Traducir los datos en narrativas estrat√©gicas que aporten valor a propuestas creativas, estrategias de medios, UX y campa√±as de fidelizaci√≥n.
Trabajar en equipo con planners, creativ@s, especialistas de diferentes √°reas como CRM y digital para integrar la visi√≥n data-driven a lo largo de todo el proceso.
Automatizar proceso de extracci√≥n y an√°lisis de datos y creaci√≥n de dashboards
Identificar patrones de comportamiento, oportunidades de negocio y tensiones culturales que puedan inspirar nuevas ideas.

Mantenerse al d√≠a en herramientas, tendencias en anal√≠tica, inteligencia artificial y todo lo que pueda surgir.

Experiencia de al menos 4 a√±os en roles de an√°lisis de datos, consultor√≠a estrat√©gica o planning, preferentemente en agencias de medios, creativas o digitales.
Dominio de herramientas de an√°lisis y visualizaci√≥n como Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, Looker Studio, Tableau, Power BI, etc.
Experiencia en plataformas de escucha social, CRM, an√°lisis de campa√±as multicanal y Social Media (Tagger, Emplifi, Meta Business Suite, YouTube Studio, etc.), con mentalidad estrat√©gica y anal√≠tica para analizar tanto lo org√°nico como lo paid.
Capacidad para pensar de forma anal√≠tica y creativa, con enfoque en storytelling basado en datos.
Habilidades de comunicaci√≥n y colaboraci√≥n, con capacidad de influir en perfiles no t√©cnicos.
Curiosidad por las marcas, la cultura, el comportamiento de las personas y la innovaci√≥n.
Ganas de trabajar en equipos transversales y multidisciplinares.
Nivel alto de espa√±ol e ingl√©s (m√≠nimo B2).
Se valora experiencia previa en automotive o mundo del motor
En nuestro equipo tendr√°s:
Participaci√≥n en proyectos integrales para marcas l√≠deres, en un entorno creativo y colaborativo.
Cultura de equipo basada en la curiosidad, el aprendizaje continuo y la ambici√≥n estrat√©gica.
Flexibilidad, oportunidades de crecimiento y trabajo con perfiles multidisciplinares.

Title: Data Analyst II Rider Experience (They/She/He) - HQ
Description:
If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 23 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

ü§ù Our culture and strong values.

üí™ Our career development philosophy.

ü§ù Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: Building the largest marketplace in your city, to give access to anything in minutes. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

We are seeking a highly motivated and analytical Rider Experience Analyst to join our Rider Experience team. In this role, you will play a key role in shaping the loyalty strategy for our riders. You‚Äôll be responsible for analyzing the performance of our loyalty program, designing data-driven strategies to increase engagement and retention, and optimizing initiatives that drive riders satisfaction and frequency.

THE JOURNEY


Data Analysis: Collect, analyze, and interpret rider experience data, including feedback, performance metrics, and operational data, to identify trends, issues, and opportunities for improvement.
Insights & Reporting: Develop comprehensive reports and dashboards that communicate key rider experience metrics and insights to stakeholders.
Cross-functional Collaboration: Work closely with operations and product teams to implement initiatives that enhance the rider experience.
Program Optimization: Define and continuously refine tier thresholds based on behavioral data, operational impact, and business goals.
Strategy & Engagement: Design and monitor quests, missions, and challenges aimed at increasing frequency, loyalty, and overall engagement.
Benchmarking: Research industry best practices and competitor strategies related to rider experience to identify new opportunities.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


Bachelor's degree in Business, Data Analytics, Economics, or a related field.
2+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or a similar analytical role, preferably within the logistics, e-commerce, or gig economy sectors.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Proficiency in data analysis tools (e.g., Excel, SQL, Python/R for data analysis).
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Looker Studio).
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to present complex data and insights clearly and concisely to diverse audiences.
Proactive, self-starter with a strong sense of ownership and accountability.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.


Nice To Have


Experience with rider-facing platforms or applications.
Knowledge of qualitative research methods.
Experience in A/B testing and experimentation.


Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves


üåü An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
üí≥ Discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!
