Title: Consultant analytics - ES
Description:
At Globant, we are working to make the world a better place, one step at a time. We enhance business development and enterprise solutions to prepare them for a digital future. With a diverse and talented team present in more than 30 countries, we are strategic partners to leading global companies in their business process transformation.

We seek a Consultant Analytics ‚Äì Financial Sector who shares our passion for innovation and change. This role is critical to helping our business partners evolve and adapt to consumers' personalized expectations in this new technological era.

What will help you succeed:


Fluent English (B2 - Upper Intermediate)
Solid expertise in Credit Risk and predictive modeling, combining business understanding with advanced analytics to deliver impactful solutions in the financial sector.
Proficiency in Python (or similar languages) and Machine Learning frameworks, capable of developing robust models and working with massive, complex datasets.
Creative, analytical mindset and consulting experience, with the ability to identify opportunities, propose innovative approaches, and lead strategic projects end-to-end.



This job can be filled in Barcelona

Create with us digital products that people love. We will bring businesses and consumers together through AI technology and creativity, driving digital transformation to impact the world positively.

We may use AI and machine learning technologies in our recruitment process. Globant is an Equal Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law. Globant is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please let your recruiter know.

Final compensation offered is based on multiple factors such as the specific role, hiring location, as well as individual skills, experience, and qualifications. In addition to competitive salaries, we offer a comprehensive benefits package. Learn more about life at Globant here: Globant Experience Guide.

Title: Data Science Internship (m/f/d)
Description:
At Fossil, we dare to dream, disrupt, and deliver in a better way. Our goal is simple - bring innovation, style, and connectivity to an industry ripe for change. Fossil is on a mission to revamp the way fashion accessories are done. We are committed to creating great watches, jewelry, handbags, small leather goods and wearables by investing in technology and long-term value creation. With our diverse portfolio of proprietary and licensed brands, along with department stores, specialty stores, eCommerce websites, and company-owned and operated retail stores, we are building a leading fashion- and tech-forward accessories company. Are you in?

We are seeking a Data Science Intern to join our Global Analytics team at Fossil Group in Barcelona. If you are passionate about using data to drive improvements and enjoy enabling the enterprise through data, this could be the perfect role for you. In this dynamic and global company, you will support the organization's efforts to become more data-driven and customer-centric.

Role

What you will do in this role:


Deliver statistical models, segmentation analysis, and customer insights to support key business decisions across marketing, supply chain, and more
Translate large datasets into meaningful and actionable business insights
Apply advanced analytical techniques such as regression models, clustering, predictive modeling, and decision trees
Work with tools such as R, Python, Tableau, and Alteryx
Manipulate and extract data using SQL


Who You Are (Requirements)


Currently enrolled in a Master‚Äôs degree or equivalent in statistics, mathematics, computer science, business analytics, or a related field
1‚Äì2 years of hands-on data analytics experience
Strong skills in advanced analytics methods (e.g., multivariate/logistic regression, clustering, predictive modeling, neural networks, pricing models)
Experience with data analytics tools such as R, Python, Tableau, or Alteryx
Proficient in SQL and data manipulation
Familiarity with large language models (LLMs) is a plus
High level of English proficiency, both spoken and written


We are looking for people who embody our core values; Authenticity, we are all in with our unique selves. Everyone is different at Fossil and we love it! At Fossil, we dare to dream, disrupt, and deliver in a better way. Our goal is simple - bring innovation, style, and connectivity to an industry ripe for change. Fossil is on a mission to revamp the way fashion accessories are done. We are committed to creating great watches, jewelry, handbags, small leather goods and wearables by investing in technology and long-term value creation. With our diverse portfolio of proprietary and licensed brands, along with department stores, specialty stores, eCommerce websites, and company-owned and operated retail stores, we are building a leading fashion- and tech-forward accessories company. Are you in?

We are seeking a Data Science Intern to join our Global Analytics team at Fossil Group in Barcelona. If you are passionate about using data to drive improvements and enjoy enabling the enterprise through data, this could be the perfect role for you. In this dynamic and global company, you will support the organization's efforts to become more data-driven and customer-centric.

Role

 What you will do in this role:

  • Deliver statistical models, segmentation analysis, and customer insights to support key business decisions across marketing, supply chain, and more
  • Translate large datasets into meaningful and actionable business insights
  • Apply advanced analytical techniques such as regression models, clustering, predictive modeling, and decision trees
  • Work with tools such as R, Python, Tableau, and Alteryx
  • Manipulate and extract data using SQL

Who You Are (Requirements)

  • Currently enrolled in a Master‚Äôs degree or equivalent in statistics, mathematics, computer science, business analytics, or a related field
  • 1‚Äì2 years of hands-on data analytics experience
  • Strong skills in advanced analytics methods (e.g., multivariate/logistic regression, clustering, predictive modeling, neural networks, pricing models)
  • Experience with data analytics tools such as R, Python, Tableau, or Alteryx
  • Proficient in SQL and data manipulation
  • Familiarity with large language models (LLMs) is a plus
  • High level of English proficiency, both spoken and written

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
BELIEVE IN LIFE. Join a company that takes you further!




Galenicum is one of the fastest growing companies in the pharmaceutical sector! We are enthusiastic about life, devoting our talent and effort to providing high-quality affordable pharmaceuticals worldwide.




People are the key to our present and future success, so we carefully select candidates that meet the requirements for each position, however most importantly, who also fit with our cultural DNA and values.




Here‚Äôs the lowdown on what your role will actually look like (spoiler alert: it‚Äôs awesome!)




We are looking for Data Analyst to join our Data & BI team.




What you'll be rocking:




Design and Develop Dashboards: Actively participate in the design, development, and maintenance of interactive business intelligence dashboards and reports using BI tools (TABLEAU), transforming complex data into clear and actionable visualizations for various departments.
Data Transformation and Enrichment: Collaborate in the creation and optimization of data pipelines (ETL/ELT) for extracting, cleaning, transforming, and loading information, ensuring data quality and availability for analysis (TABLEAU-PREP & GOOGLE BIG QUERY).
Strategic Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams (sales, marketing, production, etc.) to understand their information needs, translate business requirements into effective data solutions, and ensure that BI tools meet their expectations.
Data Quality Assurance: Conduct regular data audits to ensure the accuracy and quality of data used in business intelligence initiatives.
Support and Training: Provide training and support to internal users on BI tools and data-driven processes, contributing to the creation of a data-driven culture.
Continuous Improvement: Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in business intelligence and data analytics, proposing and implementing improvements in data management processes and the overall BI strategy.
Technological Adaptation: Actively support the organization during tool changes/updates to ensure




What you bring to the table:




Experience: 1 year of previous experience in business intelligence, data analytics, or a related role is preferred but not required. Candidates with relevant internships or academic projects will also be considered.




Educational milestone:




Education: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, Computer Science, Data Analytics, Information Systems, or a related field.
Languages: Excellent level of scientific and business English, both spoken and written.




Your key superpowers:




Proficiency in SQL and Excel for data manipulation and analysis.
Familiarity with BI tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Looker).
Knowledge of data warehousing concepts and ETL/ELT processes.
Understanding of data visualization techniques and best practices. Eagerness to learn and adapt to new technologies and methodologies.
Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work in multidisciplinary teams.
Strong organizational and time management skills.
Proactive, detail-oriented, and capable of managing multiple tasks simultaneously.
Eagerness to learn and adapt to new technologies and methodologies, and actively contribute to team growth.

Title: Data Analyst Junior- Control Tower
Description:
Description

The EU External Fulfilment (EF) network consists of circa 35 operations which offer flexible solutions to the CF network operated by external providers (3PL providers). EU EF primarily provides: (1) network capacity solutions (storage/throughput), (2) special operation solutions (Hazmat, BWS, IXD, SDC, ICC, etc) and (3) emerging market penetration solutions. EU EF is currently undergoing an operational transformation, driving demand for enhanced expertise in Outbound (OB).

The goal of EU 3PL Control Tower is to provide an excellent operational end to end, 24/7 support, in 3PL buildings across European/UK External Fulfillment chain. We aim to provide the standardized and optimized process with frustration free communication. This role is for a highly driven and motivated individual with operational experience and innovative, hands-on approach.

This position involves the daily operational tasks resolutions and day to day communication with 3PL and Amazon team of problem solvers and node managers on their KPIs management.

The successful candidate will be responsible for: a- Provide reactive/proactive support to 3PL Providers and Amazon internals, b- Work on internal Projects to improve/automate 3PL Control Tower services. This person has a strong delivery record, attention to details and will be able to work independently with limited supervision.

This job involves 3PL operations monitoring and ops support, within a team that covers 24/7 shift pattern, for 30+ buildings in Europe/UK.

The shift to cover is Night Shift: 10pm CET to 6am CET, Sunday to Thursday (Friday and Saturday: days off).

Key job responsibilities


Providing the operational guidance to 3PL
Being a communication bridge between 3PL and Amazon stakeholders
Mitigating CX risk by CPT management support, resolving OB errors and managing shipment cancellations
Supporting on Transportation escalations.
Uploading critical data for supply chain and transportation visibility
Checking process and Amazon standard compliance
Optimization of actual Control Tower Outbound processes, aiming to automatize the actual tasks of the team, applying BI skills.
Work on Projects to improve actual 3PL Control Tower services, and capture new services that can be scalable to all 3PL sites.


Basic Qualifications


- Relevant experience working with the MS Office suite (Word, Excel, Outlook)
- C1 English level
- Spanish C2 level


Preferred Qualifications


High school or equivalent diploma.
Focus on details and analytical approach.
Expertise in data analysis tools such as SQL, Python, AI, etc.
Experience in logistics.


Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you‚Äôre applying in isn‚Äôt listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

Title: Electronics & Data Analysis Internship
Description:
Are you an analytical person who enjoys Big Data analysis? Do you have an electronics background and want to grow in this area? HP Inc and be part of one of the most recognized supply chains in the industry!

We are the Procurement team for electromechanical parts within the Large Format Printing Business and 3D Business (aka LFP & 3D). We take care of direct materials procurement, and our deliverables are directly linked with the parts specifications, availability and suitability for all our needs.

PPSC is the acronym for the whole HP Procurement team and concerns the supply chain inbound.

Main Responsibilities


Support PPSC Large Format Printing and 3D EMECH team in the development of analysis tools to support Printed Circuit Assembly industrialization, design, and production.
Focus in the spend analytics, tracking and impact analysis for the various Manufacturer Partners.
Help the PPSC senior engineers with the different guidelines to be developed, maintained and communication WITH R&D and Operations Communities.
Be part of the PPSC electronics team, working closely to RD and operations to optimize Electronics design in terms of EE components selection, and cost analysis
Develop the data analysis layer for tracking Quality Data to improve industrialization activities, test coverage and faster TAT for corrective actions.


What are we looking for?


Fourth-year student, as well as master‚Äôs, currently enrolled in electronics or industrial engineering. Other related disciplines may be acceptable, depending on the technical knowledge. Academic agreement is required. Interest in Data Mining and Big Data would be a plus.
Tools needed: MS Office (PowerPoint, Excel, etc.), Power BI. Knowledge in coding would be a plus.
Strong data analytics and reporting skills: ability to analyze data and interpret it accurately to get conclusions.
Proactive, curious, and dynamic personality: Capacity and eagerness to learn quickly new tools, processes, methods, etc.
Autonomous and self-sufficient person: availability to work on your own and take risks on decisions and new solutions that need to be created.
Fluent in English.


Experience Our Benefits

Being part of HP means access to an international community with lots of growth opportunities within the company, professional development resources, networking opportunities, while enjoying in a great atmosphere making an impact.


You will be able to choose to either work office-based or hybrid work style.
Flexible schedule for part time (4h/day) or full time (8h/day) for a 3 to12 months agreement.
Lunch in the cafeteria.
Love sports? Then take advantage of our sports center (indoor and outdoor); gym, squash courts, tennis courts, basketball courts and with 25+ regular coordinated activities / sports , such as HIIT training, squash,‚ÄØbasketball and yoga.
A Young employee Network (YEN) which host fun events on a regular basis, such as ‚Äúbeer bust‚Äù Fridays at different venues including the beach in the summertime.
We have an onsite Doctor and medical team for our employees, including services such as: nutrition, physiotherapy and general health.
Free printing Happy hour ‚Äì from photographs to large posters. And Hands-on‚ÄØworkshops‚ÄØto print with the latest technology ‚Äì from wall covers to 3D printed models.


Sounds like you? Please apply and let‚Äôs talk!

Title: Junior Business Analyst
Description:
Somos GCO Ventures: la entidad de Corporate Venturing de GCO (Grupo Catalana Occidente). Nuestro objetivo es apoyar a las iniciativas innovadoras para que emprendan su viaje hacia el √©xito.

Research y an√°lisis de mercado, tendencias, competidores, productos, servicios en Espa√±a y otros pa√≠ses.
Realizar investigaciones cualitativas y cuantitativas, recogiendo insights relevantes para la fase de ideaci√≥n.

Requisitos


Formaci√≥n universitaria en Econom√≠a, ADE o formaci√≥n similar. Se valora formaci√≥n complementaria en negocios digitales e innovaci√≥n.

Espa√±ol e ingl√©s fluido (m√≠nimo C1 en ambos).

Title: EHS Manager
Description:
JOB SUMMARY:

The Manager-EHS will be responsible for site level implementation, and maintenance of EHS systems, programs and initiatives to support Tenneco‚Äôs conformance with applicable EHS legal and other requirements and to minimize EHS legal risks and liabilities.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:

The incumbent is responsible to provide site level EHS and Operational teams within the Plant. Job Responsibilities include but are not limited to:


Coordinated and consistent implementation of Tenneco‚Äôs EHS policy, procedures, standards and guidance documents, programs, and initiatives, EHS Management System, and other enterprise requirements.
Analyze EHS legal obligations and risks and develop initiatives and action plans to address those obligations and risks, including but not limited to environmental permits, submission of required reports, and maintenance of data are properly managed.
Implementation of work permit system, contractor and visitor safety management program.
To advise usage of proper & good quality PPE at workplace. Coordinating safety Awareness & Events. Organizing trainings & awareness
Evaluate and assess the internal EHS incident reporting process/system including participating in root cause investigation, development of corrective and preventive action plans, communication of lessons learned and usage of electronic incident reporting tool.
Identify, monitor, track, drive, and report leading and lagging EHSS metrics and KPIs metrics to ensure site level engagement and transparent communication.
Participate in and support corporate EHS audit program and other internal assessment measures for all applicable Tenneco locations.
Collaborate with all Regional Manager, to ensure communication of information on EHS best practices, lessons learned, and other success stories.
Coordinate the collection and submission of the company‚Äôs energy use, greenhouse gas emissions and water use initiatives.
Develop and present site-level EHS trainings in line with EHS training matrix/deployment plan(s) covering both legal and Tenneco EHS requirements.
Facilitates process of industrial hygiene, ergonomic evaluations to ensure compliance with EHS regulations and Tenneco requirements. Specific attention is needed to evaluate and ensure compliance with local EHS requirements.
Establishes and maintains relationships with governmental authorities on matters of mutual concern including voluntary certification (e.g., ISO 14001 and 45001 registrations)
Facilitates plant team with investigations and analysis of accidents and incidents, and support to identify actions and follow-ups to ensure timely completion of all identified actions.
Ensures timely communication, escalation and reporting of events and actions in EHS IS, and timely completion of actions by action owners.
Ensure environmental permits, submission of required reports, and maintenance of data are properly managed at the site.
Oversee operations of ETP an STP as per Statutory Requirements.
Submits EHS reports to the Plant Leadership, Regional EHS Manager on the EHS Performance.
Emergency response actions dealing with the environment, employees, or the community.
Collecting and reporting data related to environmental, health & safety performances, contributing to the organization's overall ESG/Sustainability reporting.


EDUCATION:

Master of Engineering in Occupational Health and/or Safety or Diploma Course in Industrial Safety from RLI or equivalent.

Relevant advanced degree and certifications preferred.

EXPERIENCE:

Minimum of 10-15 years of experience with an emphasis in environmental, health and safety program management and currently manage a team of 1-3 people.

EADERSHIP SKILLS:


Strategic Planning: Developing and implementing long-term EHS strategies to improve overall safety performance.
Effective Communication: Clear and concise communication is crucial for conveying safety protocols, addressing concerns, and ensuring everyone is on the same page.
Problem-Solving: Ability to quickly identify issues and implement effective solutions to maintain a safe and productive work environment.
Decision-Making: Making informed decisions that prioritize safety and compliance while balancing operational needs.
Attention to Detail: Ensuring all safety protocols are meticulously followed and documented.
Conflict Resolution: Addressing and resolving conflicts that may arise related to safety concerns.


ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS:


Excellent oral and written communication skills in English and proficiency in local languages preferred.
Ability to work in a manufacturing environmental requiring the use of Personal Protective Equipment, walking, standing, and other motion-based activities.
Strong knowledge of environmental, health and safety legal requirements.
Strong background in hazard identification, risk assessment, accident investigation and development of corrective actions / risk reduction measures.
Understanding of manufacturing technologies and processes.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Proven facilitation skills including the ability to influence others.
Strong team-building skills.
Strong organizational skills including ability to manage projects and to track projects through completion.
Demonstrate good understanding of latest relevant EHS legislation.
Fluent computer skills including Microsoft Word, PowerPoint and Excel.
Experience in the automotive industry a plus.

  • Participate in and support corporate EHS audit program and other internal assessment measures for all applicable Tenneco locations.
  • Collaborate with all Regional Manager, to ensure communication of information on EHS best practices, lessons learned, and other success stories.
  • Coordinate the collection and submission of the company‚Äôs energy use, greenhouse gas emissions and water use initiatives.
  • Develop and present site-level EHS trainings in line with EHS training matrix/deployment plan(s) covering both legal and Tenneco EHS requirements.
  • Facilitates process of industrial hygiene, ergonomic evaluations to ensure compliance with EHS regulations and Tenneco requirements. Specific attention is needed to evaluate and ensure compliance with local EHS requirements.
  • Establishes and maintains relationships with governmental authorities on matters of mutual concern including voluntary certification (e.g., ISO 14001 and 45001 registrations)
  • Facilitates plant team with investigations and analysis of accidents and incidents, and support to identify actions and follow-ups to ensure timely completion of all identified actions.
  • Ensures timely communication, escalation and reporting of events and actions in EHS IS, and timely completion of actions by action owners.
  • Ensure environmental permits, submission of required reports, and maintenance of data are properly managed at the site.
  • Oversee operations of ETP an STP as per Statutory Requirements.
  • Submits EHS reports to the Plant Leadership, Regional EHS Manager on the EHS Performance.
  • Emergency response actions dealing with the environment, employees, or the community.
  • Collecting and reporting data related to environmental, health & safety performances, contributing to the organization's overall ESG/Sustainability reporting.

EDUCATION:

Master of Engineering in Occupational Health and/or Safety or Diploma Course in Industrial Safety from RLI or equivalent.

Relevant advanced degree and certifications preferred.

EXPERIENCE:

Minimum of 10-15 years of experience with an emphasis in environmental, health and safety program management and currently manage a team of 1-3 people.

EADERSHIP SKILLS:

  • Strategic Planning: Developing and implementing long-term EHS strategies to improve overall safety performance.
  • Effective Communication: Clear and concise communication is crucial for conveying safety protocols, addressing concerns, and ensuring everyone is on the same page.
  • Problem-Solving: Ability to quickly identify issues and implement effective solutions to maintain a safe and productive work environment.
  • Decision-Making: Making informed decisions that prioritize safety and compliance while balancing operational needs.
  • Attention to Detail: Ensuring all safety protocols are meticulously followed and documented.
  • Conflict Resolution: Addressing and resolving conflicts that may arise related to safety concerns.

ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS:

  • Excellent oral and written communication skills in English and proficiency in local languages preferred.
  • Ability to work in a manufacturing environmental requiring the use of Personal Protective Equipment, walking, standing, and other motion-based activities.
  • Strong knowledge of environmental, health and safety legal requirements.
  • Strong background in hazard identification, risk assessment, accident investigation and development of corrective actions / risk reduction measures.
  • Understanding of manufacturing technologies and processes.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Proven facilitation skills including the ability to influence others.
  • Strong team-building skills.
  • Strong organizational skills including ability to manage projects and to track projects through completion.
  • Demonstrate good understanding of latest relevant EHS legislation.
  • Fluent computer skills including Microsoft Word, PowerPoint and Excel.
  • Experience in the automotive industry a plus.

Title: Territory Manager-Personal Loan (Partner Business)
Description:
Job Requirements

Role/ Job Title: Territory Manager-Personal Loan (Partner Business)

Function/ Department: Sales- Personal Loan

Job Purpose

The role bearer has the responsibility of sourcing loans from market using DSAs/DSTs / Connectors and existing channel partners as well establishing a quality portfolio. It entails managing a team, maintain strong relationships, foster co-operation, and communicate effectively across different mediums. The role bearer must make sure adherence to the policies and guidelines set. The execution of these tasks must be accomplished in such manner which is both sales supportive and risk averse contributing to the larger objectives of the bank.

Roles & Responsibilities


Sourcing and managing channels from the market and acquiring business from them.
Ensuring quality portfolio by minimizing delinquency and rejection.
Extensive knowledge and understanding of retails assets, products, operations, and current market trends.
Identifying the changing market trends, channel development for acquiring business and provide high quality customer service.
Recommend improvements to processes and policies across the Retail Banking business to drive operational efficiencies and high-quality customer service.


Education Qualification

Graduation: Any Graduation

Post Graduation: MBA, PGDM

Experience: 2 to 5 years of experience in Personal Loans- Connector Business.

Title: Data Analyst(They/She/He)
Description:
If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionize the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

ü§ù Our culture and strong values.

üí™ Our career development philosophy.

ü§ù Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

Support the optimization of logistics features, with a focus on delivery areas and supply/demand imbalances, by maintaining and improving settings, quantifying their impact, providing data-driven insights, coordinating feature rollouts, and measuring their effectiveness.

THE JOURNEY


Work closely with local/regional stakeholders, product teams and development teams, serving as a bridge between product and operations, to define how to best set up and enable products, monitor and give visibility of metrics and KPIs.
Deep-dive on business metrics, in order to explore areas of opportunity and enable data-driven decision-making, based on applied statistics and probability techniques
Develop and maintain scalable and self-service visualization tools and storytelling dashboards.
Build optimization processes to define the best tuning of every feature on each geography.
Build robust relationships with stakeholders acting as a strategic and supportive link between the technology, business and product.
Support recurrent processes within the team, enabling the adjustment of tools to business needs
Continuously explore and refine key operational metrics (delivery time, efficiency, costs), gaining a comprehensive understanding of Glovo‚Äôs logistics.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


1-3 years of professional experience outside of an academic and internship setting, in a quantitative analysis role
Excellent SQL and Excel/GoogleSheet skills
Solid proficiency in statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown.
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, PowerBI, ...
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Great spoken and written English.


Individuals representing diverse profiles, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable


üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
üí≥ Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Title: Data Analyst, Marketing Analytics
Description:
Who we are:

Want to make an impact? Join our pack and come work (and play!) with us.




We believe everyone deserves the unconditional love of a pet‚Äîand at Rover, our mission is to make it easier to experience that love. Founded in 2011, the Rover app and website connect dog and cat parents with loving pet sitters and dog walkers in neighborhoods across the US, Canada, and Europe. We empower our community of trusted pet sitters and dog walkers to run their own pet care businesses on Rover with the tools and security of a global company to back them.




Headquartered in Seattle, Washington, we work closely with our teams in Barcelona, San Antonio, Spokane, and remote locations. We‚Äôve got a reputation for being a great place to work, having been named among the 100 Best Companies to Work For in Seattle Business Magazine and Washington‚Äôs Best Workplaces in the Puget Sound Business Journal. We're an agile, fast-growing company, and our leadership comes from some of the world's most respected tech companies.




At Rover, our furry coworkers are just as important as our human ones‚Äîand we wouldn‚Äôt have it any other way. Along with making the joys of pet parenthood more accessible, we‚Äôre committed to fostering a diverse, inclusive, and welcoming community of pet people‚Äîand that starts with our employees.




Who we're looking for:

The Marketing Analytics team supports the company‚Äôs marketing efforts, while also working with teams throughout the organization. The analytics team is responsible for a number of business-critical reports and data models that our global marketing teams rely on for daily reporting, budgeting, and analysis. We measure marketing attribution to understand how people become Rover customers, provide campaign reporting to monitor trends in cost efficiency and optimization, deliver lifecycle data to action against a variety of customer behaviors, and narrate the business to identify and prioritize new opportunities.




We are looking for an Analyst to support our Growth, International Expansion, Lifecycle, and SEO stakeholders with a focus on improving our reporting and dashboard structure. The ideal candidate will have experience working closely with business stakeholders and building data-driven narratives that enable clear decision making.




*This is a hybrid position that has the minimum expectation to work out of our Barcelona Office in the Poblenou neighborhood two days per week on Mondays and Thursdays. For this reason, candidates must be based in Barcelona or willing to relocate.




Your Responsibilities:

Work closely with analytics peers and marketing teams to narrate trends and insights, with a particular focus on our customer acquisition marketing programs.
Design reports and dashboards that enable clear, data-driven decision-making for marketing and cross-functional teams.
Refine our marketing attribution models to drive optimal resource allocation across paid and organic marketing channels.
Expand your expertise by supporting experiments such as A/B testing and Market Match tests to optimize strategies across multiple marketing functions.




Your Qualifications:

At least 2 years experience working with complex datasets to support business decision making.
Fluency in SQL.
Data visualisation tool experience (e.g. Mode, Looker, Tableau, etc.)
Ability to adapt your communication style to translate complex data insights for different audiences.
You have experience in owning small-to-medium projects from design to completion with limited guidance from your manager.
You understand when you are blocked, proactively seeking out for help within the team or the organization to move the project forward.




Nice to Have:

Python or R familiarity is helpful, but we welcome candidates eager to develop these skills.
Experience evaluating results of A/B tests as well as expertise in statistical analysis.
Understanding of marketing metrics such as clicks, CPC, CTR, impressions, and unit economics like customer LTV, payback period, and CAC.




Benefits of working at Rover:

Competitive compensation
Long-term incentive plan with a company performance-based cash payout
Permanent contract
Pension plan
Meal tickets through Cobee
Generous PTO allowance
Private health insurance
Discounted gym membership
Bring your dog to work (and unlimited puppy time)
Monetary help for adopting a dog or cat plus yearly credit to use on our platform
A wide variety of snacks, fresh fruit, and beverages in our kitchen to keep yourself going
Regular team activities, including happy hours, game nights, and more




Rover is an equal-opportunity employer committed to promoting a diverse, inclusive, and inventive environment with the best employees. We‚Äôre driven by seeing our people succeed and grow, and we work to ensure everyone contributes to their fullest potential. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, protected veteran status, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable laws, regulations, and ordinances.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Banco Sabadell es una de las principales entidades bancarias en Espa√±a con m√°s de 13.000 personas caracterizadas por nuestra implicaci√≥n, esp√≠ritu de colaboraci√≥n y dinamismo. Banco Sabadell ofrece sus servicios a m√°s de 11 millones de clientes contando con una posici√≥n privilegiada en el segmento de empresas.




Nuestra raz√≥n de ser es ayudar a personas y empresas a hacer realidad sus proyectos, anticip√°ndonos y ocup√°ndonos de que tomen las mejores decisiones econ√≥micas, a trav√©s de nuestros valores: el compromiso, no conformismo, profesionalidad, eficacia, empat√≠a y franqueza.

Y adem√°s, lo hacemos mediante una gesti√≥n responsable y comprometida con el medio ambiente.




¬°√önete a nosotros!







¬øQu√© estamos buscando?




Desde la unidad de Credit Risk Portfolio & ESG, nos encontramos buscando un/una Data Analytic para incorporarse a nuestro equipo, con la finalidad de gestionar y mantener los datos core de la Direcci√≥n.




Hablemos del proyecto...

Misi√≥n

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
We power people‚Äôs progress.

At Preply, we‚Äôre all about creating life-changing learning experiences. We help people discover the magic of the perfect tutor, craft a personalized learning journey, and stay motivated to keep growing. Our approach is human-led, tech-enabled - and it‚Äôs creating real impact. So far, 90,000 tutors have delivered over 20 million lessons to learners in more than 175 countries. Every Preply lesson sparks change, fuels ambition, and drives progress that matters.

Meet The Team

At Preply, we‚Äôre reimagining the way we support language learning!

Our B2B team is at the forefront of enabling global companies to unlock language skills across their workforces. As our B2B offering continues to grow, we‚Äôre looking for a Junior Data Analyst - Insights to join our team and support our data driven decision-making.

You‚Äôll be part of the Data chapter and embedded in the B2B squad, working alongside a senior data scientist, analytical engineer, and analytics manager. The role is ideal for someone who already has an analytical foundation and is eager to learn, grow, and make an impact in a dynamic and varied business environment.

We have an outstanding data science organization: we work throughout the company - in the product, business, and platform teams - using analysis, experimentation, data visualisation, and machine learning techniques. We are uniquely placed to use data to help make better decisions and improve data literacy across Preply.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing


Discover insights and inform the B2B team by running queries and extracting data using SQL and spreadsheets
Help build, improve and maintain data visualisations and reports to track B2B performance
Collaborate with the team on analyses related to customer success, product usage, and sales goals
Gain a deep understanding of B2B business metrics and use data to identify patterns or areas for improvement
Partner with your manager and peers to build skills and grow your analytical toolkit
Measure the impact of initiatives in order to identify growth opportunities and iterate our strategy
Create reporting that the team can use to evaluate and track business performance and take action upon


What You Need To Succeed


Some experience in the data science & analytics field (around 1-2 years' experience or internships preferably)
Strong working knowledge of SQL for querying and data exploration
Comfortable with spreadsheets (Google Sheets or Excel), including functions, charts, and pivot tables
Some experience with data visualisation (can be in any tool)
Some knowledge of quantitative fields (statistics, mathematics, etc.)
Some coding skills in one or more analytics languages (Python, SQL, etc.)
Strong curiosity, problem solving and problem finding skills, and interest in learning about business context and impact
Good written and verbal communication skills - B1 English is a must


Nice To Have


University degree in statistics, economics, econometrics, or a relevant field (or equivalent business experience).
Experience working in startups, tech, or digital B2B environments
Previous experience in Marketplaces and/or digital businesses (B2B, B2C, B2B2C)
Basic knowledge of business metrics like retention, conversion, or usage patterns
Knowledge of Looker, Tableau, Amplitude or other BI tools;
Knowledge of version controlling tools (GitHub, GitLab, etc.).


Why You‚Äôll Love It At Preply


An open, collaborative, dynamic and diverse culture;
A generous monthly allowance for lessons on Preply.com, Learning & Development budget and time off for your self-development;
A competitive financial package with equity, leave allowance and health insurance;
Access to free mental health support platforms;
Access to Gympass-partnered wellness and gym centers throughout Spain to promote and support well-being and physical health;
The opportunity to unlock the potential of learners and tutors through language learning and teaching in 175 countries (and counting!).


Our Principles


Care to change the world - We are passionate about our work and care deeply about its impact to be life changing.
We do it for learners - For both Preply and tutors, learners are why we do what we do. Every day we focus on empowering tutors to deliver an exceptional learning experience.
Keep perfecting - To create an outstanding customer experience, we focus on simplicity, smoothness, and enjoyment, continually perfecting it as every detail matters.
Now is the time - In a fast-paced world, it matters how quickly we act. Now is the time to make great things happen.
Disciplined execution - What makes us disciplined is the excellence in our execution. We set clear goals, focus on what matters, and utilize our resources efficiently.
Dive deep - We leverage business acumen and curiosity to investigate disparities between numbers and stories, unlocking meaningful insights to guide our decisions.
Growth mindset - We proactively seek growth opportunities and believe today's best performance becomes tomorrow's starting point. We humbly embrace feedback and learn from setbacks.
Raise the bar - We raise our performance standards continuously, alongside each new hire and promotion. We build diverse and high-performing teams that can make a real difference.
Challenge, disagree and commit - We value open and candid communication, even when we don‚Äôt fully agree. We speak our minds, challenge when necessary, and fully commit to decisions once made.
One Preply - We prioritize collaboration, inclusion, and the success of our team over personal ambitions. Together, we support and celebrate each other's progress.


Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

Preply is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive. Different opinions and viewpoints are key ingredients in our success as a multicultural Ed-Tech company.

Preply will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age or veteran status. Together, we are The World Class.

Title: Junior Portfolio Data Analyst
Description:
In a nutshell üìå

Position: Junior Portfolio Data Analyst

Location: Madrid, onsite

Experience: At least 1 year in data analysis or a similar role




Want to know more? üëá




INSUD PHARMA operates across the entire pharmaceutical value chain, bringing specialized knowledge and experience in scientific research, development, manufacturing, sales, and marketing of a wide range of active pharmaceutical ingredients (APIs), finished dosage forms (FDFs), and branded pharmaceutical products, adding value to human and animal health.

INSUD PHARMA‚Äôs activity is organized into three synergistic business areas: Industrial (Chemo), Branded (Exeltis), and Biotech (mAbxience), with over 9,000 professionals in more than 50 countries, 20 state-of-the-art facilities, 15 specialized R&D centers, 12 commercial offices, and more than 35 pharmaceutical subsidiaries serving 1,150 clients in 96 countries worldwide. INSUD PHARMA believes in innovation and sustainable development.

Are you ready to be a #Challenger? üí™




What are we looking for? üîé




Support the Business Development team in identifying, analyzing, and selecting products to develop, both generic and innovative.
Perform quantitative (market data) and qualitative (strategic evaluations) analyses within portfolio selection and new product development.
Regularly monitor competitor performance.
Create KPIs and dashboards to provide insights into the execution quality of the Business Development and Portfolio teams.
Develop benchmarks to monitor company performance against peers.
Understand and feel comfortable with clinical and scientific language.
Work on strategic or operational projects.




The challenge! üöÄ

√á

Translate business rules into data logic to support strategic decision-making.
Collaborate closely with different departments to ensure quality and relevance of analysis.
Present results in a structured, clear, and convincing manner.




What do you need? ü§ì




Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Business (double major or Master‚Äôs in Data Science is a plus). Knowledge in Health Sciences is valued.
At least 1 year of experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role.
Proficiency in Python and SQL.
Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar.
Excellent analytical and conceptual skills.
Effective communication skills in English, both written and verbal.
Investigative and curious mindset with strong ability to understand business rules and translate them into data logic.
Strong interpersonal skills and desire to work in a highly collaborative environment.




How will the selection process be? üïµÔ∏è




Initial contact by phone or email.
1 or 2 interviews, either virtual or onsite.
Continuous communication about the status of the process.




üî∑ Think this offer is not for you? üî∑




Follow us on LinkedIn and Instagram for more job opportunities. #InsudPharma #Challenger #Insuder #InsudTalent

COMMITMENT TO EQUAL OPPORTUNITIES

At INSUD PHARMA, we promote gender equality and ensure a work environment free from discrimination based on ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, disability, or any other condition. We value diversity and foster inclusion in all our hiring processes.

Position: Junior Portfolio Data Analyst

Location: Madrid, onsite

Experience: At least 1 year in data analysis or a similar role


Want to know more? üëá


INSUD PHARMA operates across the entire pharmaceutical value chain, bringing specialized knowledge and experience in scientific research, development, manufacturing, sales, and marketing of a wide range of active pharmaceutical ingredients (APIs), finished dosage forms (FDFs), and branded pharmaceutical products, adding value to human and animal health.

INSUD PHARMA‚Äôs activity is organized into three synergistic business areas: Industrial (Chemo), Branded (Exeltis), and Biotech (mAbxience), with over 9,000 professionals in more than 50 countries, 20 state-of-the-art facilities, 15 specialized R&D centers, 12 commercial offices, and more than 35 pharmaceutical subsidiaries serving 1,150 clients in 96 countries worldwide. INSUD PHARMA believes in innovation and sustainable development.

Are you ready to be a #Challenger? üí™


What are we looking for? üîé


  • Support the Business Development team in identifying, analyzing, and selecting products to develop, both generic and innovative.
  • Perform quantitative (market data) and qualitative (strategic evaluations) analyses within portfolio selection and new product development.
  • Regularly monitor competitor performance.
  • Create KPIs and dashboards to provide insights into the execution quality of the Business Development and Portfolio teams.
  • Develop benchmarks to monitor company performance against peers.
  • Understand and feel comfortable with clinical and scientific language.
  • Work on strategic or operational projects.


The challenge! üöÄ

√á

  • Translate business rules into data logic to support strategic decision-making.
  • Collaborate closely with different departments to ensure quality and relevance of analysis.
  • Present results in a structured, clear, and convincing manner.


What do you need? ü§ì


  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Business (double major or Master‚Äôs in Data Science is a plus). Knowledge in Health Sciences is valued.
  • At least 1 year of experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role.
  • Proficiency in Python and SQL.
  • Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar.
  • Excellent analytical and conceptual skills.
  • Effective communication skills in English, both written and verbal.
  • Investigative and curious mindset with strong ability to understand business rules and translate them into data logic.
  • Strong interpersonal skills and desire to work in a highly collaborative environment.


How will the selection process be? üïµÔ∏è


  • Initial contact by phone or email.
  • 1 or 2 interviews, either virtual or onsite.
  • Continuous communication about the status of the process.


üî∑ Think this offer is not for you? üî∑


Follow us on LinkedIn and Instagram for more job opportunities. #InsudPharma #Challenger #Insuder #InsudTalent

COMMITMENT TO EQUAL OPPORTUNITIES

At INSUD PHARMA, we promote gender equality and ensure a work environment free from discrimination based on ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, disability, or any other condition. We value diversity and foster inclusion in all our hiring processes.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
BELIEVE IN LIFE. Join a company that takes you further!




Galenicum is one of the fastest growing companies in the pharmaceutical sector! We are enthusiastic about life, devoting our talent and effort to providing high-quality affordable pharmaceuticals worldwide.




People are the key to our present and future success, so we carefully select candidates that meet the requirements for each position, however most importantly, who also fit with our cultural DNA and values.




Here‚Äôs the lowdown on what your role will actually look like (spoiler alert: it‚Äôs awesome!)




We are looking for Data Analyst to join our Data & BI team.




What you'll be rocking:




Design and Develop Dashboards: Actively participate in the design, development, and maintenance of interactive business intelligence dashboards and reports using BI tools (TABLEAU), transforming complex data into clear and actionable visualizations for various departments.
Data Transformation and Enrichment: Collaborate in the creation and optimization of data pipelines (ETL/ELT) for extracting, cleaning, transforming, and loading information, ensuring data quality and availability for analysis (TABLEAU-PREP & GOOGLE BIG QUERY).
Strategic Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams (sales, marketing, production, etc.) to understand their information needs, translate business requirements into effective data solutions, and ensure that BI tools meet their expectations.
Data Quality Assurance: Conduct regular data audits to ensure the accuracy and quality of data used in business intelligence initiatives.
Support and Training: Provide training and support to internal users on BI tools and data-driven processes, contributing to the creation of a data-driven culture.
Continuous Improvement: Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in business intelligence and data analytics, proposing and implementing improvements in data management processes and the overall BI strategy.
Technological Adaptation: Actively support the organization during tool changes/updates to ensure




What you bring to the table:




Experience: 1 year of previous experience in business intelligence, data analytics, or a related role is preferred but not required. Candidates with relevant internships or academic projects will also be considered.




Educational milestone:




Education: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, Computer Science, Data Analytics, Information Systems, or a related field.
Languages: Excellent level of scientific and business English, both spoken and written.




Your key superpowers:




Proficiency in SQL and Excel for data manipulation and analysis.
Familiarity with BI tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Looker).
Knowledge of data warehousing concepts and ETL/ELT processes.
Understanding of data visualization techniques and best practices. Eagerness to learn and adapt to new technologies and methodologies.
Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work in multidisciplinary teams.
Strong organizational and time management skills.
Proactive, detail-oriented, and capable of managing multiple tasks simultaneously.
Eagerness to learn and adapt to new technologies and methodologies, and actively contribute to team growth.

Title: Data Analyst - Fintech
Description:
At Leadtech, we've been redefining digital businesses since 2009, creating innovative online solutions that reach millions of users every month. With a diverse team of over 700 members from 23+ nationalities, we're united by a passion for creativity and collaboration.

We specialize in delivering user-centric experiences across web and mobile platforms, where people can connect with our products like never before.

We're proud of our global reach and committed to fostering an inclusive workplace where every individual contributes to our shared vision of bringing cutting-edge projects to life. Learn more about our journey and mission on our About Us page!

About The Role

Due to continuous growth, we are seeking an ambitious and detail-oriented Data Analyst - Payments Specialist to drive data-led insights and support our payments strategy during a critical expansion phase. As a fast-growing B2C company with a strong presence in the US and European markets, we are focused on scaling our brand, optimising payment performance, and enhancing fraud prevention. This role requires a strong analytical mindset and a deep understanding of digital payment ecosystems, transactional data, and customer behaviour. You will play a key role in analysing payment trends, identifying inefficiencies, preventing fraud, and enabling data-driven decision-making across our payments and risk operations.

Key Responsibilities:

You're our perfect candidate if you:


Investigate, prioritise, and document anomalies in payments data and fraud patterns to support rapid issue resolution and risk mitigation
Use advanced Excel skills (e.g., VLOOKUPs, pivot tables, IF conditions) to analyse payment transactions, identify unusual behaviour, and support reconciliation efforts
Ensure data accuracy across payment systems by validating transaction records and flagging inconsistencies or suspicious activity
Identify trends in payment failures, chargebacks, and fraud attempts to drive process improvements and reduce financial risk
Implement consumer data acquisition strategies and e-commerce analytics with a focus on optimising payment funnel performance and detecting fraud signals
Build and apply consumer segmentation and profiling models to detect high-risk behaviours and improve fraud prevention tactics
Respond to data analysis requests from fraud teams, compliance, finance, and operations with a focus on payment performance and fraud detection insights
Retrieve, clean, and prepare transactional data for deep analysis of payment patterns, fraud triggers, and refund behaviours
Contribute to daily, weekly, monthly, and annual reporting on payments KPIs, fraud rates, authorization success rates, and risk events
Perform in-depth analysis on large volumes of payments and fraud-related data using advanced techniques to extract actionable insights
Define and enforce data quality standards specific to payments and fraud monitoring systems, ensuring high confidence in real-time decisions
Maintain expertise in analytics tools and practices relevant to payments processing, fraud detection, and compliance reporting
Collaborate with engineering, product, risk, and business intelligence teams to embed data quality controls across payments and fraud pipelines
Create and optimise metrics and dashboards to monitor payment success, fraud incidents, transaction declines, and risk thresholds
Communicate key insights on payment performance and fraud trends to stakeholders, driving cross-functional initiatives for improvement
Research discrepancies in payment data and correct records to ensure accurate transaction histories and trustworthy reporting
Monitor real-time analytics dashboards for drops in payment success rates or spikes in fraud indicators, enabling swift investigation and escalation
Review and act on data control alerts related to payment processing, chargebacks, fraud scoring models, and transaction integrity
Continuously analyse payment flows to detect fraud attempts, reduce false positives, and improve approval rates through data-driven strategies


Requirements

Your expertise in a nutshell:


3+ years of experience as a Data Analyst, in payments, fraud, or transactional data
Strong SQL skills and experience with large datasets and relational databases
Proficient in BI/reporting tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Looker) and Excel.
Solid understanding of digital payment systems, chargebacks, fraud indicators, and PSPs
Experience with data modelling, ETL processes, and data quality best practices
Familiarity with Python, R, or statistical tools (SPSS, SAS) is a plus
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with keen attention to detail
Ability to communicate findings clearly to technical and non-technical stakeholders
Proactive, well-organized, and adaptable in a fast-paced environment
Fluent in English, both written and spoken
Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (e.g., Statistics, Economics, Computer Science)


YOUR TEAM:


We're team-first. If you believe in the power of collaboration and thatthe team's success is your success,then you're one of us!
Fun is fundamental. We believe in forming strong bonds in and outside the oce. That's why we have a team-building budget and organize activities to enjoy ourselves.
Positivity wins the day. Bring a positive attitude and communicate openly. Self-awareness and an openness to learn are always a plus


Benefits

WHY SHOULD YOU JOIN US?

Growth and career development


At Leadtech, we prioritize your growth. Enjoy a flexible career path with personalized internal training and an annual budget for external learning opportunities


Work-Life balance


Benefit from a flexible schedule with flextime (7 - 9:30 a.m. start, 3:30 - 6 p.m. end) and the option of working full remote or from our Barcelona office. Enjoy free Friday afternoons with a 7-hour workday, plus a 35-hour workweek in July and August so you can savor summer!


Comprehensive benefits


Competitive salary, full-time permanent contract, and top-tier private health insurance (including dental and psychological services)
25 days of vacation plus your birthday off, with flexible vacation options‚Äîno blackout days!


Unique Perks


If you wish to come, in our office in Barcelona you'll find it complete with free coffee, fresh fruit, snacks, a game room, and a rooftop terrace with stunning Mediterranean views
Additional benefits include ticket restaurant and nursery vouchers, paid directly from your gross salary


Join us in an environment where you're free to innovate, learn, and grow alongside passionate professionals. At Leadtech, you'll tackle exciting challenges and be part of a vibrant team dedicated to delivering exceptional user experiences

Equal Employment Opportunity Employer

Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, and/or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be part of a great project!

Location

You'll have the flexibility to choose whether you'd like to come to the office every day, from time to time, or work fully remote. We want you to find the best combination for you.

If you prefer to be surrounded with amazing people, our exceptional office is in Barcelona's Blue Building, located right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy our office perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and you'll also be able to take part in our Mario Kart and table tennis competitions.

The personal data you provide will be used to manage your candidacy for the corporate selection processes that fit your profile. If you wish, you can exercise your rights of access, rectification or cancellation by sending a letter to Avenida Litoral, 12-14, 5ta planta, Barcelona 08005, or emailing us at protecciondedatos@LeadTech.com, including a document that validates your identity.

HTML:
At Leadtech, we've been redefining digital businesses since 2009, creating innovative online solutions that reach millions of users every month. With a diverse team of over 700 members from 23+ nationalities, we're united by a passion for creativity and collaboration.

We specialize in delivering user-centric experiences across web and mobile platforms, where people can connect with our products like never before.

We're proud of our global reach and committed to fostering an inclusive workplace where every individual contributes to our shared vision of bringing cutting-edge projects to life. Learn more about our journey and mission on our About Us page!

About The Role

Due to continuous growth, we are seeking an ambitious and detail-oriented Data Analyst - Payments Specialist to drive data-led insights and support our payments strategy during a critical expansion phase. As a fast-growing B2C company with a strong presence in the US and European markets, we are focused on scaling our brand, optimising payment performance, and enhancing fraud prevention. This role requires a strong analytical mindset and a deep understanding of digital payment ecosystems, transactional data, and customer behaviour. You will play a key role in analysing payment trends, identifying inefficiencies, preventing fraud, and enabling data-driven decision-making across our payments and risk operations.

Key Responsibilities:

You're our perfect candidate if you:

  • Investigate, prioritise, and document anomalies in payments data and fraud patterns to support rapid issue resolution and risk mitigation
  • Use advanced Excel skills (e.g., VLOOKUPs, pivot tables, IF conditions) to analyse payment transactions, identify unusual behaviour, and support reconciliation efforts
  • Ensure data accuracy across payment systems by validating transaction records and flagging inconsistencies or suspicious activity
  • Identify trends in payment failures, chargebacks, and fraud attempts to drive process improvements and reduce financial risk
  • Implement consumer data acquisition strategies and e-commerce analytics with a focus on optimising payment funnel performance and detecting fraud signals
  • Build and apply consumer segmentation and profiling models to detect high-risk behaviours and improve fraud prevention tactics
  • Respond to data analysis requests from fraud teams, compliance, finance, and operations with a focus on payment performance and fraud detection insights
  • Retrieve, clean, and prepare transactional data for deep analysis of payment patterns, fraud triggers, and refund behaviours
  • Contribute to daily, weekly, monthly, and annual reporting on payments KPIs, fraud rates, authorization success rates, and risk events
  • Perform in-depth analysis on large volumes of payments and fraud-related data using advanced techniques to extract actionable insights
  • Define and enforce data quality standards specific to payments and fraud monitoring systems, ensuring high confidence in real-time decisions
  • Maintain expertise in analytics tools and practices relevant to payments processing, fraud detection, and compliance reporting
  • Collaborate with engineering, product, risk, and business intelligence teams to embed data quality controls across payments and fraud pipelines
  • Create and optimise metrics and dashboards to monitor payment success, fraud incidents, transaction declines, and risk thresholds
  • Communicate key insights on payment performance and fraud trends to stakeholders, driving cross-functional initiatives for improvement
  • Research discrepancies in payment data and correct records to ensure accurate transaction histories and trustworthy reporting
  • Monitor real-time analytics dashboards for drops in payment success rates or spikes in fraud indicators, enabling swift investigation and escalation
  • Review and act on data control alerts related to payment processing, chargebacks, fraud scoring models, and transaction integrity
  • Continuously analyse payment flows to detect fraud attempts, reduce false positives, and improve approval rates through data-driven strategies

Requirements

Your expertise in a nutshell:

  • 3+ years of experience as a Data Analyst, in payments, fraud, or transactional data
  • Strong SQL skills and experience with large datasets and relational databases
  • Proficient in BI/reporting tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Looker) and Excel.
  • Solid understanding of digital payment systems, chargebacks, fraud indicators, and PSPs
  • Experience with data modelling, ETL processes, and data quality best practices
  • Familiarity with Python, R, or statistical tools (SPSS, SAS) is a plus
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with keen attention to detail
  • Ability to communicate findings clearly to technical and non-technical stakeholders
  • Proactive, well-organized, and adaptable in a fast-paced environment
  • Fluent in English, both written and spoken
  • Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (e.g., Statistics, Economics, Computer Science)

YOUR TEAM:

  • We're team-first. If you believe in the power of collaboration and thatthe team's success is your success,then you're one of us!
  • Fun is fundamental. We believe in forming strong bonds in and outside the oce. That's why we have a team-building budget and organize activities to enjoy ourselves.
  • Positivity wins the day. Bring a positive attitude and communicate openly. Self-awareness and an openness to learn are always a plus

Benefits

WHY SHOULD YOU JOIN US?

Growth and career development

  • At Leadtech, we prioritize your growth. Enjoy a flexible career path with personalized internal training and an annual budget for external learning opportunities

Work-Life balance

  • Benefit from a flexible schedule with flextime (7 - 9:30 a.m. start, 3:30 - 6 p.m. end) and the option of working full remote or from our Barcelona office. Enjoy free Friday afternoons with a 7-hour workday, plus a 35-hour workweek in July and August so you can savor summer!

Comprehensive benefits

  • Competitive salary, full-time permanent contract, and top-tier private health insurance (including dental and psychological services)
  • 25 days of vacation plus your birthday off, with flexible vacation options‚Äîno blackout days!

Unique Perks

  • If you wish to come, in our office in Barcelona you'll find it complete with free coffee, fresh fruit, snacks, a game room, and a rooftop terrace with stunning Mediterranean views
  • Additional benefits include ticket restaurant and nursery vouchers, paid directly from your gross salary

Join us in an environment where you're free to innovate, learn, and grow alongside passionate professionals. At Leadtech, you'll tackle exciting challenges and be part of a vibrant team dedicated to delivering exceptional user experiences

Equal Employment Opportunity Employer

Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, and/or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be part of a great project!

Location

You'll have the flexibility to choose whether you'd like to come to the office every day, from time to time, or work fully remote. We want you to find the best combination for you.

If you prefer to be surrounded with amazing people, our exceptional office is in Barcelona's Blue Building, located right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy our office perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and you'll also be able to take part in our Mario Kart and table tennis competitions.

The personal data you provide will be used to manage your candidacy for the corporate selection processes that fit your profile. If you wish, you can exercise your rights of access, rectification or cancellation by sending a letter to Avenida Litoral, 12-14, 5ta planta, Barcelona 08005, or emailing us at protecciondedatos@LeadTech.com, including a document that validates your identity.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

En MRM buscamos un/a Data Analyst para sumarse a nuestro equipo de Data Science & Business Intelligence, participando en proyectos innovadores para grandes marcas y sectores internacionales.

¬øQu√© har√°s?


Analizar comportamiento de usuarios y clientes mediante consultas SQL avanzadas, generando insights accionables para campa√±as y estrategias.
Recoger, estructurar e implementar briefings de an√°lisis espec√≠ficos adaptados a cada cliente o proyecto.
Dise√±ar y automatizar dashboards interactivos con herramientas como Power BI, Tableau, Qlik o Data Studio, orientados a marketing, ventas o customer experience.
Definir y aplicar metodolog√≠as estad√≠sticas como A/B Testing y grupos de control paramedir impacto real de acciones.
Coordinar y asegurar la entrega de reports peri√≥dicos con foco en calidad, claridad y puntualidad.
Comunicar resultados y hallazgos de manera clara y con visi√≥n estrat√©gica, tanto a nivel interno como en reuniones con cliente externo.


¬øQu√© buscamos en ti?


Esp√≠ritu de equipo y capacidad para trabajar en entornos colaborativos con perfiles de distintas disciplinas, pa√≠ses y culturas.
Proactividad, energ√≠a positiva y fuerte ambici√≥n profesional.
Atenci√≥n al detalle y mentalidad anal√≠tica.
Creatividad e innovaci√≥n: no buscamos replicadores de modelos, sino personas que aporten ideas nuevas y valientes.
Mentalidad cr√≠tica y orientada a la mejora continua.
Capacidad de adaptaci√≥n a la presi√≥n sin perder foco en la calidad.
Gusto por el marketing, el entorno digital y la relaci√≥n con los datos.


Requisitos T√©cnicos Imprescindibles


SQL avanzado: agilidad en la extracci√≥n, manipulaci√≥n y an√°lisis de grandes vol√∫menes de datos. S√∫per enfocado en el dato, con gran cuidado en la precisi√≥n de los resultados asegurando unos entregables de calidad y 100% fiables.
Conocimiento s√≥lido de entornos de BI y anal√≠tica.
Experiencia con herramientas de visualizaci√≥n (Power BI, Tableau, Qlik, Data Studio).
Rigor y cuidado extremo en validaciones y revisiones de datos.
Capacidad de estructurar briefings y transformar preguntas de negocio en an√°lisis efectivos.


Sobre MRM

MRM es una agencia de experiencias digitales que ofrece soluciones creativas transformadoras en la intersecci√≥n de los negocios, el data y la tecnolog√≠a. MRM opera de forma integrada y sin fronteras, para permitir una mayor colaboraci√≥n y velocidad, todo ello con el objetivo de ayudar a las empresas a establecer relaciones significativas con las personas. MRM forma parte de McCann Worldgroup y del grupo de empresas Interpublic (NYSE: IPG) y cuenta con 35 oficinas en Am√©rica del Norte, Am√©rica Latina, Europa, Oriente Medio y Asia Pac√≠fico.


McCann Worldgroup manifiesta su compromiso con la igualdad y la diversidad.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

AbbVie's mission is to discover and deliver innovative medicines and solutions that solve serious health issues today and address the medical challenges of tomorrow. We strive to have a remarkable impact on people's lives across several key therapeutic areas ‚Äì immunology, oncology, neuroscience, and eye care ‚Äì and products and services in our Allergan Aesthetics portfolio. For more information about AbbVie, please visit us at www.abbvie.com. Follow @abbvie on X, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, LinkedIn and Tik Tok.

Job Description

The Data Analyst will work within Customer Engagement Analytics team in Spain, to provide technical expertise in Advance/Predictive/Prescriptive Analytics. The key responsibilities of the role will be to contribute to AbbVie Data Analytics projects and support Data Science projects. Should be highly analytical with love and high affinity for analysis, mathematics and statistics. Additionally, not only should be familiar with quantitative methodologies and programming but also keen on business acumen. The Data Analyst should have passion for data analysis, data quality and accuracy, data exploration, machine learning and out of the box thinking.

Key responsibilities:

Serve as a relevant member of Customer Engagement Analytics, working in close partnership with the rest of team member and Global Winning with Data team to implement global and local initiatives in the affiliate, becoming a trusted partner of the CEx local team.

Develop in collaboration with the commercial teams and other CEx teams, advanced analytics, identify synergies, optimize reporting strategy to generate business relevant outcomes.

Master in different Foundry datasets of varying complexity and size levels and develop new ways to generate creative predictive analytic solutions to work around data limitations.

Identify best practices and extend them to the rest of the organization in terms of repoting & analytics, Proactively identify new analytical approaches that would improve our ability to answer key business questions, by closely collaborating with key business partners to transform key business questions to insights.

Work with business stakeholders to define key business questions, requirements, timelines, objectives and success factors for winning with data initiatives.

Qualifications

BS degree in mathematics, statistics or engineering, computer science or economics complemented with a master in Big Data, Artificial Intelligence, Advanced Analytics, Machine Learning, Data Science or equivalent.

Portfolio of work demonstrating data science applications.

Minimum of 2 years of applied data science in fields such as data engineering, predictive modelling,

Experience developing and executing data analytica to address key business questions with positive and measurable outcomes.

Experience analyzing and drawing insights from key internally and externally generated data sets.

Essential skills:

Analytical reasoning abilities, intellectual curiosity, strong business acumen and creative problem solving.

Ability to interact effectively with/present to (verbally or written) to all levels of the organization.

Ability to be agile and nimble changing business conditions, strong collaborative relationships, teamwork across different functions and teams to contribute to productive culture.

Lead strategically and create trust within the team.

Additional Information

AbbVie is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to operating with integrity, driving innovation, transforming lives and serving our community.‚ÄØ Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled.

US & Puerto Rico only - to learn more, visit https://www.abbvie.com/join-us/equal-employment-opportunity-employer.html

US & Puerto Rico applicants seeking a reasonable accommodation, click here to learn more:

https://www.abbvie.com/join-us/reasonable-accommodations.html
