Title: Data Analyst (They/She/He)
Description:
If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

ü§ù Our culture and strong values.

üí™ Our career development philosophy.

ü§ù Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

THE JOURNEY


Work closely with multi-disciplinary teams to define the business roadmap and strategy, monitor and give visibility of operations metrics and KPIs.
Apply various advanced mathematical and statistical modeling techniques and analyses (experimentation, machine learning, causal inference, etc.) to solve for product and business problems that drive the highest impact.
Translate business questions and hypotheses into analysis and actionable insights.
Develop and maintain scalable and self-service visualization tools and storytelling dashboards.
Foster strong relationships with stakeholders acting as a strategic and supportive link between the technology, business, and product.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


3-5 years of professional experience outside of an academic and internship setting, in a quantitative analysis role.
A higher education in scientific discipline such as Physics, Statistics, Computer Science or Mathematics.
Knowledge or experience in digital product development.
Demonstrable experience with the application of statistical modeling and advanced analytics to provide strategy-shaping insights.
Mastery in SQL and statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown.
Demonstrated experience in designing and analyzing experiments in digital products (A/B test, multivariate, etc).
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, PowerBI.
Excellent spoken and written English.


Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves


üåü An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
üí≥ Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Pozuelo de Alarc√≥n, Community of Madrid, Spain
Description:
Verisure is seeking a talented, innovative, passionate¬†Data Analyst to join our growing and successful Group Marketing Team, reporting to the Group Head of Web development & Analytics.

Verisure is building a talented and passionate Digital Marketing Team, and the Data Analyst position is key to its success! This is your chance to visibly impact on Verisure‚Äôs growth and the development of a best-in-class organization.

The role‚Äôs relevance in data collection and analysis is a great opportunity for a strong talent to develop our organization‚Äôs growth. Our success depends on our people, and we invest in them every day. Working with Verisure is being part of an industry leading, world-class company that thrives on a strong entrepreneurial spirit.

Key Responsibilities

As a core member of the Group Digital Marketing team, the Data Analyst will play a crucial role in driving data-informed decision-making by performing the following responsibilities:

Improving the quality and consistency of digital marketing tracking, collaborating with technical teams to maintain a robust data infrastructure and ensure the integrity of analytics data.
Designing, building, and maintaining marketing performance dashboards and reports using Tableau, Looker Studio or similar data visualization tools, ensuring clarity, accuracy, and usability for diverse stakeholders.
Engaging with cross-functional stakeholders to understand business needs, translate them into data requirements, and deliver actionable insights through compelling analysis and visual storytelling.
Partnering with teams across the organization, including Product, CRM, and Web, to identify data opportunities, support campaign measurement, and foster a data-driven culture.
Extracting and manipulating data using SQL to support advanced analytics and reporting needs.
Contributing to the development and lifecycle of Adtech products, including participation in requirement definition, data architecture design, and ongoing maintenance.

Location

The position will be based in Madrid (Spain).

Candidate profile

Qualifications, Experiences, and Competencies

Required Qualifications

Education & Experience

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, Marketing, or a related field.
Minimum of 2‚Äì3 years of experience in data analysis within a digital marketing or Adtech environment.
Experience working in multinational or cross-market teams is a plus.

Technical Skills

Good understanding of digital tracking technologies, including GA4, Google Tag Manager, and custom event tracking.
Solid experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or Looker Studio.
Familiarity with digital marketing platforms (e.g. Google Ads, Meta Ads, DV360, etc.).
Knowledge of marketing KPIs, attribution models, customer journey analysis, and performance measurement.
Proficiency in SQL for data extraction, cleaning, and manipulation across large datasets.
Ability to handle large datasets and navigate data warehouse environments (experience with BigQuery is a plus).
Basic understanding of Python or R for automation and exploratory data analysis is an advantage.

Analytical & Business Acumen

Strong ability to translate business problems into analytical questions and deliver actionable insights.
Working knowledge of conversion funnel analysis, CRO strategies, and campaign optimization.
Experience with A/B testing design, analysis, and interpretation is a plus.

Communication & Collaboration

Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to present complex insights clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Proven ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Product, CRM, Design, and Content.
Proactive, detail-oriented, and comfortable working autonomously in a fast-paced environment.

Languages

Fluent English is required (written and spoken).
Other languages (e.g. Spanish, French, German, or Nordic languages) are a plus.

Preferred Qualifications

Experience working with Google BigQuery or similar cloud-based data platforms.
Exposure to Adtech environments, CDPs (Customer Data Platforms), or server-side tracking.
Experience with automated reporting solutions or building data pipelines.
Familiarity with marketing mix modeling, predictive analytics, or machine learning use cases.
Certifications such as:
Google Analytics Certification
Tableau/Power BI certifications
Meta or Google Ads certifications

Strong fit with our Company DNA

Passionate in Everything We Do: Our people have a sense of energy that is unmistakable, one that drives us to delight our customers and focus on creating impact quickly.¬†

Committed to Making a Difference: When we say we will do something; we deliver with excellence. We are accountable, focused and operate with discipline.¬†

Always Innovating: We believe that Innovation can be big or small; it‚Äôs a continuous state of mind that inspires us to think differently and always make things better. We are risk takers and we learn continuously.¬†

Winning as a Team: Our people know that by leveraging one another‚Äôs strengths, investing in and developing our team‚Äôs capability and by collaborating well, we will win.

With Trust & Responsibility: Operating with integrity is core to our success. We are humble, honest and value deep mastery and expertise. We do the right thing, always.

The Company

Verisure is the leading European provider of professionally monitored security systems with 24/7 response services. We protect more than 5 million families and small businesses across 17 countries in Europe and Latin America. And our mission is to provide our customers peace of mind by protecting what matters most to them.

With over 35 years of insight, experience, and innovation, Verisure is known for category-creating marketing, sales excellence, innovative products and services, and customer-centricity. Thanks to a strong focus on high quality, our customers are amongst the most satisfied and loyal in our industry. We have some of the strongest double-digit growth and retention rates globally in consumer-facing services which demonstrates our exceptional service levels and strong value proposition to our customers.

Diversity, inclusion, equity, and belonging at Verisure

At Verisure, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace, recognising that diversity of thought and background only makes our teams stronger and more innovative. We reject all forms of discrimination and bias, and we believe in access to opportunities for everyone, regardless of gender, age, disability status, race, sexual orientation, or any other status. Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Belonging values are embedded in our company‚Äôs DNA. And we continue to prioritise our DEIB efforts every day to create a more inclusive organisation, enable diverse representation of our community, and ensure equity and meritocracy every step of the way.
¬†

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
¬°Hi! ¬°We are Cheil Spain! üöÄ




Cheil Worldwide is a full-service agency from brand building to digital transformations creating excellent data-driven experiences for every customer. As part of Cheil Worldwide, Cheil Spain plays its part in one of the world‚Äôs biggest agency networks ‚Äì comprising 53 offices and 8 affiliates in 43 countries globally with more than 6.000 employees and 600 clients around the world. Cheil Spain is made up of 100 employees from different disciplines, who are passionate about innovation in all its forms. We offer a wide variety of marketing and advertising services, including strategy and planning, creative, content production, traditional and digital media advertising, influencer marketing, event marketing, e-commerce and performance marketing, among others.




‚úîÔ∏è Your role at Cheil: Data Analyst




‚úîÔ∏è What we are looking for?




We are looking for a highly analytical and business-driven Senior Data Analyst to join our Performance team at Cheil Spain. This role will play a critical part in unlocking insights from web and CRM data to improve user experiences, increase conversions, and inform strategic decisions for Samsung Spain and Portugal.

The ideal candidate has strong expertise in Adobe Analytics and GA4, and a solid understanding of user behavior analysis, segmentation, and digital marketing KPIs. Bonus if you're familiar with SQL, Python, BigQuery, and Qlik.




‚úîÔ∏è Key Responsibilities:




Support CRM and performance initiatives through audience segmentation, behavior analysis, and campaign performance reporting.
Evaluate Campaigns, promotions, marketing channels attribution, the funnel, and much more for the understanding of the customer journey, identifying insights with clear business recommendations
Analyze user journeys and web behavior through Adobe Analytics and GA4 to identify performance trends, drop-offs, and optimization opportunities.
Create dashboards and reports using tools such as Adobe Workspace, Looker Studio, or Power BI to track performance and support internal and client decision-making.
Collaborate closely with UX, CRO, Paid Media, and CRM teams to align data strategies and contribute with actionable insights.
Define KPIs and measurement frameworks for digital marketing initiatives and validate technical tracking implementations (with support from GTM specialists if needed).
Deliver recurring and ad hoc reports for always-on and campaign-based activities, including funnel analysis, campaign attribution, and ecommerce performance.
Present insights clearly and effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, connecting data findings with business objectives.
Continuously monitor data quality, track implementation, and propose process improvements to strengthen data-driven decision-making.




‚úîÔ∏è Key Skills & requirements:




4+ years in a Digital Data Analyst role, ideally within an agency or ecommerce environment.
Advanced expertise in Adobe Analytics and Google Analytics 4.
Proven ability to extract, visualize, and present insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Experience building dashboards and reports using Looker Studio or Power BI.
Strong understanding of digital marketing campaigns, ecommerce KPIs, and data quality validation.
Excellent storytelling and presentation skills in PowerPoint.
Strong communication and teamwork skills, with a strategic business mindset.




Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with SQL, BigQuery, and Python for data querying and automation tasks.
Understanding of website tagging and event tracking via Google Tag Manager.
Knowledge of Adobe Audience Manager or other CDP tools.
Previous exposure to e-commerce platforms and CRO/UX concepts.
Familiarity with A/B testing frameworks and marketing attribution models.
Fluent in Spanish and English.




Languages:

C1 level of English required, with advanced English writing skills and the ability to communicate effectively with international teams and external suppliers.




‚úîÔ∏è We would like you to bring together attitudes that have to do with...




Working effectively with individuals of diverse cultures, interpersonal styles, abilities, motivations, or backgrounds.
Making the most effective use of the capabilities, insights, and ideas of all individuals.
Inspiring others by generating innovative solutions in work situations .
Trying different and novel ways to deal with work problems and opportunities.
Working effectively and cooperatively with others.
Establishing and maintaining good working relationships.
Setting high goals for personal and group accomplishment.
Tenaciously working to meet or exceed goals by proactively confronting difficult issues.
Establishing and sustaining trusting relationships by accurately perceiving and interpreting one‚Äôs own and others‚Äô emotions and behavior.
Leveraging insights to effectively manage one‚Äôs own responses and reactions.




‚úîÔ∏è Cheil offers you:




üå±Work in a growing environment, focused on creating and innovating with multidisciplinary and multicultural teams in Creativity, Digital Performance, Retail, Data and Technology.

‚úçÔ∏èStable position: Permanent contract because we want you to be part of Cheil and be able to develop with us.

üí∏Salary: To be negotiated based on experience. Bonus Performance.

üìñInternal training opportunities.

‚ù§Ô∏èSocial Benefits: Restaurant Tickets and Medical Insurance.

üïõTimetable from Monday to Thursday from 09.00-18.15 and Fridays from 09.00-15.00. July and August, we have an intensive working day, Monday to Friday from 8:00 - 15:00.

üíªHybrid working model.

üèñÔ∏è22 days of annual leave, plus 24 and 31 December and Advertising Day.

üí∞Possibility of incentive for attracting new clients and new employees to Cheil. Help us to keep growing!

üìçWe are located in Alcobendas and we have a direct bus service, 100% free, with departures from Plaza Castilla, Chamart√≠n and Nuevos Ministerios to our offices.




‚úîÔ∏è Next steps:




Are you motivated by what you have just read? Join Cheil!

If you are passionate about the world of advertising and have experience leading teams, we invite you to send your CV and cover letter. We hope to have a high-level professional who will help us continue to grow in the market.

Observaciones

Se ofrece:

El contrato est√° asociado a la ejecuci√≥n del encargo detallado en la publicaci√≥n para el plan de Recuperaci√≥n, Transformaci√≥n y Resiliencia o con financiaci√≥n que provenga de Fondos de la Uni√≥n Europea.
  • Jornada completa de 37,5 h semanales.
  • Flexibilidad horaria.
  • Cheque restaurante con independencia del salario bruto anual.
  • Posibilidad de realizar hasta un m√°ximo del 50% del trabajo a distancia por ahorro energ√©tico.


El plazo de recepci√≥n de candidaturas estar√° abierto desde hoy d√≠a 18/07/2025 hasta el pr√≥ximo 08/08/2025 a las 23:59 h.


Para poder participar en este proceso de selecci√≥n ser√° necesario adjuntar como anexo a la solicitud, o bien durante el trascurso del proceso de selecci√≥n, la documentaci√≥n acreditativa del cumplimiento de los requisitos de formaci√≥n acad√©mica y/o experiencia detallados en la oferta. La incorrecta acreditaci√≥n de los documentos solicitados o la falsedad en lo indicado, supondr√° la exclusi√≥n inmediata del proceso.


El cumplimiento de los requisitos deber√° justificarse, anexando en el apartado ‚ÄúAnexos‚Äù de la solicitud (o durante el proceso) los siguientes documentos, seg√∫n corresponda:

-T√≠tulo oficial de la formaci√≥n o justificante del pago de solicitud del t√≠tulo o certificado acad√©mico de los estudios finalizados (incluido el proyecto final)

-Vida laboral y/o contrato de trabajo que permita comprobar y acreditar la experiencia profesional requerida.

-Anexos de pr√°cticas que permita comprobar y acreditar la experiencia acad√©mica requerida en su caso.


Se deber√° aportar las titulaciones correspondientes al sistema educativo espa√±ol, as√≠ como las equiparadas a todos los efectos en virtud de la credencial de homologaci√≥n o el certificado de equivalencia emitidos por la Secretar√≠a General de Universidades.


En caso de t√≠tulos obtenidos en universidades y/o centros extranjeros, se requiere que el mismo est√© homologado en Espa√±a debiendo adjuntar como Anexo a la solicitud la correspondiente documentaci√≥n justificativa.


Estar en posesi√≥n de la documentaci√≥n acreditativa suficiente para poder formalizar un contrato de trabajo en Espa√±a: Permiso de residencia y trabajo en vigor.


No haber sido objeto de despido disciplinario por hechos acaecidos en el √°mbito del Grupo Tragsa, ni tener la condici√≥n de ‚Äúpersona no apta‚Äù para el desempe√±o de las funciones esenciales del puesto ofertado, aunque sea temporalmente.


La inscripci√≥n y presentaci√≥n de su solicitud de empleo supone la declaraci√≥n responsable del cumplimiento de los requisitos recogidos en la misma, as√≠ como la veracidad de sus respuestas a las preguntas de filtrado o killer questions, que respondan en relaci√≥n a la misma, pudiendo ser rechazados en caso de que se compruebe su incumplimiento o falta de veracidad.


Con el objeto de dar cumplimiento al II Plan de Igualdad de la empresa para alcanzar una presencia equilibrada de mujeres y hombres en todos los niveles, √°reas y ocupaciones donde exista desequilibrio, a igualdad de m√©ritos y capacidades, se articular√° la preferencia de contrataci√≥n de la persona del sexo infrarrepresentado en el puesto. Se entiende por infrarrepresentaci√≥n un porcentaje igual o menor al 40% en el √°mbito de la empresa en el puesto ofertado


Con el objeto de dar cumplimiento de la Norma RRH.09 para el Fomento de la incorporaci√≥n de personas con discapacidad en el Grupo Tragsa, a igualdad de condiciones, se priorizar√°n las candidaturas de aquellas personas que cuenten con una discapacidad reconocida y acreditada igual o superior al 33%, siempre y cuando la discapacidad sea compatible con el adecuado desempe√±o del puesto.


Si la persona que resulte seleccionada en este proceso mantiene una relaci√≥n laboral vigente en la empresa, la suscripci√≥n del nuevo contrato conlleva la inexistencia de reserva de su actual puesto de trabajo, debiendo realizar previamente, los tr√°mites legales oportunos.


Cualquier contrataci√≥n temporal resultante de este proceso de selecci√≥n garantizar√° por parte del Grupo Tragsa la operatividad y el mantenimiento de los proyectos/servicios, as√≠ como, el cumplimiento de la normativa interna y la legislaci√≥n laboral vigente.


En caso de surgir bajas, se podr√° contactar a los/as candidatos/as para ofrecer un contrato de duraci√≥n determinada con una duraci√≥n que variar√° en funci√≥n del hecho causante.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Kiwi.com

Kiwi.com is a leading global travel-tech company headquartered in the Czech Republic. Our innovative algorithm enables users to find better route options and prices other search engines can‚Äôt see, daily performing billions of price checks across 95% of global flight content. Are you bold, bright and curious? Join a global business that‚Äôs still got a start-up heart.

About Our Content Analytics Team

Our team is responsible for providing data-centric insights that enable the optimization of our flight content acquisition and processing. We use extensive datasets to support booking channel performance, improve autobooking efficiency and ensure data quality across our systems. Our work directly impacts Kiwi.com 's ability to offer our customers unique travel combinations and a smooth booking experience worldwide. We combine technical expertise with business understanding to build data-informed recommendations across multiple teams and stakeholders.

What You Will Do


You will conduct complex ad-hoc analysis using BigQuery and Looker, delivering insights that support thoughtful decision-making.
By creating and maintaining dashboards for key business metrics, you will help make data accessible and meaningful for stakeholders.
You will work with Looker's analytical layer, defining explores, measures and dimensions to support robust data exploration.
You will collaborate on building data models and support data quality through rigorous QA processes in collaboration with our data engineers.
You will evaluate and improve our complex flight booking and data acquisition systems, identifying opportunities for optimization.
You‚Äôll create data-informed recommendations by sharing practical insights with our flight content ecosystem.
You will help develop monitoring and alerting tools for product operations, enabling proactive incident detection and prevention.


What You Will Need


Your strong SQL skills and experience with BigQuery or similar data warehouses.
You have experience with BI tools (we use Looker) and a solid understanding of data modeling and data quality standards.
You can translate complex analytical findings into actionable insights that drive results.
You bring experience working with large datasets and collaborating with multiple stakeholders across teams.
Your excellent communication skills in English enable you to explain complex concepts to non-technical audiences.
You have an analytical mindset with a strong attention to detail, ensuring accuracy and precision in your work.
You are capable of working independently while aligning with and contributing to team goals.


We offer you


We offer a hybrid and flexible work environment. A lovely, modern office in the center of Barcelona (Passeig de Gracia) with great views and amenities.
Monthly entitlement of 200 Euro redeemable through Cobee. Cobee is a benefits platform offering a range of benefits (meals, transport, nursery, health insurance, and physical wellness) and flexible compensation. It also allows our employees to allocate up to 30% of their gross salary to the consumption of certain products or services, leveraging tax exemption.
We also enjoy benefits, such as flexible working hours, 30 paid vacation days and sick days.
Annual financial bonus based on company and individual performance.
Flight vouchers to celebrate your Kiwi anniversaries.
Relocation package (including visa transfer support).
Dogs are welcome in our offices.


Interested? Join us and help us make travel more accessible to all.

Kiwi.com is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and employer. We review applications for employment without regard to their race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, uniformed services, genetic information, physical or mental disability, medical condition, marital status, or any other basis prohibited by law.

Throughout the recruitment process and for some time after it‚Äôs finished, we‚Äôre going to process your Personal Data. You can find all the necessary information in our Privacy Policy available at: https://jobs.kiwi.com/recruitment-privacy-policy/ .

Title: Personal De Aforos En Vi√±edos Y Auxliar De Inspector Vendimias 2025
Description:
El Consejo Regulador de la Denominaci√≥n de Origen Protegida Ribera del Duero selecciona PERSONAL PARA AFOROS DE VI√ëEDO para trabajar en las labores de Control e Inspecci√≥n de la producci√≥n y entrada de uva en las Instalaciones de las Bodegas Inscritas.Los candidatos deben contar necesariamente con estudios relacionados con la agronom√≠a .

Title: Marketing Data Analyst (Remote) - 1014145311
Description:
We're looking for a Marketing Data Analyst who is passionate about their work, adapts easily, and shares our company values!

A Little Bit About Us

Leadtech has been fostering and developing innovative digital businesses across several industries since 2009. It has since then expanded to a team of over 500 committed employees working all over Spain. We are thrilled to have more than 23 nationalities working together and very proud to see that our products and services are enjoyed by millions of users monthly around the globe.

How you will make a difference:


Measure the performance of marketing campaigns, build ad hoc custom reports, and analyze anomalies and trends
Preparation of analytical reports and dashboards (including visualization) for the marketing team
Creation of Google Sheets scripts to connect data from different reports and Google Sheets
High experience and skill level in Microsoft Excel / Google Sheets
Analysis of product & marketing metrics correlation and identification of their drivers
Analysis and identification of user behavior patterns based on product & marketing analytics and forming hypotheses for the marketing team based on these insights
Develop the SKAN measurement approach for Google, Meta and Tiktok
Deeply understand the process of acquisition of users in order to analyze/provide valuable proposals
Manage MMP Tools (Adjust), and provide technical support and troubleshooting for the marketing team, specifically related to app attribution, event tracking, and callback implementations
Analyze performance impact of any product and marketing strategy changes
Cooperate with Marketing and Product teams to actively increase project profitability
Collaborate with the BI department to create and maintain data visualization dashboards


Requirements


Bachelor degree in STEM field or similar
Experience working as Analyst of at least 3 years
Strong knowledge of app attribution tools commonly used in the mobile advertising industry
Strong knowledge of machine learning and statistics techniques
Strong communication skills and the ability to translate technical findings into clear business recommendations
In-depth understanding of digital marketing strategies including down funnel analysis, as well technical knowledge of iOS and Android marketing analysis to tailor strategies for both platforms
Experience working with data visualization tools
Experience with setting up and managing event tracking in mobile apps. Especially with a focus on SKAN, Firebase, Meta etc
Teamwork and collaboration skills to work closely with other data professionals and cross-functional teams
Proactive attitude and results-oriented


Benefits

Perks of being one of us


Full-time, permanent contract
Flexible time off, no blackout dates, plus your birthday, Christmas' Eve and New Year's Eve off
Remote work
Flextime (7 - 9:30 a.m. / 3:30 - 7:30 p.m)
Free Friday afternoons (a 7-hour workday!) + 35-hour week in July and August (free afternoons here we come!)
Enhanced career path designed just for you
External training budget
We celebrate all company landmarks


Sounds good? Apply now! We're looking forward to getting to know you.

Equal Employment Opportunity Employer

Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expressi√≥n and/or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be a part of a great project!

Location

You'll have the flexibility to choose whether you'd like to come to the office every day, from time to time, or work fully remote. We want you to find the best combination for you.

If you prefer to be surrounded with amazing people, our exceptional office is in Barcelona's Blue Building, located right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy our office perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and you'll also be able to take part in our Mario Kart and table tennis competitions.

Title: Data Analyst - Travel Industry
Description:
AIC Travel Group SAis a B2B travel company headquartered in Geneva, Switzerland, with over 20 years of experience in the tourism sector.

We are seeking a skilledData Analystwith proven expertise in thetravel and hospitality industry.


Responsibilities:


Drive data-led decisions forB2B travel partners(bedbanks, OTAs, DMCs) by analyzing hotel performance, market trends, and sales pipelines.

Build and manage dashboards inLooker Studio / Google Data Studio

Segment and automate campaigns and reports inHubSpot CRM

Provide actionable insights to support sales and marketing teams

Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and business intelligence metrics

Direct exposure to the CEO/management, offering visibility into strategic decision-making


Requirements:


2+ years of experience in the travel industry, ideally in a B2B environment (bedbanks, OTAs, DMCs, tour operators)

Proficiency withLooker Studio (Google Data Studio), Google Sheets, and advanced Excel

Hands-on experience withHubSpot CRM(reports, segmentation, workflows)

Strong analytical mindset and problem-solving skills

Self-driven, analytical mindset, remote collaboration fluency

Fluent inEnglish(mandatory); Italian/French/Spanish/German advantageous for EU market alignment


What We Offer:


A supportive and professional working environment

100% remote role, ideal for professionals seeking EU market access without relocation

A strategic position in a solid, fast-scaling Swiss company

Competitive compensation and motivational development aligned with your capabilities and responsibilities


If you are interested and possess the above qualities, please send your CV and motivation letter in English ****** the subject line: CV - Data Analyst - [Your Name].


Important Note:Only applications from candidates residing in the specified region and strictly meeting the above criteria will be considered for this position.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Qualitest Group is looking for a talented Data Analyst!

Qualitest, the largest quality assurance company in the world, is recruiting employees for a localization/software testing project in partnership with one of the world‚Äôs largest tech providers.

If you are a passionate tech savvy person, with analytical, problem-solving, communication, organizational, and time management skills, you‚Äôre the one we‚Äôre looking for!

Responsibilities

  • Help coordinate work with client stakeholders;
  • Define project scope and objectives;
  • Develop and maintain project plans and timelines;
  • Support the management of technical teams and resources;
  • Identify and mitigate technical risks and issues;
  • Ensure the quality and delivery of technical solutions;
  • Track work progress and report to stakeholders.

Skills

  • Detail-oriented, organized, and able to work on multiple projects over the course of a day;
  • Proficiency (C1) in English;
  • Demonstrated ability to work independently;
  • PMP Certification is a Plus;
  • Excellent analytical skills, logical problem solving skills;
  • Creative, out-of-the-box thinking;
  • Experience troubleshooting complex problems;
  • Meticulously high level of attention to detail and accurate documentation of information;
  • Excellent interpersonal, communication and listening skills;
  • High level of cultural sensitivity and awareness to work effectively with diverse teams.

Ready to make a difference? Join the Qualitest Team!

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
At Bloq.it, we‚Äôve created the world‚Äôs leading smart locker solution. Solving online deliveries by enabling everyone to participate easily, reducing delivery costs and making them more sustainable.

We‚Äôre quickly expanding, and after growing at 1000% for three years in a row, we‚Äôre now the fastest-growing Smart Locker company in the world and one of the fastest growing scale-ups in Europe.

We are in search of a Data Analyst to join our innovative team as our new #bloqstar.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing

  • Collaborate with stakeholders to gather business requirements and deliver data-driven solutions aligned with organizational objectives;
  • Work closely with data engineers and business teams to address data challenges and provide recommendations based on analysis;
  • Extract, transform, and analyze data from Amazon Redshift, AWS S3 Data Lakes, and MongoDB Atlas, ensuring data accuracy and integrity;
  • Create insightful dashboards and reports using visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or AWS QuickSight to present actionable insights;
  • Tackle business ad-hoc requests by exploring data product solutions or retrieving data directly from golden sources to address immediate needs.

What You‚Äôll Bring To The Table

  • Minimum of 2 years of experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar analytical role;
  • Proficiency in SQL for querying and Python or R for data analysis and scripting;
  • Experience in data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or AWS QuickSight;
  • Strong communication skills to present insights clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences.

It Would Be Great If You Would Also Have

  • Knowledge of statistical modeling or machine learning techniques is a plus;
  • Familiarity with MongoDB Atlas, including querying NoSQL data.

Why join us?

  • The opportunity to join our Software team and play a pivotal role in contributing to innovative solutions that redefine Bloq.it's revolution in the smart locker industry ;
  • A dynamic and fast-paced work environment with a culture of innovation, collaboration, and continuous learning;
  • Competitive salary and flexible benefits package, tailored to your experience and skills ;
  • Eligibility for performance-based bonus, tied to your results and designed to reward your impact ;
  • Work how you work best - we offer a remote-friendly policy and flexible hours so you can stay productive and keep life balanced ;
  • Portuguese Health Insurance ;
  • Unlimited days off (subject to manager approval).

Ready to join the revolution?

At Bloq.it, we provide end-to-end solutions for Smart Lockers, and our software ecosystem, Bloq.it OS, is the leading tech solution available in the market.

We've had the pleasure of working with some of the biggest names in e-commerce, logistics, and retail in Europe, such as Vinted and DHL.

We have recently become the fastest-growing Smart Locker company in the world. Before Bloq.it the industry had stagnated and lacked innovation and good products. We strive to have the same impact in this industry as Tesla has had on the car industry.

We believe that Smart Lockers are a big part of the future for everyone, and we want to play our part in making sure that Smart Lockers become as mainstream as the mobile phone.

Title: Junior Power BI Consultant
Description:
Company Description

Inetum is a European leader in digital services. Inetum‚Äôs team of 28,000 consultants and specialists strive every day to make a digital impact for businesses, public sector entities and society. Inetum‚Äôs solutions aim at contributing to its clients‚Äô performance and innovation as well as the common good.

Present in 19 countries with a dense network of sites, Inetum partners with major software publishers to meet the challenges of digital transformation with proximity and flexibility.

Driven by its ambition for growth and scale, Inetum generated sales of 2.5 billion euros in 2023.

Job Description

We are looking for a Consultant for the Power BI solution, who will also act as the guarantor of Modern BI and Data Visualization best practices. This role is key to ensuring the technical excellence and strategic evolution of our BI ecosystem.

Key Responsibilities


Act as the go-to expert for Power BI, ensuring adherence to best practices in data visualization and modern BI.
Administer Power BI Services, including workspace organization, access rights, role and authorization management, and data encryption.
Optimize performance through data compression, partitioning, and aggregation strategies.
Design and maintain advanced data models and ensure alignment with broader data architecture.
Collaborate with business and technical stakeholders to understand needs and translate them into effective BI solutions.
Drive continuous improvement through bug fixes, enhancements, and technical quality assurance.


Qualifications


Experience with Power BI implementation.
Strong proficiency in DAX, SQL, and M (Power Query).
Deep understanding of data modeling and data architecture.
Experience with performance optimization techniques in Power BI.
Expertise in data visualization principles and storytelling with data.


Soft Skills


Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Comfortable interacting with both business and technical stakeholders.
Curious, proactive, and eager to stay up to date with BI trends and technologies.


Nice to Have


PL-300: Microsoft Power BI Data Analyst certification.
Experience with Google BigQuery.
Knowledge of Python and ETL tools.
Familiarity with Oracle Database and MongoDB.


Passionate about data, stunning visualizations, and cutting-edge tech? Join us and lead the way in transforming BI with Power BI!"
Show more

Title: Business Intelligence Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job


The Transaction Banking business concerns two fundamental business lines:
Cash Management: all products that assist our customers with their liquidity needs (current accounts, term deposits, payments & collections, forex)
Global Trade Solutions: all products that assist our customers with their global trade needs (letters of credit, guarantees, supply chain management, factoring)
The Business Intelligence Data Analyst‚Äôs main mission is to provide global support to the Multinational Corporates (MNCs) and Non-Banking Financial Institutions (NBFIs) fili√®re on all data related topics and contribute to the automation and industrialization of Transaction Banking (TB) Reporting.

Your Main Activities Are


Automate TB business dashboards as prototypes and prepare them to be put in production, working closely with the team¬¥s data analysts
Conduct ad-hoc analysis on MNCs and NBFIs and present findings to senior management and other stakeholders
Collect, clean and analyze large data sets from various sources to identify trends, patterns and insights
Ensure data accuracy and integrity by implementing data quality checks and validation processes
Identify opportunities for process improvements and recommend data-driven solutions


Profile And Skills To Success


Master‚Äôs degree in Mathematics and Statistics or Information Technology and Computer Science
Excellent communication skills and fluency in English, both oral and written
At least 2 years of experience in Data Analytics
Proficiency in Microsoft SQL server, Tableau or Power BI
Results driven mindset with an ability approach and the ability to synthetize


About The Team


The Global TB COO team assists the different business teams in multiple topics, both on daily and monthly needs, as in project mode, where the data analysts and scientists focus on data involved in the conception of data use cases from exploration phase up to production delivery


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centers providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

HTML:
About The Job

  • The Transaction Banking business concerns two fundamental business lines:
    • Cash Management: all products that assist our customers with their liquidity needs (current accounts, term deposits, payments & collections, forex)
    • Global Trade Solutions: all products that assist our customers with their global trade needs (letters of credit, guarantees, supply chain management, factoring)
  • The Business Intelligence Data Analyst‚Äôs main mission is to provide global support to the Multinational Corporates (MNCs) and Non-Banking Financial Institutions (NBFIs) fili√®re on all data related topics and contribute to the automation and industrialization of Transaction Banking (TB) Reporting.
Your Main Activities Are

  • Automate TB business dashboards as prototypes and prepare them to be put in production, working closely with the team¬¥s data analysts
  • Conduct ad-hoc analysis on MNCs and NBFIs and present findings to senior management and other stakeholders
  • Collect, clean and analyze large data sets from various sources to identify trends, patterns and insights
  • Ensure data accuracy and integrity by implementing data quality checks and validation processes
  • Identify opportunities for process improvements and recommend data-driven solutions

Profile And Skills To Success

  • Master‚Äôs degree in Mathematics and Statistics or Information Technology and Computer Science
  • Excellent communication skills and fluency in English, both oral and written
  • At least 2 years of experience in Data Analytics
  • Proficiency in Microsoft SQL server, Tableau or Power BI
  • Results driven mindset with an ability approach and the ability to synthetize

About The Team

  • The Global TB COO team assists the different business teams in multiple topics, both on daily and monthly needs, as in project mode, where the data analysts and scientists focus on data involved in the conception of data use cases from exploration phase up to production delivery

Why joining BNP Paribas?

  • Leading banking institution

BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.

  • Our presence in Portugal

In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centers providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.

  • International reach

Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions

  • Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
  • Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
  • Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
  • Diversity and Inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

  • Commitment towards work/life balance

At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.

  • Remote Working Conditions

At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Expleo is a trusted partner for your innovation journey. As a global engineering, technology and consulting service provider, we are ideally positioned to help you achieve your ambitions and future-proof your business. With a smart blend of bold thinking and reliable execution, we‚Äôre able to fast-track innovation through each step of your value chain.

We are strategically positioned to build value, with a global footprint across 30 countries.

We are as global and local as you need us to be, with strong best-in-class pan-European technological centres and unique best-shoring capabilities.

We leverage a network of high value-adding affiliates in consulting and industrial excellence, and leading partners across multiple sectors to provide you with the most comprehensive services and solutions in an ever-changing environment.

Essential Skills


Skilled in data visualization tools such as Power BI and Looker Studio to create clear, actionable reports and dashboards
Experience in Text Mining techniques to extract insights from unstructured data
Expertise in the full ETL process, ensuring data is clean, structured, and ready for analysis and decision-making
Strong working knowledge of GA4, providing in-depth insights into user behavior and marketing performance

The opportunity is remote but the candidate must already be living in PT.

Title: Growth Data Analyst
Description:
üìö TripleTen is a U.S.-based tech school internationally recognized for its excellence in education and transformative impact. We‚Äôre rapidly expanding in Brazil, helping more and more people break into the tech industry‚Äîregardless of where they‚Äôre starting from. We value talent, promote continuous learning, and offer real challenges that drive both personal and professional growth in a global and innovative environment.

We're looking for passionate analyst to help the team set up experiments and validate growth and marketing hypothesis in a fast-paces growth team in Brazil EdTech market.

What you will do:

Growth:


Identify growth opportunities through data analysis
Monitor conversion funnels from impression to enrollment completion
Execute A/B testing and analyze marketing experiments
Track qualified lead generation metrics (MQLs and SQLs)
Analyze user behavior and build end-to-end reporting to track it
Map customer journey and identify optimization opportunities


Marketing:


Conduct cohort analysis for different marketing segments
Analyze performance across channels (Google Ads, Facebook Ads, LinkedIn, SEO, email marketing)
Create attribution models to understand channel impact
Help marketing and sales departments to sync by clarifying pyramid of metrics
Support remarketing and nurturing strategies with data-driven insights
Create visualizations for ROI, ROAS, CAC (Customer Acquisition Cost), and LTV (Lifetime Value)
Present actionable insights for budget and strategy optimization
Develop and maintain daily marketing campaign dashboards using Tableau


Requirements:


Advanced English
Expertise in Tableau (dashboard creation, calculated fields, parameters, actions)
Proficiency in SQL or Python for marketing data extraction and manipulation
Familiarity with marketing automation tools (RD Station, HubSpot or Salesforce)
Knowledge of digital campaign analysis and performance metrics


What we can offer you:


100% remote work, with flexibility and work-life balance
Paid time off (vacation and national holidays)
Opportunity to make a real, direct impact on the company's results by actively contributing to our growth
A diverse, global team with people based in the U.S., Latin America, Brazil, Serbia, Georgia, and more than 10 other countries
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
CAPGEMINI ENGINEERING

At Capgemini Engineering, the world leader in engineering services, we bring together a global team of engineers, scientists, and architects to help the world‚Äôs most innovative companies unleash their potential. From autonomous cars to life-saving robots, our digital and software technology experts think outside the box as they provide unique R&D and engineering services across all industries. Join us for a career full of opportunities. Where you can make a difference. Where no two days are the same.

YOUR ROLE

As a Data Analyst at PMI, you will play a key role in transforming data into actionable insights that drive strategic decision-making across the organization. You will work with tools such as SQL, Excel, Power BI, and Tableau to analyze trends, define key performance indicators (KPIs) like model bias and accuracy, and support data quality initiatives.

Key Responsibilities:


Support Data Privacy Impact Assessments (DPIA) and Business System Owner (BSO) approvals.
Define and maintain business terms using Atlan for metadata management.
Design and implement data quality checks within DSH.
Reconcile source data with historical records using DPaaS.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure data integrity and alignment with business goals.
Present findings and insights in a clear, concise manner to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.


YOUR PROFILE


Proven experience with SQL and Business Intelligence tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau).
Strong proficiency in Excel and data visualization techniques.
Familiarity with data quality and metadata management tools such as Atlan, Snowflake, and DSH is a plus.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.
A proactive approach to problem-solving and continuous improvement.


What You‚Äôll Love About Working Here


Join a multicultural and inclusive team environment.
Enjoy a supportive atmosphere promoting work-life balance.
Hybrid work.
Your career growth is central to our mission. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professionals are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.
Access valuable training and certifications in cutting-edge technologies.
Engage in exciting national and international projects.
Health and life insurance.
Referral program with bonuses for talent recommendations.
Great office locations.


Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you‚Äôd like, where you‚Äôll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you‚Äôll be able to reimagine what‚Äôs possible. Join us and help the world‚Äôs leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.

Title: Power BI Consultant
Description:
Company Description

Inetum is a European leader in digital services. Inetum‚Äôs team of 28,000 consultants and specialists strive every day to make a digital impact for businesses, public sector entities and society. Inetum‚Äôs solutions aim at contributing to its clients‚Äô performance and innovation as well as the common good.

Present in 19 countries with a dense network of sites, Inetum partners with major software publishers to meet the challenges of digital transformation with proximity and flexibility.

Driven by its ambition for growth and scale, Inetum generated sales of 2.5 billion euros in 2023.

Job Description

We are looking for a Consultant for the Power BI solution, who will also act as the guarantor of Modern BI and Data Visualization best practices. This role is key to ensuring the technical excellence and strategic evolution of our BI ecosystem.

Key Responsibilities


Act as the go-to expert for Power BI, ensuring adherence to best practices in data visualization and modern BI.
Administer Power BI Services, including workspace organization, access rights, role and authorization management, and data encryption.
Optimize performance through data compression, partitioning, and aggregation strategies.
Design and maintain advanced data models and ensure alignment with broader data architecture.
Collaborate with business and technical stakeholders to understand needs and translate them into effective BI solutions.
Drive continuous improvement through bug fixes, enhancements, and technical quality assurance.


Qualifications


2/3 years of hands-on experience with Power BI implementation.
Strong proficiency in DAX, SQL, and M (Power Query).
Deep understanding of data modeling and data architecture.
Experience with performance optimization techniques in Power BI.
Expertise in data visualization principles and storytelling with data.


Soft Skills


Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Comfortable interacting with both business and technical stakeholders.
Curious, proactive, and eager to stay up to date with BI trends and technologies.


Nice to Have


PL-300: Microsoft Power BI Data Analyst certification.
Experience with Google BigQuery.
Knowledge of Python and ETL tools.
Familiarity with Oracle Database and MongoDB.


Passionate about data, stunning visualizations, and cutting-edge tech? Join us and lead the way in transforming BI with Power BI!"

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Who We Are

At VML, we are a beacon of innovation and growth in an ever-evolving world. Our heritage is built upon a century of combined expertise, where creativity meets technology, and diverse perspectives ignite inspiration. With the merger of VMLY&R and Wunderman Thompson, we have forged a new path as a growth partner that is part creative agency, part consultancy, and part technology powerhouse.

Our global family now encompasses over 30,000 employees across 150+ offices in 64 markets, each contributing to a culture that values connection, belonging, and the power of differences. Our expertise spans the entire customer journey, offering deep insights in communications, commerce, consultancy, CRM, CX, data, production, and technology. We deliver end-to-end solutions that result in revolutionary work.

Who We're Looking For

We are seeking a talented and detail-oriented Data Analyst with up to 3 years of experience to join our growing team. This role is ideal for someone passionate about turning complex data into actionable insights that support strategic decision-making. You will thrive in collaborative environments, demonstrate analytical thinking, and communicate clearly with both technical and non-technical stakeholders. A strong interest in the energy sector and digital behavior analytics will be key to success in this role.

What You'll Do


Collect, clean, and analyze data from various sources to support business decisions.
Develop and maintain dashboards and interactive reports using Power BI and Looker Studio.
Monitor and interpret digital behavior using Google Analytics 4 (GA4).
Work collaboratively with cross-functional teams to support business strategies with data-driven insights.


Who You Are


A data-driven professional with a knack for transforming data into meaningful insights.
A collaborative team player with a keen analytical mindset.
Eager to grow and contribute to impactful projects in the energy industry.
Comfortable communicating complex ideas clearly to varied audiences.


What You'll Need


Up to 3 years of experience in data analytics.
Proficiency with GA4, Power BI, and Looker Studio (required).
Previous experience in the energy sector (required).
Familiarity with Google Tag Manager is a plus.
Fluency in English (written and spoken).
Spanish language skills are a strong plus.


Bonus Points If You Have


Experience working in international or multicultural environments.
A commitment to continuous learning and skill development.
An ability to connect data insights to broader business opportunities.


We believe the best work happens when we're together, fostering creativity, collaboration, and connection. That's why we‚Äôve adopted a hybrid approach, with teams in the office an average of four days a week. If you require accommodations or flexibility, please discuss this with the hiring team during the interview process.

WPP (VML) is an equal opportunity employer and considers applicants for all positions without discrimination or regard to characteristics. We are committed to fostering a culture of respect in which everyone feels they belong and has the same opportunities to progress in their careers.

VML is a WPP Agency. For more information, please visit our website, and follow VML on our social channels via Instagram,‚ÄØLinkedIn, and‚ÄØX.

When you click "Submit Application", this will send any information you add below to VML. Before you do this, we think it's a good idea to read through our Recruitment Privacy Policy. California residents should read our California Recruitment Privacy Notice. This explains what we do with your personal data when you apply for a role with us, and, how you can update the information you have provided us with or how to remove it.

Title: Data Analyst at Boost inc (B2B Tech)
Description:
At A Glance

We‚Äôre one of the fastest-growing companies in unattended retail tech - 150+ people, 5 countries, hundreds of customers, and a product that‚Äôs redefining how the world shops.

We are looking for an experienced Data Analyst to join our growing data team.

We‚Äôre looking for someone who thrives in a scale-up environment and enjoys structuring and managing BI platforms by implementing data governance principles to ensure consistency, reliability, and secure access.

As our data analyst, you will play a key role in supporting Boostbar (our fast-growing operator in Switzerland) as well as Boost inc‚Äôs technology teams. You will turn data into actionable insights for both internal and external stakeholders.

What You'll Do


Collaborate cross-functionally with operations, sales, category management, and finance teams to understand business needs and translate them into robust analytical solutions.
Serve as a bridge between business and data teams, gathering requirements, defining technical specs, and ensuring alignment throughout projects.
Develop and maintain BI dashboards and reports to support strategic and operational decision-making across the organisation.
Work with data and ML engineers to ensure data quality and to operationalise insights (e.g., forecasting, recommendations), while proactively identifying KPIs, trends, and growth opportunities through effective data storytelling.


What You'll Bring


Strong analytical background, with experience in BI tools (e.g., Tableau, Superset) and a proven ability to translate business needs into actionable data solutions.
Skilled in managing dashboards as data products, ensuring quality, usability, and clear documentation.
Excellent communicator, fluent in English, with a track record of collaborating effectively across cross-functional teams.
Bonus points for Python skills, experience with cloud-based platforms like Databricks, background in retail/FMCG/vending, and additional language proficiency (especially German or other European languages).


Why Join Us


Exceptional learning opportunities. You will be part of a fast growing scale-up with a dynamic team, with the opportunity to learn from a highly talented group of people and have a real impact across the company.
The chance to work at the intersection of technology and operations, influencing critical business decisions.
Offices in Zurich, London, and 4 other countries - but no office politics
The usual: budget for personal development


About Us

Boost inc is a global leader in unattended retail technology, redefining traditional vending by transforming it into modern, digital retail experiences. Headquartered in Switzerland, with a dedicated technology hub in the UK, our team of over 150 professionals works across Zurich, London, and offices in four additional countries. Since our founding, we‚Äôve empowered more than 400 customers across Europe and beyond - including vending operators, OEMs, and consumer brands - with cutting-edge solutions designed to drive operational efficiency, business growth, and engaging consumer experiences.

Here you can find more information:

www.boostinc.com / www.boostbar.ch

Title: Data Market Analyst ‚Äì Business Planning
Description:
Imagine a world with zero vehicle accidents, zero vehicle emissions, and wireless vehicle connectivity all around us. Every day, we move closer to making that world a reality. Aptiv‚Äôs passionate team of engineers and developers creates advanced safety systems, high-performance electrification solutions and data connectivity solutions so that automakers can bring advanced capabilities to more people around the globe. This is how we enable sustainable mobility and help to prevent accidents caused by human error.

Want to join us?

Your role:


Conduct internal planning data analysis, transform data into knowledge to provide input for decision, compare data with Market industry-level to support operational and strategic initiatives.
Monitor market share, competitive intelligence, product development trends and EDS portfolio to support market positioning reports.
Align data analysis with company‚Äôs strategic direction. Initiate and support market research and competitor analysis by developing automatization of different data sources.
Collaborate with external research and consulting firms to provide insights to internal functions and leadership.
Participate in customer studies and market environment analysis.
Maintain up-to-date understanding of the EMEA wiring harness market, including key drivers such as electrification, regulatory shifts, consumer behavior, and regional trends.
Contribute to general business planning tasks as needed and support Commercial Teams in regards current and future business.


Your Background


Graduate or Master's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field
Strong proficiency in SQL, Microsoft Excel, and Power BI.
Working knowledge of SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS).
Excellent command of office applications, including PowerPoint and Excel.
Familiarity with Automotive product portfolios and market forecasting.
Experience in market research, data analysis, or a related function.
Fluent in English, with strong written and verbal communication skills.
Able to perform under pressure, work collaboratively, and meet deadlines.


Nice To Have Skills


Experience with VBA, Power Query, Power Pivot, or Power Automate.
Automotive supplier background or direct exposure to manufacturing and business planning in the automotive sector.


Why join us?


You can grow at Aptiv. Aptiv provides an inclusive work environment where all individuals can grow and develop, regardless of gender, ethnicity or beliefs.
You can have an impact. Safety is a core Aptiv value; we want a safer world for us and our children, one with: Zero fatalities, Zero injuries, Zero accidents.
You have support. We ensure you have the resources and support you need to take care of your family and your physical and mental health with a competitive health insurance package.


Privacy Notice - Active Candidates: https://www.aptiv.com/privacy-notice-active-candidates

Aptiv is an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

Title: Power BI Consultant
Description:
Company Description

Inetum is a European leader in digital services. Inetum‚Äôs team of 28,000 consultants and specialists strive every day to make a digital impact for businesses, public sector entities and society. Inetum‚Äôs solutions aim at contributing to its clients‚Äô performance and innovation as well as the common good.

Present in 19 countries with a dense network of sites, Inetum partners with major software publishers to meet the challenges of digital transformation with proximity and flexibility.

Driven by its ambition for growth and scale, Inetum generated sales of 2.5 billion euros in 2023.

Job Description

We are looking for a Consultant for the Power BI solution, who will also act as the guarantor of Modern BI and Data Visualization best practices. This role is key to ensuring the technical excellence and strategic evolution of our BI ecosystem.

Key Responsibilities


Lead the implementation and evolution of the Power BI solution across the organization.
Act as the go-to expert for Power BI, ensuring adherence to best practices in data visualization and modern BI.
Administer Power BI Services, including workspace organization, access rights, role and authorization management, and data encryption.
Optimize performance through data compression, partitioning, and aggregation strategies.
Design and maintain advanced data models and ensure alignment with broader data architecture.
Collaborate with business and technical stakeholders to understand needs and translate them into effective BI solutions.
Drive continuous improvement through bug fixes, enhancements, and technical quality assurance.


Qualifications


5+ years of hands-on experience with Power BI implementation.
Strong proficiency in DAX, SQL, and M (Power Query).
Deep understanding of data modeling and data architecture.
Experience with performance optimization techniques in Power BI.
Expertise in data visualization principles and storytelling with data.
Fluency in English and French (B1/B2).


Soft Skills


Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Comfortable interacting with both business and technical stakeholders.
Curious, proactive, and eager to stay up to date with BI trends and technologies.


Nice to Have


PL-300: Microsoft Power BI Data Analyst certification.
Experience with Google BigQuery.
Knowledge of Python and ETL tools.
Familiarity with Oracle Database and MongoDB.


Passionate about data, stunning visualizations, and cutting-edge tech? Join us and lead the way in transforming BI with Power BI!"

Title: Data Analytics and Business Intelligence Senior (M/W)
Description:
Company Description

VANTIVA, headquartered in Paris, France and formerly known as Technicolor, is a global technology leader in designing, developing and supplying innovative products and solutions that connect consumers around the world to the content and services they love ‚Äì whether at home, at work or in other smart spaces.

VANTIVA has also earned a solid reputation for optimizing supply chain performance by leveraging its decades-long expertise in high-precision manufacturing, logistics, fulfilment and distribution. With operations throughout the Americas, Asia Pacific and EMEA, VANTIVA is recognized as a strategic partner by leading firms across various vertical industries, including network service providers, software companies and video game creators for over 25 years.

Our relationships with the film and entertainment industry goes back over 100 years by providing end-to-end solutions for our clients. VANTIVA is committed to the highest standards of corporate social responsibility and sustainability across all aspects of their operations.

For more information, please visit www.vantiva.com

Job Description

The BI expert will contribute to all aspects of BI development, covering Vantiva applications and supporting the implementation of the data strategy roadmap.

This role is critical in designing, developing, and maintaining data warehousing, reporting solutions, and BI applications. It requires a strong foundation in business intelligence, analytics, and functional expertise to interpret business requirements effectively.

The candidate will drive solution design, customization, and development to resolve issues, enhance existing solutions, and deliver new business intelligence capabilities.

The ideal candidate thrives in complex technical environments, enjoys problem-solving, and is passionate about data and analytics.

Key Responsibilities


Align and implement data architecture to support data analytics, reporting needs, and business planning requirements.
Ensure BI system health and performance by proposing, implementing, and monitoring best practices.
Maintain data reliability across all layers of the data platform and satellite systems.
Develop best practices for data visualization, dashboarding, planning, analytics, and application architecture.
Conduct root cause analysis and provide recommendations to leadership to mitigate risks and improve efficiency.
Ensure compliance with core solution principles and industry regulations for data handling and reporting.
Implement and maintain data security measures to protect sensitive information.
Handle user support requests, prioritizing them based on business impact.
Perform necessary system configurations and developments as needed.
Collaborate extensively with business stakeholders to understand reporting & analytics needs and deliver solutions that meet their requirements.


Qualifications


Highly motivated, proactive, and a self-starter with a strong sense of ownership.
Strong experience in analyzing, diagnosing, designing, planning, executing, and evaluating BI solutions while meeting time, cost, and quality targets.
Excellent verbal and written communication, interpersonal, and documentation skills.
10+ years of experience in data foundation, data management, data governance, and insights generation.
Senior-level expertise in SAP BI architecture and development tools, with a focus on BW/4HANA.
Hands-on experience with BW/4HANA, IP/BPC, SAC, BODS, BOBJ (Webi), and Analysis for Excel.
Exposure to HANA administration, including data provisioning, data tiering, security, and performance optimization.
Proficiency in ABAP development is required (programs, functions, object classes, WebDynpro).
Strong SQL skills with experience in query performance tuning.
Knowledge of MS Power BI, Azure Data Lake, and Data Factory is an advantage.
Databricks experience is a strong plus completed by a proficiency in Python.


Additional Information

The position is located in Lisbon, Portugal.

Our most important asset is our People

Vantiva‚Äôs success greatly relies on our people‚Äôs energy, motivation, and talent.

We are dedicated to cultivating a workforce that embraces and celebrates diversity as we believe our differences drive our creativity, and innovation.

We are proactive in supporting equality and maintaining an inclusive work environment, developing, and enhancing career opportunities for all.

If you require a reasonable accommodation at any step of the application process, please let us know by answering the dedicated question in this application form.
