Title: BI/Data Tester
HTML:
Main Tasks And Responsibilities

Noesis is looking for professionals whith the following profile:

  • Develop and execute comprehensive test plans for data products;
  • Identify and document defects, and work with developers and analysts to ensure timely resolution;
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure data quality, consistency, and accuracy across the organization;
  • Create and maintain test data and test cases;
  • Monitor and report on test results, including defect tracking and resolution status;
  • Conduct root cause analysis on defects and provide recommendations for improvement;
  • Ensure adherence to best practices and standards for testing, data governance, and data management;
  • Provide input into the design and development of data warehouse and BI solutions, with a focus on testing and quality assurance;
  • Continuously learn and stay up-to-date on industry trends and technologies related to testing and data analytics;
  • Contribute to the development and maintenance of automated data testing scripts and frameworks where applicable;

Profile

  • Strong understanding of data warehousing and BI concepts and technologies (at least 3 years of experience in BI/data testing or related field);
  • Experience with SQL and data validation;
  • Experience with data visualisation tools such as Tableau, Power BI;
  • Experience in data migration projects is a plus;
  • Experience with testing tools (e.g., HP ALM, JIRA, or similar);
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills;
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills;
  • Ability to work independently and in a team environment;
  • Strong attention to detail and ability to multitask;
  • Great English communication skills, both written and spoken;

Location: Lisboa, Porto, Coimbra, Guarda, Covilh√£ or Castelo Branco

If you meet these requirements and are interested in joining an audacious and innovative company, please send us your application.

Join us. Let‚Äôs innovate together!

All our recruitment and selection processes are based on equal opportunities, valuing the competence and potential of each person and ensuring that no candidate is discriminated on the grounds of gender, ethnicity, sexual orientation, age, religion or physical condition.

  • Job advertisement under Law nr 4 / 2019, of 10th January

Title: eBusiness Analyst Trainee
Description:
Your Main Activities Are

AI And Data Management Project Management


Help Drive AI Projects related to automatization of pricings for Structured Products
Engage with the sales teams to collect feedbacks and areas of improvement
Understand client requests and help improve the AI translator abilities
Troubleshoot errors
Help develop tools to process and analyse large amounts of unstructured data for monitoring purposes
Read model calibration results and be able to have a critical opinion
Produce KPIs on the project status for top management


Business Support


Investigate and resolve issues across all BNP Paribas electronic products and services, ensuring a quick and effective resolution
Ensure clients are connected, having the ability to price and to trade at all times
Using data-mining analysis tools to identify issues
Provide business support & training to several teams and ensure the proper usage of the platform
Assist users in finding alternatives to automate their pricing needs


Communication


Propose and create new marketing materials to promote the platform and new features
Ensure the information available in the platform regarding existing/new features are up to date
Client Engagement Activities: Monitor new client activity, monitor dormant clients and users and conduct reactivation campaigns


Profile And Skills To Success


Academic background in Engineering, Mathematics, Finance, Economics or similar areas
An overall understanding and interest in the financial world
Fluency in English
Excellent communication skills and client focus
Strong team work while being able to work autonomously
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Ability to work under tight deadlines and organisational skills
Strong Excel knowledge
Interest in AI related projects


About The Team

Electronic Client Solutions (ECS) is a global team within the COO group, with teams based in London, Lisbon, New York and Singapore, ECS represents the backbone of BNP Paribas‚Äôs Electronic trading offering.

Its core function is to provide a single point of contact for Client queries for all our Electronic products and services. ECS supports Clients, Trading venues and external counterparties, is responsible for Client enablement, Client Support and vendor relationships across all our Ecommerce platforms.

Responsibilities

ECS supports BNP PARIBAS clients on Single dealer and Multi dealer platforms in conjunction with Sales and Trading. Its responsibilities fall into three main business/product lines organised respectively into three sub-teams:


FX Cash / Options / Algos / Commodities
Fixed Income ‚Äì Rates / Credit / Structured Products / Derivatives
Structured Products / Derivatives


ECS are a critical component of Electronic Business & Markets group, providing the highest level of service to our external and internal clients to position BNP Paribas as a leading provider of Electronic Markets solutions.

Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centers providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Analyst Trainee - Real Assets
Description:
About The Job


Data is a strategic asset for BNP Paribas. It plays a fundamental role in the analysis of the teams‚Äô performance and evolution ultimately allowing to become more efficient and to contribute to the sustainability of the business model and the accurate selection of the bank‚Äôs assets. To be in control of data is crucial to enhance risk management, to reach right credit decisions and bring added value to the business
Based in Lisbon, the Trainee will join a team of professionals who are known for their sectorial knowledge and support the team


Your Main Activities Are


Input missing data on credit files for presentation to the Credit Committee
Ensure accuracy of credit data
Ensure consistency of data between different credit files
Communicate with the CPM Credit Analyst Teams aiming to get updates on progress of credit files
Ensure proper understanding of credit files to identify structured data to be inputted
Create and maintain standard procedures for data input (user guides)
Cooperate and communicate with the teams in charge of the golden source systems to ensure correct data in the source system
Produce periodic reports based on data collected and captured, providing clear analysis and interpretation


Profile And Skills To Success


Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Economics, Accounting or Management
Detail oriented with deep interest in data
Good knowledge of Excel
Good written/verbal communication skills in English (mandatory)
Ability to collaborate / teamwork
Efficient organizational and planning capacities
Self-starter, good initiative and flexible


About The Team


The Real Assets team includes a Coverage Relationship & Origination team, a Transaction & Execution team and a Credit Portfolio Management Team (CPM) spread across several countries serving the sector client in EMEA. These teams are split across Transportation (Shipping & Offshore, Aviation, Rail), Real Estate, Energy, Recourses & Infrastructure (ERI), Export, Leasing & Alternative Structuring. This transversality aims to provide a common training path, opportunities to explore other sectors, more efficiency and greater mobility


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centers providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Visualization Specialist
Description:
About The Job


We are seeking a talented Senior Data Visualization Expert to join the CIB Human Resources team. As a Senior Data Visualization Expert, you will play a crucial role in transforming complex HR data into clear and actionable insights through visually compelling representations. Your work will empower our HR teams to make data-driven decisions that drive the success of our organization


Your Main Activities Are


Data Visualization: Create visually appealing and interactive data visualizations, including charts, graphs, dashboards, and reports, using tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar platforms
Storytelling: Translate data findings into compelling narratives to convey insights effectively to HR and organizational stakeholders
Data Analysis: Analyse large volumes of HR data to identify trends, patterns, and areas for improvement
Data Integration: Collaborate with the HR and IT teams to integrate and maintain data sources to ensure data accuracy and completeness. Play a key role in sprint planning and contribute in daily standup meetings to ensure on time delivery of new developments
Data Quality Assurance: Implement data validation and quality control procedures to ensure data accuracy and reliability
User Training: Train HR staff on interpreting and using visualized data for informed decision-making
Project Collaboration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to support HR-related projects and initiative
Stay Current: Keep up-to-date with industry best practices and emerging data visualization tools and techniques
Provide end user support and follow up with IT teams on any production incidents/issues and ensure they are resolved in a timely manor


Profile And Skills To Success


Masters Degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field
At least 3 years of experience in data analysis and visualization, preferably in a Human Resources context
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Data driven mindset / exploratory data analysis
Proficiency with data visualization tools such as Tableau and Power BI
Excellent communication and presentation skills
Ability to work collaboratively in a team and meet project deadlines
Flexibility: ability to work in a changing environment
Project management skills
Facilitate problem solving & collaboration


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

About The Job

  • We are seeking a talented Senior Data Visualization Expert to join the CIB Human Resources team. As a Senior Data Visualization Expert, you will play a crucial role in transforming complex HR data into clear and actionable insights through visually compelling representations. Your work will empower our HR teams to make data-driven decisions that drive the success of our organization

Your Main Activities Are

  • Data Visualization: Create visually appealing and interactive data visualizations, including charts, graphs, dashboards, and reports, using tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar platforms
  • Storytelling: Translate data findings into compelling narratives to convey insights effectively to HR and organizational stakeholders
  • Data Analysis: Analyse large volumes of HR data to identify trends, patterns, and areas for improvement
  • Data Integration: Collaborate with the HR and IT teams to integrate and maintain data sources to ensure data accuracy and completeness. Play a key role in sprint planning and contribute in daily standup meetings to ensure on time delivery of new developments
  • Data Quality Assurance: Implement data validation and quality control procedures to ensure data accuracy and reliability
  • User Training: Train HR staff on interpreting and using visualized data for informed decision-making
  • Project Collaboration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to support HR-related projects and initiative

Title: Client Services & Data Analyst Internship
Description:
Keywords: Capital Markets, FX, FI, EQD, Structured Products, Rates, Credits, e-Commerce, Data Analytics, Client Support

Your Main Activities Are

Client Enablement


Responsible for managing and implementing all Client/User Enablement requests to BNP Paribas electronic trading platforms including our Single dealer Platform (Cortex Suites, Smart Derivatives), Multi Dealer platforms such as Bloomberg, Tradeweb, FXall, 360t and FIX API Connections
Relationship with other departments - Sales, Trading and IT Support Teams to manage the configuration of Pricing and Client margin across various platforms


Business Support


Resolve issues across all BNP Paribas electronic products and services, ensuring a quick and effective resolution
Ensure clients are connected, being priced and able to trade at all times
Monitor the status of all systems and electronic trade flows
Using data-mining analysis tools to identify issues
Provide business support to Trading & Sales
Working closely with IT, Credit Risk, Legal, Compliance, etc.


Pricing Configuration


Manage all pricing and tier changes for Sales and Trading in the respective gateways
Manage price controls and limits across all products, ensuring all changes are properly controlled and approved prior to implementation


EBusiness Optimisation


Client Engagement Activities: monitor new client activity as well as dormant clients and users, follow up on credit and limit issues
Conduct client feedback surveys to ensure ECS is meeting customer expectations, improving service levels and product development as needed.
Record all Client Engagement activities in our ecommerce CRM tool to ensure accurate and meaningful MIS around Client Engagement
Constantly review manual process and suggest new operating models to improve efficiency


Profile And Skills To Success


Academic background in Engineering, Mathematics, Finance, Economics or similar areas
An overall understanding and interest in the financial world
Fluency in English
Excellent communication skills and client focus
Strong team work while being able to work autonomously
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Ability to work under tight deadlines and organisational skills
Strong Excel knowledge
Python and other IT coding Skills - (Intermediate)


About The Team

Electronic Client Solutions (ECS) is a global team within the COO group, with teams based in London, Lisbon, New York and Singapore, ECS represents the backbone of BNP Paribas's Electronic trading offering.

Its core function is to provide a single point of contact for Client queries for all our Electronic products and services. ECS supports Clients, Trading venues and external counterparties, is responsible for Client enablement, Client Support and vendor relationships across all our Ecommerce platforms.

Responsibilities

ECS supports BNP PARIBAS clients on Single dealer and Multi dealer platforms in conjunction with Sales and Trading. Its responsibilities fall into three main business/product lines organised respectively into three sub-teams:


FX Cash / Options / Algos / Commodities
Fixed Income - Rates / Credit / Structured Products / Derivatives
Structured Products / Derivatives


ECS are a critical component of Electronic Business & Markets group, providing the highest level of service to our external and internal clients to position BNP Paribas as a leading provider of Electronic Markets solutions.

Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.

Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centers providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.

Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.

Title: Junior Data Engineer Graduate Program
HTML:
Role Overview

We are seeking an enthusiastic and aspiring Junior Data Engineer to join our growing data team. In this entry-level role, you will have the opportunity to learn and contribute to building, maintaining, and optimizing our data infrastructure, with a strong emphasis on DataOps principles. You will work closely with data analysts and other engineers, learning to ensure the reliability, scalability, and security of our data pipelines.

Key Responsibilities

  • Translate the business requirements into technical specifications, in cooperation with the data product owner;
  • Design, develop, and maintain robust and scalable data pipelines using Airflow;
  • Utilize dbt for data transformation and modeling, ensuring data quality and consistency;
  • Employ Terraform for infrastructure as code (IaC), automating the provisioning and management of our data infrastructure;
  • Implement and maintain CI/CD pipelines for data engineering workflows;
  • Monitor and troubleshoot data pipeline performance, identifying and resolving bottlenecks;
  • Implement data quality checks and monitoring to ensure data accuracy and reliability;
  • Contribute to the development of data engineering best practices and standards;
  • Manage and maintain data repositories using Git;
  • Automate data-related tasks to improve efficiency and reduce manual effort;
  • Cooperate with the support teams and provide L3 support to comply with predefined SLA‚Äôs.

Key Qualifications

  • University degree in computer science, engineering, or a comparable field;
  • Strong academic record with coursework or projects related to data engineering, databases, or software development;
  • Familiarity with data warehousing concepts and technologies;
  • Strong foundational knowledge and proficiency in Python and SQL, or a strong willingness to develop these skills rapidly;
  • Exposure to Google Cloud Platform (GCP) data services (e.g., BigQuery, Cloud Storage), dbt, Terraform, and Git through academic projects or personal exploration;
  • Strong problem-solving and analytical skills;
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills;
  • Eagerness to learn and a strong passion for data engineering.

Title: Data Engineer
HTML:
Description

Who is Defined.ai? Well, from a technical point of view, we leverage the power of a global crowd to provide some of the world‚Äôs biggest companies with the high-quality data they need to power their artificial intelligence. We‚Äôre instrumental to the progression and development of artificial intelligence and we couldn‚Äôt be prouder or more inspired to be involved in an industry that is changing the world.

From a personal point of view, we‚Äôre a group of big thinkers, high achievers and creative problem solvers. We bond over our shared love of software engineering, data science, and strong coffee. We like online gaming, running marathons, and team drinks. We celebrate authenticity and diversity and we‚Äôre invested in what we do. Our mission? World domination, obviously!

What will you do?

  • Design and implement scalable PySpark-based data pipelines to process (clean, validate, package and deliver) multimodal AI training datasets (e.g., text, audio, video, images, etc.);
  • Develop ETL pipelines to fuel the Operations areas with data for their analytical dashboards;
  • Set software engineering tools, platforms, and best practices while performing trade-off analysis to best match engineering, product, and project constraints and expectations;
  • Operate data pipelines to ingest data from multiple sources, and deliver it to different destinations.
  • Help the Product Manager and stakeholders in structuring, breaking down, and prioritizing the product roadmap into backlog work items;
  • Collaborate with other software engineering teams such as SREs and DevOps to achieve your team‚Äôs goals;
  • Work together with Software Engineering teams so as to integrate the Data Platform with other tools and platforms.

Who are we looking for?

Do you have the drive to work in an innovative and ambitious environment?

We‚Äôre looking for someone with a determined and proactive mindset, someone inspired and passionate to help us achieve our goals. Our successful candidate is a strong critical thinker, reliable and transparent, with an ability to learn and communicate. We are looking for someone special to contribute to our unique culture.

  • BSc or MSc in Computer Science or similar background;
  • Minimum of 3 years of experience;
  • Experience in PySpark-based data pipelines and software quality best practices;
  • Worked with Azure services such as Synapse Analytics (mainly PySpark Jobs, Pipelines, and Notebooks), ADLS, Power BI, DevOps, and SQL and NoSQL databases;
  • Solid understanding of data-related architectures, concepts, technologies, and processes (e.g., Medallion, Data Lake, Data Lakehouse, Data Warehouse, ETL, etc.);
  • Comfortable with evaluating and applying software design and architectural patterns/principles;
  • Knowledge of RESTful APIs based on FastAPI, from the provider as well as the consumer point of view;
  • Problem Solving skills;
  • Proficient in both written and spoken English.

Benefits

You spend a lot of your time at work, so it should be challenging, fun and interesting. At Defined.ai it will be all of those things and more. Here‚Äôs what we offer:

  • Flexible working schedule and hybrid model. We know comfort can boost creativity and performance, so you can manage your schedule and work both from one of our modern office spaces or home.
  • Excellent career development opportunities in a high growth company. With us, you can accomplish your career goals and follow a well-described career path with the support of your supervisor.
  • Culture of feedback and continuous improvement. AI is a fast-paced area, so we keep track of tech trends, and we always ask for feedback.
  • An international and diverse team. We have more than 30 nationalities at our 3 locations, and we provide language classes.
  • Continuous training opportunities. You can choose from many options: leveraging hand-on workshops, unlimited access to Udemy and formal development opportunities.
  • We love to have fun together. We joke a lot, and we can't imagine work without fun activities ‚Äì we already surfed, raced carts and played soccer together.

About Us

Defined.ai offers a platform with multiple data delivery options that leverages machine learning technology and human intelligence to deliver quality-guaranteed training data for AI systems. The platform offers self-service and fully customizable solutions that deliver high-quality project-specific training data, enabling AI products reach market quicker. It is this business model that has allowed Defined.ai to raise a total of $63.6M in funding over 4 rounds. Our value proposition is quality, privacy, speed and scale, covering more than 50 different languages. With strong expertise in speech and natural language processing technologies, we have been serving AI companies and Fortune 500 companies since day one. Defined.ai was founded in Seattle and has offices in Lisbon and Porto.

Title: Capital Portfolio Management Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job


The Resource & Portfolio Management (RPM) Team is part of the Securitised Product Group (SPG), which combines all securitisation and other risk distribution activities within Global Banking EMEA ‚Äì Capital Markets
The Securitisation Trade Manager is responsible for the booking of transactions and the management of their cash flows (calculation, monitoring of payments, etc.) and for their correct regulatory Capital calculation in the systems, to achieve optimum Capital savings for the bank
Acting as a point of contact with investors during the life of the transaction, as well as for regulatory reporting, the Securitisation Trade Manager will develop expertise in transaction management (Securitisation, SRT, Credit Default Swap, Credit Insurance) and most importantly in regulatory Capital of the Bank
The Candidate will work with data to assess the Capital savings on the transactions under management and should have an interest in learning Python/SQL languages. The Candidate will also be key to ensure that all the contractual commitments related to Resources & Portfolio Management transactions are fulfilled


Your Main Activities Are


Advisory role in pre-trade phase by actively liaising with the Origination and Structuring team, to assess the feasibility of a transaction
Booking of transactions in Front-Office systems
Perform monitoring and payment of invoices to Third Parties (Investors, Brokers and Insurers)
Calculate the correct Capital savings by ensuring the right Risk-Weighted Assets (RWA) are calculated during the quarterly Capital process
Perform quarterly updates of the capital structure of existing programs and quarterly coupon computation and validation, following instructions of underlying flow of funds
Identify claims based on rating triggers in underlying portfolios
Perform reporting to Validation Agent, Investors, Regulators, and internal stakeholders, acting as a point of contact for questions related to existing portfolios


Profile And Skills To Success


Master's degree in Engineering, Finance, Maths or Economics
Up to 3 years of relevant experience
Interest in VBA, Python, or data analytics tools such as SQL
Fluency in English both oral and written (mandatory)
Advanced knowledge of Office package (Excel)


#Hybrid

Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centers providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.
Show more
HTML:
About The Job

  • The Resource & Portfolio Management (RPM) Team is part of the Securitised Product Group (SPG), which combines all securitisation and other risk distribution activities within Global Banking EMEA ‚Äì Capital Markets
  • The Securitisation Trade Manager is responsible for the booking of transactions and the management of their cash flows (calculation, monitoring of payments, etc.) and for their correct regulatory Capital calculation in the systems, to achieve optimum Capital savings for the bank
  • Acting as a point of contact with investors during the life of the transaction, as well as for regulatory reporting, the Securitisation Trade Manager will develop expertise in transaction management (Securitisation, SRT, Credit Default Swap, Credit Insurance) and most importantly in regulatory Capital of the Bank
  • The Candidate will work with data to assess the Capital savings on the transactions under management and should have an interest in learning Python/SQL languages. The Candidate will also be key to ensure that all the contractual commitments related to Resources & Portfolio Management transactions are fulfilled

Your Main Activities Are

  • Advisory role in pre-trade phase by actively liaising with the Origination and Structuring team, to assess the feasibility of a transaction
  • Booking of transactions in Front-Office systems
  • Perform monitoring and payment of invoices to Third Parties (Investors, Brokers and Insurers)
  • Calculate the correct Capital savings by ensuring the right Risk-Weighted Assets (RWA) are calculated during the quarterly Capital process
  • Perform quarterly updates of the capital structure of existing programs and quarterly coupon computation and validation, following instructions of underlying flow of funds
  • Identify claims based on rating triggers in underlying portfolios
  • Perform reporting to Validation Agent, Investors, Regulators, and internal stakeholders, acting as a point of contact for questions related to existing portfolios

Profile And Skills To Success

  • Master's degree in Engineering, Finance, Maths or Economics
  • Up to 3 years of relevant experience
  • Interest in VBA, Python, or data analytics tools such as SQL
  • Fluency in English both oral and written (mandatory)
  • Advanced knowledge of Office package (Excel)

#Hybrid

Title: IoT Data Eng and Analyst
Description:
Join Us

At Vodafone, we‚Äôre not just shaping the future of connectivity for our customers ‚Äì we‚Äôre shaping the future for everyone who joins our team. When you work with us, you‚Äôre part of a global mission to connect people, solve complex challenges, and create a sustainable and more inclusive world. If you want to grow your career whilst finding the perfect balance between work and life, Vodafone offers the opportunities to help you belong and make a real impact.

What You‚Äôll Do


Take ownership and accountability of Analytics Data Pipeline data Modelling and design solutions for (IoT) Analytics and BI projects
Help facilitate discussions and conflict resolution, alternatives or different approaches & ensure no impact on the delivery of projects
Manage stakeholders and vendor interfaces as required for technical delivery and report on project progress & activities



Who You Are


BSc or MSc level degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science or Telecommunications
Ability to understand architecture, network design & technical issues to drive effective agile delivery
Creative and efficient in proposing solutions to complex, time-critical problems
Proven hands-on experience in developing and deploying Analytics solutions
Knowledge on Analytics solutions, BI solution and data modelling
Knowledge on Redshift Data Modelling and SQL
Deep Knowledge of DevOps tools and CI/CD
Experience with AWS Service or Goggle Cloud Service
Knowledge on Telcon Business (OSS and BSS)
Ability to maintain calm attitude during difficult situations and handle pressure situations
Agile Methodology embracement
Strong team player with an ability to identify and remove impediments or conflicts that interfere with the ability of the team to deliver the sprint & project goals
Self-starter & self-motivated with a drive to identify opportunities for improvement across the agile delivery processes
Highly independent, takes ownership, does not need to be told what to do and seeks feedback and execute actions
Fluent in Portuguese and English



Not a perfect fit?

Worried that you don‚Äôt meet all the desired criteria exactly? At Vodafone we are passionate about empowering people and creating a workplace where everyone can thrive, whatever their personal or professional background. If you‚Äôre excited about this role but your experience doesn‚Äôt align exactly with every part of the job description, we encourage you to still apply as you may be the right candidate for this role or another opportunity.

What's In It For You


Hybrid Work Model - Flexible hybrid work model with 8-10 in-office days per month, managed by team leaders
Vodafone Products and Services - Employees get a mobile phone, free communication plan, data card, and various discounts on services and products
Recognition - Recognition programs for innovative, creative, high-potential employees and exemplary behaviors
Health and Well-being - Well-being Program offers nutrition and psychological consultations, webinars, workshops, and discounts on various services and products
Learning - Access to Communities of Practice and a customizable digital training platform with high-quality content (namely Harvard Business Publishing and Skillsoft)
Local and International Mobility - Internal recruitment with local and international rotation opportunities across departments and roles



Who We Are

We are a leading international Telco, serving millions of customers. At Vodafone, we believe that connectivity is a force for good. If we use it for the things that really matter, it can improve people's lives and the world around us. Through our technology we empower people, connecting everyone regardless of who they are or where they live and we protect the planet, whilst helping our customers do the same.

Belonging at Vodafone isn't a concept; it's lived, breathed, and cultivated through everything we do. You'll be part of a global and diverse community, with many different minds, abilities, backgrounds and cultures. ;We're committed to increase diversity, ensure equal representation, and make Vodafone a place everyone feels safe, valued and included.

If you require any reasonable adjustments or have an accessibility request as part of your recruitment journey, for example, extended time or breaks in between online assessments, please refer to https://careers.vodafone.com/application-adjustments/ for guidance.

Together we can.

Title: Predictive Modelling Specialist
Description:
About Us

Indie Campers, the go-to campervan Marketplace, is on a mission of making road trips available to everyone. Thanks to its digital approach and customer-centric orientation, Indie Campers has developed a strong booking experience and high-quality road trips at affordable prices.

With over one million nights rented through our travel platform, we have welcomed more than 300,000 travelers from 169 countries. We offer a comprehensive and expanding array of road trip possibilities: short-term RV rentals, long-term campervan subscriptions, and the possibility of buying one of our vehicles available for sale.

Rooted in a deep technological focus, our challenges are both exciting and demanding and require top talent and motivation to be successfully pursued. We are growing our team and looking for those interested in pursuing this dream with us and joining an ever-developing journey.

THE ROLE

As Indie Campers' Predictive Modelling Specialist you will be in charge of creating and developing predictive models and algorithms to assist decision making, anticipate issues and detect opportunities.

You will report directly to the Own Fleet Director and work very closely with our Data, Product, Ecommerce, Pricing, Stock, Finance, and Marketing teams from our Lisbon, Portugal HQ.

WHAT WILL YOU WORK ON?

You'll be responsible for creating and developing key capabilities that will make Indie Campers increasingly more data-driven.

The Right Candidate Will


Lead the creation and development of predictive models and algorithms.
Support forecasting and budgeting efforts with advanced analysis
Develop an E2E process of Models & Algorithms creation for Indie Campers.
Work constantly with model's end users to continously optimize them, making them increasingly more complete.
Oversee and detect which departments and areas could benefit more from the application of these tools in their activities.
Develop analysis tools to control and measure the impact of the predictive models and algorithms usage.
Together with Data, collect data, cleaning it, organising it, and search for customers behaviour patterns and what influences it.
Firslty focus on developing these capabilities for the Revenue department to then expand it company wide.


WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR?

You are fluent in English, spoken and written, with a Bachelor's or Master's in Finance, Mathematics, Engineering or Physics. You have minimum 4 years of professional experience, and previous involvement in algorithms and models creation or development.

Experience in working with large Datasets (SQL) and different data sources. Experience in using Python for scripting, data management and writing algorithms.

You'll lead the creation of tools and mechanism capable to automate decision making and improve our capability to react faster and plan ahead.

Are you ready to Go Indie?

Title: Real Assets Data Analyst & Dev Power BI
Description:
About The Job


You will work in agile mode on different types of reporting for Real Assets, as a Data Analyst & BI Developer


Your Main Activities Are


Understanding business needs
Proposing technical and design solutions for reporting
Developing reports that are tailored to needs and performance-optimized
Contributing to the implementation of development best practices for the reporting team
Ensuring that developments do not negatively impact existing functionalities, particularly in terms of functional non-regression and performance
Writing documentation and technical specifications
Participating in cross-functional projects related to data analysis
Ensuring that the data displayed is accurate


Profile And Skills To Success


Bachelor or Master degree Engineering or similar
Up to 3 years of relevant professional experience
Fluency in English both oral and written (mandatory)
Strong technical background in BI and SQL
Problem-solving mindset and initiative will be key assets for success in this role
Detail oriented with interest in data


About The Team


The Real Assets team includes a Coverage Relationship & Origination team, a Transaction & Execution team and a Credit Portfolio Management Team (CPM) spread across several countries serving the sector client in EMEA. These teams are split across Shipping & Offshore, Aviation, Rail, Real Estate, Export, Leasing & Alternative Structuring. This transversality aims to provide a common training path, opportunities to explore other sectors, more efficiency and greater mobility.
We are recruiting a Data Analyst & Dev Power BI to be part of the CPM Real Assets team focusing on Transportation, Export, ERI and Real Estate sectors. You will work in very close collaboration with the CIB ‚Äì ITO ‚Äì Transversal Reporting & Dashboarding Teams to develop reports ensure that the report built meet the user expectations in terms of visuals, functionality, and ‚Äì most importantly ‚Äì data quality


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centers providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.

  • Our presence in Portugal

In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centers providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.

  • International reach

Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions

  • Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
  • Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
  • Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
  • Diversity and Inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

  • Commitment towards work/life balance

At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.

  • Remote Working Conditions

At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal

  • Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
  • In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Personal Data Protection Analyst
Description:
At Axians, we value talent, not labels.

We believe in a culture of inclusion, where everyone has a place and all applications are considered based on merit, without discrimination.

This is your opportunity to join an international group with a project that needs you to help meet the challenges of digital transformation.

üíª THE JOB

We are looking for a #TechTalent to work as a Personal Data Protection Analyst for a national project.

üí° What We Are Looking For


+5 years of experience in similar roles, including significant experience on Data Privacy / GDPR;
Mandatory experience / academic background on EU GDPR;
Full proficiency of MSOffice suite;
Proficiency of Project Management tools and methodologies;
Knowledge of other Privacy laws and regulations is a plus;
Fluency in English (written & spoken).


‚≠ê What You Can Expect From Us

Stable professional career

Working with Axians projects becomes an asset to those of us who want to offer stability through a secure career.

Prospects for career advancement

You can access training and new certifications that will further elevate your skills. The 360¬∞ evaluation from managers and peers will also allow you to evolve.

Work Life Balance

By collaborating with Axians, you will be able to reconcile work and family requirements without neglecting either area.

Attractive, Evolving Compensation

When working with Axians, you will have access to performance bonuses in addition to an attractive salary pack (base salary + benefits). You are also entitled to health insurance and free psychology consultations.

Do you identify with this position?

If you think this position is the right fit for you and you have the #TechTalent we are looking for, send us your resume, preferably in English, to recrutamento.axianspt@axians.com with the subject "PDPA.IB.DB".

Learn more about Axians

Title: SAP Business Intelligence - BW Analyst
Description:
You'll be focused in


Creating cost and effort estimation for the implementation of the target architecture
Influencing the design and implementation of the data strategy and the making of architecture decisions
Driving the technical introduction of SAP Datasphere (DSP) as the successor of an on-premises BW system
Supporting building up of the master data structure in DSP considering 3 ERPs as source systems
Migrating existing "BW applications" to new DSP and find best in class solutions for the replacing applications within the MAN data landscape
Supporting on creation of "SAP Analytics Cloud" (SAC) reporting in the project stage
Designing both new and existing planning applications on the technical basis of DSP
Shaping the further development of SAP DSP as the future data warehouse in the cloud for MAN and setting the basis for future AI functionalities
Adapting and analyzing roles and authorizations in SAP DSP and SAC



In order to succeed, you'll need


Bachelor's degree in computer science, software engineering, or comparable work experience
2‚Äì4 years of experience in SAP BW (on HANA or classic)
Exposure to SAP Datasphere (DSP) and SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC)
Experience with data modelling, ETL processes, and reporting
Ability to understand and translate business requirements into BI solutions
Good communication skills and proficiency in English



Nice to have


Basic knowledge of SQL and relational databases
Familiarity with SAP BW/4HANA concepts
Understanding of roles and authorizations in SAP BI tools
Experience working in cross-functional teams or international environments



About The Product

This team works with Business intelligence tools and focus on offering the technical solution to gain information and insights from company data. They offer the data platform to provide the corporate planning as well as the financial closing of the MAN Truck & Bus companies in a consolidated reporting view.

Company Benefits


1200‚Ç¨ to equip your home office
720‚Ç¨ gross/year home allowance
Performance bonus
Health insurance extendable to your household
Wellbeing program extendable to your household
Life insurance
Pension fund
Smartphone & Unlimited phone data plan
Discounts on VW Group cars and special financing conditions
Relocation package & Visa process sponsorship (if applicable)



Cool Things You‚Äôll Experience In Our Work Environment


Tailored remote-friendly setup for every team's vibe!
Flexible working hours
Multicultural reality with + 30 different nationalities
Pet friendly environment
Boost your career with our internal mobility program, focused on your personal & professional growth
Mix and mingle across teams for idea-sharing and bonding



About VWDS

Technology-driven trends such as diverse mobility, electrification and connectivity will revolutionize the mobility industry in the next decade. Volkswagen Group, as world leader in the automotive industry, is setting the pace for this revolution.

At Volkswagen Digital Solutions (VWDS) we are the go-to team to tackle complex systems and programming challenges. We make sure that our products flow smoothly in all stages of the digital value chain.

Our main areas of focus: vehicle software & operations, mobile online services, IT security, fleet management, sales & after sales, purchasing & logistics and product portfolio management.

Ready to #ExploreNewRoads? Join us! üöó

Title: Data Analyst - GHR
Description:
About The Job

People Analytics is the AI & Analytics center of expertise for HR. Our goal is to support HR teams in leveraging data to help strategically manage activities and improve employee experience. To achieve this, People Analytics use a AI & Analytics platforms for data processing, visualization and AI. People Analytics offers analyses, dashboards, predictive models, and digital solutions that meet the needs of senior management, HR teams, and business units.

Within People Analytics, you will join a dynamic and multidisciplinary team of about forty collaborators, working in Paris and Lisbon in an agile mode. You will work with other data experts (including data quality analysts, data engineers, data scientists) and will be in constant contact with other HR experts.

As a Data Analyst, you will build analyses and participate in the development of projects that help make strategic decisions for the function (e.g. Analyzing workforce trends for the general management).

Your Main Activities Are

In This Role, Your Missions Will Include

Understand the needs expressed by senior management, HR teams, or the business.

Translate them into an analytical roadmap (scope of analysis, metrics...) to help make decisions.

Develop dashboards (Power BI and Tableau) and written analyses (preparation, exploration, descriptive analysis, data visualization, clustering, machine learning, NLP...) in collaboration with data scientists and data engineers of the team.

Contribute to the monitoring and analysis of workforce trends, from data collection to the delivery of analyses to senior management.

Clearly communicate actionable recommendations orally and in writing through reliable and quality deliverables.

Your Team / Work Environment

This position is to be filled within the People Analytics team at Group HR;

You will join a dynamic and multidisciplinary team of about forty collaborators, working in an agile mode with all the AI&Analytics experts (Data Analyst, Data Engineer, AI Business Analyst, Data project manager, Data Scientist, Data quality analyst, Product Owner‚Ä¶), and will be in contact with other HR department collaborators.

And after? / FUTURE PROSPECTS:

The numerous contacts you will gain will allow you to develop your network and consider joining different teams within GHR or more broadly within the group's businesses.

Profile And Skills To Success

With a scientific background, you have experience as an analyst, management controller, auditor, consultant in a quantitative-oriented position.

Pedagogically, you can communicate your statistical analyses and results clearly and intelligibly to different stakeholders, both in writing and orally, adapting to the technical levels expected by your interlocutors.

You have significant experience in data visualization, data preparation and machine-learning.

Finally, we attach particular importance to our future collaborators acting with responsibility and professional ethics daily.

Your Required Skills

Business Skills:

Data Processing (Expert)

Data Analysis (Expert)

Knowledge of BNP Paribas organization (Proficient)

Knowledge of Human Resources (Proficient)

Knowledge of Data (Proficient)

Data Quality and Security (Expert)

Transversal Skills

Ability to understand, explain, and lead change (Proficient)

Analytical Skills (Expert)

Project Management Skills (Expert)

Ability to lead meetings, seminars, committees and trainings (Proficient)

Ability to define relevant performance indicators (Expert)

Behavioral Skills

Ability to synthesize/simplify (Expert)

Communication Skills ‚Äì oral and written (Expert)

Adaptability (Proficient)

Results-oriented (Expert)

Problem-solving Skills (Proficient)

Languages

English (Advanced)

Tools / Technologies / Methodologies

DATA VIZ BLENDING ANALYTICS Tableau (Expert)

DATA VIZ BLENDING ANALYTICS DataIKU (Proficient)

DATA VIZ BLENDING ANALYTICS Power BI (Proficient)

Python (Proficient)

DATABASE MANAGEMENT Standard SQL (Proficient)

AGILE Methodology (Proficient)

MS OFFICE PACK MICROSOFT EXCEL Tools (Proficient)

Mobility is one of the core principles of BNP Paribas career and management strategy, which aims to meet our Employees‚Äô needs for personal development along with ensuring that the company meets the overall business needs. For further details, we invite you to explore the mobility principles available on https://bwelcome.hr.bnpparibas/internalmobility. Before applying, please make sure you discuss it with your manager whose support is critical

Title: Data Engineer (m/f/d)
Description:
At Flix, we offer a tech-driven environment where innovation meets real-world impact, with competitive pay, strong growth opportunities, and a culture of collaboration and ownership.‚ÄØ

We are trailblazers in data-driven marketing. We firmly believe that successful marketing is rooted in high-quality data, and our commitment to support marketing teams with reliable data solutions is what sets us apart. You will work in a talented team of data engineers, data scientists & a product owner, delivering data products and models that empower marketing teams to take optimal budget steering decisions.

About The Role


Use Python, SQL, and Airflow to design and maintain robust, scalable data pipelines that deliver timely, actionable insights to marketing stakeholders.
Apply analytical thinking to understand complex data requirements and translate them into efficient data pipelines.
Ensure data quality through validation, monitoring, and clear documentation.
Proactively debug and refactor data pipelines to enhance performance, accuracy, and maintainability, based on a solid understanding of the underlying business logic.
Participate in code reviews and contribute to engineering best practices within the team.
Collaborate with the Product Owner and cross-functional teams to understand marketing stakeholders' data needs and translate them into technical solutions.
Assist with ad hoc requests and help resolve data-related issues by applying both technical and analytical problem-solving skills.
Participate in the continuous improvement of data infrastructure by optimizing pipeline performance, enhancing data models, and integrating scalable, future-proof solutions.


About You


You‚Äôve had hands-on experience with Python, SQL, and Git.
You hold a degree in Computer Science or a related field. Candidates from Business or Marketing backgrounds with strong technical experience are also welcome.
You think critically, ask insightful questions, and enjoy turning complex business requirements into clean, effective code.
You are experienced with relational databases and excel at writing complex SQL queries.
You thrive in team settings, communicate well, and are fluent in English.
Bonus: Experience with Airflow, AWS, terraform, CI/CD tools; having worked in Marketing Domain.


We recognize that everyone carries a unique set of valuable skills and experiences. If you think you could have an impact even though you don't meet 100% of the requirements, we still encourage you to apply. We want to hear from you!‚ÄØ

What We Offer


Travel perks: 12 free Flix vouchers + 12 discount vouchers for friends & family.
Work from (M)Anywhere: Depending on your role, work from another location for up to 60 days per year.
Hybrid work model: We are an office-first company, but we offer flexibility to balance work and life.
Wellbeing support: Access confidential 1:1 counselling, courses, and stress management for yourself and up to four family members.
Learning & Development: Take advantage of language classes, training courses, and expert-led sessions to grow your skills.
Mentoring Program: Connect with experienced colleagues to gain insights and accelerate your career.


To view more local benefits specific to each office location, please check out this link: Locations - Flix Career

Why Join Flix?

At Flix, we empower our teams to push boundaries and shape the future of mobility. As we continue to scale globally, we harness cutting-edge technology to make mobility smarter, more sustainable, and more affordable.

If you‚Äôre looking for a place where you can drive change and redefine how millions of people travel, Flix is the place where you can lead your journey!

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Company Description

Inetum is a European leader in digital services. Inetum‚Äôs team of 28,000 consultants and specialists strive every day to make a digital impact for businesses, public sector entities and society. Inetum‚Äôs solutions aim at contributing to its clients‚Äô performance and innovation as well as the common good.

Present in 19 countries with a dense network of sites, Inetum partners with major software publishers to meet the challenges of digital transformation with proximity and flexibility.Driven by its ambition for growth and scale, Inetum generated sales of 2.5 billion euros in 2023.

Job Description

We are seeking a talented and motivated Data Engineer to join our team. If you have a passion for working with large data sets, creating efficient pipelines, and turning data into actionable insights, we want to meet you!

Responsibilities


Develop and maintain scalable, reliable, and efficient data pipelines.
Optimize the collection, storage, and processing of large data volumes.
Collaborate with data scientists, analysts, and other stakeholders to understand the company‚Äôs data needs.
Ensure data quality, integrity, and security.
Implement data storage solutions in cloud, hybrid, or on-premises environments.


Qualifications


Experience with Spark (PySpark), Cloudera, SQL, Hive/Impala, Datawarehouse/Data lake
Fuent in English

Title: OPC Reporting and Automation - Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job

The Global Markets Operational and Permanent Control (GM OPC) set-up faces increasing Regulatory and Conduct demands beyond pure Operational Risk. As part of Strategy Conduct and Risk (SCR), GM OPC operates over the 3 main regions, through the three following Practices:


Regulatory Practice: support any regulatory requirement with a sustainable framework, in line with the dedicated Governance, Control Plan & Risk Assessment
Conduct Practice: assess and challenge the effectiveness of the Conduct control set-up as well as ensure a full convergence between Conduct Risk Identification (CRI), Risk and Control Self-Assessment ‚Äì RCSA).
Operational Risk Practice: contribute to protect the business (P&L, reputation)


The three Practices are further supported by three transversal Streams ‚Äì Protection (Management and monitoring of incidents, remediation actions and recommendations), Prevention (Deploying RCSA and contribute to Operational risk computation) and Supervision (Validation process and Coordinating the internal control Governance and other Regulatory-based committees).

Your Main Activities Are


Support the team to produce regular reporting on the main operational risk indicators, and proactively suggest improvements on the reports;
Use different tools to collect and analyze data, as well as structuring queries and performing routine maintenance of reports;
Perform trend analysis comparison to previous weeks/months/quarters
Proactively suggest improvements on reports on a continuous basis and promote digital solutions
Ensure data input & quality check;
Support the execution of governance committees and presentations
Support the OPC team with Ad-Hoc requests (Statistics; Kpis; presentations; etc.)
Liaise & Interact with OPC teams worldwide


Profile And Skills To Success


Bachelor, Post-Graduation or Master Degree in Data Science; Management, Finance, Science, Maths;
Excellent knowledge of PowerPoint, Excel, VBA, Power BI, (other languages would be a plus)
Analytical and quantitative skills, Precision, rigorousness;
Excellent organizational skills
Team spirit, ability to work with others;
Ability to communicate clearly in both oral and written form (English);
Experience in investment banking is an advantage.


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

HTML:
About The Job

The Global Markets Operational and Permanent Control (GM OPC) set-up faces increasing Regulatory and Conduct demands beyond pure Operational Risk. As part of Strategy Conduct and Risk (SCR), GM OPC operates over the 3 main regions, through the three following Practices:

  • Regulatory Practice: support any regulatory requirement with a sustainable framework, in line with the dedicated Governance, Control Plan & Risk Assessment
  • Conduct Practice: assess and challenge the effectiveness of the Conduct control set-up as well as ensure a full convergence between Conduct Risk Identification (CRI), Risk and Control Self-Assessment ‚Äì RCSA).
  • Operational Risk Practice: contribute to protect the business (P&L, reputation)

The three Practices are further supported by three transversal Streams ‚Äì Protection (Management and monitoring of incidents, remediation actions and recommendations), Prevention (Deploying RCSA and contribute to Operational risk computation) and Supervision (Validation process and Coordinating the internal control Governance and other Regulatory-based committees).

Your Main Activities Are

  • Support the team to produce regular reporting on the main operational risk indicators, and proactively suggest improvements on the reports;
  • Use different tools to collect and analyze data, as well as structuring queries and performing routine maintenance of reports;
  • Perform trend analysis comparison to previous weeks/months/quarters
  • Proactively suggest improvements on reports on a continuous basis and promote digital solutions
  • Ensure data input & quality check;
  • Support the execution of governance committees and presentations
  • Support the OPC team with Ad-Hoc requests (Statistics; Kpis; presentations; etc.)
  • Liaise & Interact with OPC teams worldwide

Profile And Skills To Success

  • Bachelor, Post-Graduation or Master Degree in Data Science; Management, Finance, Science, Maths;
  • Excellent knowledge of PowerPoint, Excel, VBA, Power BI, (other languages would be a plus)
  • Analytical and quantitative skills, Precision, rigorousness;
  • Excellent organizational skills
  • Team spirit, ability to work with others;
  • Ability to communicate clearly in both oral and written form (English);
  • Experience in investment banking is an advantage.

Why joining BNP Paribas?

  • Leading banking institution

BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.
