Title: Automation Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
ABOUT NUMA

Hey there! We‚Äôre Numa, a forward-thinking hospitality brand redefining how people discover cities. We create spaces where simplicity meets innovation, offering thoughtfully designed rooms, studios, and apartments in the heart of Europe‚Äôs most vibrant neighbourhoods.
We‚Äôre not just transforming the guest experience‚Äîwe‚Äôre revolutionizing the hospitality industry from the inside out. Our cutting-edge technology streamlines operations, delivering unparalleled value with no hidden fees‚Äîjust real, quality experiences.
At Numa, we believe that travel should be curious and authentic, and we bring those same values to our work culture. As part of our team, you‚Äôll experience a dynamic and supportive environment where creativity thrives, and your contributions make a real impact. We‚Äôre committed to fostering a diverse, inclusive, and equitable workplace where every voice is valued, and different perspectives fuel our innovation.

ABOUT YOU

Conduct Deep-Dive Analysis: You will perform advanced analysis on guest feedback and operational data, using your statistical knowledge to uncover root causes, identify significant trends (forecasting), and build compelling business cases for what to improve next.
Build & Deploy: You will work with the team to translate your data-driven insights into tangible solutions by designing, building, and deploying robust workflows using Python.
Provide Data Partnership: Act as a key data partner for the Guest Experience & Operations teams, supporting them with ad-hoc data extractions, analysis, and generating insights to answer critical business questions as they arise.
Measure and Iterate: You will manage the full lifecycle of your projects, from initial analysis to deploying an automation and, finally, to measuring its impact on our key metrics and ROI.¬†
Stakeholders Enablement: Enable your team and direct stakeholders to independently leverage data for business insights via self-serving and dashboarding tools (Looker)

ABOUT THE ROLE

Analytical Experience: 2-4 years in a data analytics or similar role.
Technical Proficiency in Analytics
Strong proficiency in SQL for complex data querying and manipulation.¬†
Prior experience in a startup or tech-driven environment is mandatory.
Hands-on experience with a modern BI tool (e.g., Looker, Tableau, Power BI) to build strategic and user-friendly dashboards.
A solid understanding of foundational statistical principles and how to apply them to real-world business problems.
Business Acumen: You are passionate about understanding the "why" behind the data and can clearly communicate your findings and their strategic implications to both technical and non-technical audiences
An Automation Mindset (and a Willingness to Learn)
You are naturally drawn to efficiency and are excited by the idea of process improvement. While deep programming experience isn't required, a strong desire to learn and hands-on experience with Python or low-code tools (like n8n, Zapier, etc.) is a significant plus.
Technical Foundations: Experience working with data warehouses like
BigQuery or Postgres is a plus.
Mindset: A true problem-solver with a data-first mentality. You are driven by the continuous cycle of analysis, implementation, and measurement to achieve a tangible business outcome.
ABOUT OUR OFFER
Empower your career: Thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment where your ideas help shape our future. Enjoy opportunities for professional growth and build a fulfilling career path.
Experience our brand: Immerse yourself in the Numa lifestyle with a complimentary stay. Share the love with friends and family through exclusive discounts on our stylish apartments. Connect with a global community of colleagues at our inspiring team-building events.

Numa values the diversity of the people it hires and serves. Diversity at our company means fostering a workplace in which individual differences are recognised, appreciated, respected and responded to in ways that fully develop and utilise each person‚Äôs talents and strengths. We therefore welcome applications from people of all races, ethnicities, disability statuses, ages, religions, gender identities, and sexual orientations.

For more information on the processing of your personal data, please see our Privacy Notice.

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
Location: Portugal

Department: Engineering

Employment: Full time

About YLD:

Everything we do is to empower our clients to move forward. Our purpose is to help our clients develop the capabilities they need to outperform their competitors. Our success is a consequence of ensuring our clients are successful. Our company is built on extraordinary people; we aim to attract, inspire, develop and retain them. YLD is a software engineering and design consultancy; we create digital capabilities for our clients that last beyond our engagement. We have offices in London, Lisbon, Porto.

About the role:

As a Software Engineer, you'll be part of a client team building innovative products. We expect you to be curious, passionate, driven, and enthusiastic. You'll be proficient at problem-solving, and crafting scalable, resilient, and fault-tolerant architectures. You'll be an effective communicator and a team player. You and your team will move in a fast-paced engineering environment, achieving outstanding results and delivering exciting projects.

About you:

A YLD Software Engineering Consultant is a highly skilled developer who exemplifies the highest standard in software engineering and enjoys sharing their knowledge and experience with others.

You'll have the opportunity to build and deliver software within some interesting projects in terms of the product and methodology. We work in an Agile environment (Scrum) with a test-first mindset (actually, writing code without tests should be unthinkable). We are also big advocates of pair programming and nothing is released until we have a code review.

You have a real passion for problem-solving and are an active learner who gets excited by working collaboratively with those around you.

Your day-to-day responsibilities will look like this:


Crafting excellent products! As an AI Engineer, you will be building new AI-powered features that meet the needs of our clients' customers, as well as improving their Digital Platform with intelligent capabilities;
Continuously delivering changes to products including AI model integrations, prompt optimisations, and system improvements, as we push for a full CI/CD model;
Working closely with your team, regularly collaborating on both traditional engineering and AI initiatives, to continually push yourselves to build better, smarter systems;
Participating in regular show and tells to promote your work ‚Äî from AI experiments to production deployments ‚Äî to both your department and the wider company;
Joining our clients' internal events, including meeting external speakers, going to quiz nights, etc.


You'll have the following skills and experience:

Core Programming & AI


Proven strong experience with JavaScript, TypeScript, and Python
Advanced GenAI/LLM expertise: RAG, embeddings, vector search, prompt engineering, evals, guardrails, caching, chaining, function calling, etc
Fine-tuning expertise: LoRA/QLoRA, instruction tuning, RLHF, domain adaptation, and custom model training
Agentic architecture design: multi-agent systems, tool orchestration, planning/reasoning frameworks, memory systems, and agent coordination patterns
Eval systems: automated evals, human feedback loops, benchmarking, A/B testing, safety testing, hallucination detection, and performance metrics
Experience with LLM frameworks (LangChain, LlamaIndex, LiteLLM, CrewAI, Mastra, etc) and API integrations (OpenAI, Anthropic, etc.)


Infrastructure & DevOps


CI/CD pipelines and IaC tools (Terraform, CloudFormation, CDK)
Cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) for GenAI workloads and API management
Containerisation and orchestration (Docker, Kubernetes) for AI applications
LLM hosting and inference optimisation (vLLM, TGI, local deployment)


Data & Databases


Vector databases (Pinecone, Weaviate, Chroma, Qdrant) and traditional databases (PostgreSQL, Neo4j)
Data pipeline design for RAG and knowledge ingestion
Real-time data streaming and processing
Document processing and embedding generation workflows


Frontend & APIs


React or modern UI frameworks
API design for LLM services and conversational interfaces
Multiple protocols (HTTP, GraphQL, gRPC, WebSockets, MCP)
Real-time chat and streaming response handling


Performance & Reliability


Building high-performance, scalable AI applications
LLM cost optimisation, token management, and caching strategies
Performance monitoring, observability, and debugging production AI systems
Comprehensive testing: unit, integration, AI behaviour, security, accessibility


You'll be:


Self-motivated, proactive and always looking for ways to improve and develop yourself;
A good communicator, both in writing and verbally. You'll be able to explain technical ideas and concepts in business-friendly language;
Detail oriented;
Used to working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment;
Comfortable with experimentation, iteration, and managing uncertainty in AI systems;
Analytical and problem-solving oriented;
Ethical thinker who considers the broader implications of AI implementations;
A genuine believer in diversity and fairness.


As well as the chance to work with a forward-thinking, ethical, and fun group of people, you'll also get:


Company Private Health care
Enhanced fully paid maternity and paternity leave for up to 6 months
25 days annual holiday (excluding Public Holidays)
‚Ç¨2000 annual allowance for Training/Conferences
‚Ç¨300 annual allowance for additional hardware
Mental Health support: access to Spill app
Meditation/Sleep support: Headspace or Calm app subscription
Bonus (depending on Company performance and results)
Company laptop
Generous referral schemes


Our typical Recruitment Process looks like this:


1st Interview with someone from the Talent team (30/45 mins)
Technical Interview with our Senior Developers (1h30)


We live and breathe our values, and know you will too:


Growing every day
Including everyone
Relationships built on honesty and ethics
Inspiring solutions
Winning together


We're an equal-opportunity employer and value diversity of all kinds. We don't discriminate based on race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, pregnancy or maternity, age, marital status, or disability status. We also offer a remote-first working environment, meaning that flexible working and work-life balance come as standard for all employees.

Title: Data Engineer - Looker Analytics
Description:
MAIN PURPOSE

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Analytics Engineer to join our growing data engineering team. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of success in designing, developing, and maintaining Looker dashboards and explores. This role requires a deep understanding of Looker's capabilities and a strong ability to translate complex business requirements into effective data visualizations. Experience with BigQuery and dbt is a plus.

Responsibilities


Design, develop, and maintain Looker dashboards, explores, and data models to meet the evolving needs of the business.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business requirements and translate them into technical specifications.
Develop and maintain Looker data models, ensuring data accuracy, consistency, and performance.
Write efficient and well-documented LookML code.
Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to Looker dashboards and explores.
Contribute to the ongoing improvement of our Looker platform and processes.
Work closely with other members of the data engineering team to ensure data quality and consistency.
Proactively identify and address potential performance bottlenecks in Looker.
Stay up-to-date with the latest Looker features and best practices.
Manage code using Git version control, including branching, merging, and pull requests.


Qualifications


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field.
3+ years of hands-on experience with Looker, including designing and developing dashboards and explores.
Proven ability to translate complex business requirements into effective data visualizations.
Strong understanding of data warehousing principles and best practices.
Experience with BigQuery and dbt is a plus.
Experience with Git version control systems (e.g., GitHub, GitLab, Bitbucket).
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.


Key Looker Expertise Requirements


Extensive experience in LookML development, including creating custom visualizations and calculations.
Deep understanding of Looker's data modeling capabilities, including joins, aggregations, and calculated fields.
Experience with Looker's security and access control features.
Proficiency in using Looker's explore functionality to perform ad-hoc data analysis.
Experience with Looker's scheduling and alerting features.
Experience optimizing Looker dashboards and explores for performance.
Experience with Looker's API and integrations with other tools.


Show more
HTML:
MAIN PURPOSE

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Analytics Engineer to join our growing data engineering team. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of success in designing, developing, and maintaining Looker dashboards and explores. This role requires a deep understanding of Looker's capabilities and a strong ability to translate complex business requirements into effective data visualizations. Experience with BigQuery and dbt is a plus.

Responsibilities

  • Design, develop, and maintain Looker dashboards, explores, and data models to meet the evolving needs of the business.
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business requirements and translate them into technical specifications.
  • Develop and maintain Looker data models, ensuring data accuracy, consistency, and performance.
  • Write efficient and well-documented LookML code.
  • Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to Looker dashboards and explores.
  • Contribute to the ongoing improvement of our Looker platform and processes.
  • Work closely with other members of the data engineering team to ensure data quality and consistency.
  • Proactively identify and address potential performance bottlenecks in Looker.
  • Stay up-to-date with the latest Looker features and best practices.
  • Manage code using Git version control, including branching, merging, and pull requests.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field.
  • 3+ years of hands-on experience with Looker, including designing and developing dashboards and explores.
  • Proven ability to translate complex business requirements into effective data visualizations.
  • Strong understanding of data warehousing principles and best practices.
  • Experience with BigQuery and dbt is a plus.
  • Experience with Git version control systems (e.g., GitHub, GitLab, Bitbucket).
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

Key Looker Expertise Requirements

  • Extensive experience in LookML development, including creating custom visualizations and calculations.
  • Deep understanding of Looker's data modeling capabilities, including joins, aggregations, and calculated fields.
  • Experience with Looker's security and access control features.
  • Proficiency in using Looker's explore functionality to perform ad-hoc data analysis.
  • Experience with Looker's scheduling and alerting features.
  • Experience optimizing Looker dashboards and explores for performance.
  • Experience with Looker's API and integrations with other tools.

Title: Product Analyst - ComparaJ√°
Description:
About us

Our mission is to help consumers save time and money by matching them with the best products for their banking, insurance, and utility needs. We work towards becoming the largest distributor of financial services. ComparaJ√°.pt is part of Samlino Group (https://samlinogroup.com/). We operate across four markets, empowering users reach healthier financial lives.

What we offer you

You'll have the unique opportunity to be a key driver of our exponential growth curve. In your daily work, you will work directly with our Founder and senior teams.

Sunny Lisbon will be your home base, but you'll travel between our four markets (Portugal, Denmark, Belgium and Greece)!

Your Responsibilities

You will be accountable for your own projects and will be responsible for driving results across various ventures and initiatives. Your responsibilities in this job will evolve and be defined and redefined throughout your time with us. The aim is to take ownership of and drive the development of progressively larger opportunities.

What we expect from you

We are looking for a dynamic individual who thrives in a results-oriented environment to join our team and help us reach our objectives. Industry experience is not a requirement, but you do need to be highly ambitious, proactive, forward-thinking, a fast learner, and driven to succeed.

Furthermore, we are looking for candidates who:


Have a proactive mindset, strong analytical skills, and the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams
Are self-motivated, detail-oriented, and possess a track record of successfully owning projects from conception to completion
Possess an unwavering drive and desire to be the very best at what they do
Are passionate about making an impact and driving tangible results
Exude a strong work ethic fueled by an urgency to progress
Embrace ownership and proactively follow through on commitments
Possess an insatiable curiosity about business, data, and people, relishing the opportunity to build and nurture relationships that fuel lasting success
Master communication, wielding words with impact both verbally and in writing
Showcase unrivalled organisational skills, skillfully structuring and prioritising their work to achieve maximum efficiency
Native proficiency in either Portuguese or Danish and fluent in English
EU work permit is required


Start date and Location

Flexible start date

This role is full-time onsite at our Lisbon office

Title: RISK GF Senior Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job


Within the BNP Paribas Group RISK function, the RISK SGCP (Strategic Governance and Credit Platform) team is responsible among others, for leading and maintaining the Strategic Risk Governance Framework of the Group in close collaboration with the RISK Hubs, RISK Business Lines, and other RISK teams, enabling decisions on risk appetite and defining orientations on commercial strategies and corresponding risk policies
By integrating the Data Management team, the RISK GF Senior Data Analyst works in a best-in-class data management team, in an international and dynamic environment
The team works on a Big Data environment, with access to an ecosystem of Hadoop tools including Spark and Hive. Dataiku DSS (Data Science Studio) and Tableau are used as end user interface, providing a visual approach to the implementation of ETL (Extract Transform Load) pipelines and Dashboards respectively
IT solutions are granted by ITG, the IT entity servicing BNPP Group Functions. ITG supports the infrastructure on a daily-basis and helps with backend big data engineering and framework maintenance
The primary responsibility will be to handle big data, perform in-depth data analysis, notably to present data in valuable ways to see beyond the figures. Added value data visualizations are key for the SGCP department functional analysts to perform the credit portfolio analysis, notably Risk Appetite Statement monitoring of key sectors for the Group, Risk Weighted Asset assessment and explanation, amongst others
You will be in regular contact with the various SGCP teams in Lisbon, Paris and other regions, as well with partner RISK teams and ITG


Your Main Activities Are


Frame, design, implement, test, and deliver agile, innovative, and robust data visualization solutions to meet the needs of RISK users, with priority for RISK SGCP (CPA, SRA, and CRF teams)
Contribute to the rationalization and functional optimization of dashboards and their accessibility
Be proactive in proposing evolutions to implement in the data sources to simplify data models and facilitate exploitation by users as well as performance
Implement and maintain the technical and functional documentation of tools and processes
Work closely with data engineers to evolve the data foundation in line with the use cases of data visualization
Assess the integration of new features in data visualization tools and ensure technological watch around data visualization
Bring support as a data visualization expert to team members in Paris, Lisbon, and the regions
Train and coach as necessary more junior team members in new data visualization technologies and best practices
Contribute to ‚Äúdata‚Äù projects on various internal and regulatory credit risk topics (Credit Chain, B-Ready and Reboot‚Ä¶)
Contribute to disseminate a culture of data driven solutions within BNP Paribas and RISK notably
Regularly update the management of the department of progress achieved


Profile and Skills to Success


Master‚Äôs in Information Technology / Computer Science / Data Science / Mathematics and Statistics or related
At least 3 years of experience in Data Visualization / Data Analytics or similar
Advanced level of English, both written and oral
Knowledge in
Tableau Suite (Desktop, Server)
SQL
Dataiku
Python
Attention to detail / rigor
Ability to manage a project
Ability to synthetise / simplify
Analytical ability
Communication skills, both written and oral

Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Junior Power BI Consultant
Description:
Company Description

Inetum is a European leader in digital services. Inetum‚Äôs team of 28,000 consultants and specialists strive every day to make a digital impact for businesses, public sector entities and society. Inetum‚Äôs solutions aim at contributing to its clients‚Äô performance and innovation as well as the common good.

Present in 19 countries with a dense network of sites, Inetum partners with major software publishers to meet the challenges of digital transformation with proximity and flexibility.

Driven by its ambition for growth and scale, Inetum generated sales of 2.5 billion euros in 2023.

Job Description

We are looking for a Consultant for the Power BI solution, who will also act as the guarantor of Modern BI and Data Visualization best practices. This role is key to ensuring the technical excellence and strategic evolution of our BI ecosystem.

Key Responsibilities


Act as the go-to expert for Power BI, ensuring adherence to best practices in data visualization and modern BI.
Administer Power BI Services, including workspace organization, access rights, role and authorization management, and data encryption.
Optimize performance through data compression, partitioning, and aggregation strategies.
Design and maintain advanced data models and ensure alignment with broader data architecture.
Collaborate with business and technical stakeholders to understand needs and translate them into effective BI solutions.
Drive continuous improvement through bug fixes, enhancements, and technical quality assurance.


Qualifications


Experience with Power BI implementation.
Strong proficiency in DAX, SQL, and M (Power Query).
Deep understanding of data modeling and data architecture.
Experience with performance optimization techniques in Power BI.
Expertise in data visualization principles and storytelling with data.


Soft Skills


Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Comfortable interacting with both business and technical stakeholders.
Curious, proactive, and eager to stay up to date with BI trends and technologies.


Nice to Have


PL-300: Microsoft Power BI Data Analyst certification.
Experience with Google BigQuery.
Knowledge of Python and ETL tools.
Familiarity with Oracle Database and MongoDB.


Passionate about data, stunning visualizations, and cutting-edge tech? Join us and lead the way in transforming BI with Power BI!"

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Us

At Cloudflare, we are on a mission to help build a better Internet. Today the company runs one of the world‚Äôs largest networks that powers millions of websites and other Internet properties for customers ranging from individual bloggers to SMBs to Fortune 500 companies. Cloudflare protects and accelerates any Internet application online without adding hardware, installing software, or changing a line of code. Internet properties powered by Cloudflare all have web traffic routed through its intelligent global network, which gets smarter with every request. As a result, they see significant improvement in performance and a decrease in spam and other attacks. Cloudflare was named to Entrepreneur Magazine‚Äôs Top Company Cultures list and ranked among the World‚Äôs Most Innovative Companies by Fast Company.

We realize people do not fit into neat boxes. We are looking for curious and empathetic individuals who are committed to developing themselves and learning new skills, and we are ready to help you do that. We cannot complete our mission without building a diverse and inclusive team. We hire the best people based on an evaluation of their potential and support them throughout their time at Cloudflare. Come join us!

Available Locations: Lisbon, London

About The Team

The Business Intelligence team at Cloudflare is responsible for building a centralized cloud data lake and an analytics platform that enables our internal Business Partners and Product teams with actionable insights and also provides a 360 view of our business. Our goal is to democratize data, support Cloudflare‚Äôs critical business needs, provide reporting and analytics via self-service tools to fuel existing and new business critical initiatives.

Role Summary

We are looking for an experienced Data Analyst to join our London or Lisbon teams to scale our product analytics initiatives. You will partner closely with our product organization, analyzing a wide array of datasets to inform product team data requests ranging from routine reporting and ad hoc analysis, to long-term and strategic product roadmap-influencing projects.

Success in this role will rely on marrying a strong analytics background with product and business acumen to deliver highly strategic and compelling insights that accelerate our business growth and influence our product decisions.

Role Responsibilities


Provide analytics support, product understanding, and a strategic perspective to our product partners
Partner and align with data engineers, product managers, and other product stakeholders to enable data driven answers to key business problems
Take initiative and ask questions to iteratively define, build, and maintain business metrics and reports
Develop and automate data pipelines and reports to enable insights at scale
Weave stories with data to help stakeholders understand analytical insights



Role Requirements


B.S. or M.S in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or other quantitative fields
3+ years of experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau and plotting libraries
Experience writing advanced SQL queries
Initiative, curiosity, and stakeholder engagement
Experience in translating business questions into analysis frameworks, converting the results into business recommendations, and presenting those recommendations back to business stakeholders
Knowledge of data management, data modeling and data warehousing fundamentals
Experience with statistical analysis programming languages (R, Python, etc.)



Nice-to-Have Skills


Experience and/or an understanding and keen interest in internet security
Experience with a fast-growing SaaS business based company preferred



What Makes Cloudflare Special?

We‚Äôre not just a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company. We‚Äôre a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company with a soul. Fundamental to our mission to help build a better Internet is protecting the free and open Internet.

Project Galileo: Since 2014, we've equipped more than 2,400 journalism and civil society organizations in 111 countries with powerful tools to defend themselves against attacks that would otherwise censor their work, technology already used by Cloudflare‚Äôs enterprise customers--at no cost.

Athenian Project: In 2017, we created the Athenian Project to ensure that state and local governments have the highest level of protection and reliability for free, so that their constituents have access to election information and voter registration. Since the project, we've provided services to more than 425 local government election websites in 33 states.

1.1.1.1: We released 1.1.1.1 to help fix the foundation of the Internet by building a faster, more secure and privacy-centric public DNS resolver. This is available publicly for everyone to use - it is the first consumer-focused service Cloudflare has ever released. Here‚Äôs the deal - we don‚Äôt store client IP addresses never, ever. We will continue to abide by our privacy commitment and ensure that no user data is sold to advertisers or used to target consumers.

Sound like something you‚Äôd like to be a part of? We‚Äôd love to hear from you!

This position may require access to information protected under U.S. export control laws, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations. Please note that any offer of employment may be conditioned on your authorization to receive software or technology controlled under these U.S. export laws without sponsorship for an export license.

Cloudflare is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity for all people and place great value in both diversity and inclusiveness. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to their, or any other person's, perceived or actual race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, family care status, or any other basis protected by law. We are an AA/Veterans/Disabled Employer.

Cloudflare provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities. Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job. Examples of reasonable accommodations include, but are not limited to, changing the application process, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment. If you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job, please contact us via e-mail at hr@cloudflare.com or via mail at 101 Townsend St. San Francisco, CA 94107.

About Us

At Cloudflare, we are on a mission to help build a better Internet. Today the company runs one of the world‚Äôs largest networks that powers millions of websites and other Internet properties for customers ranging from individual bloggers to SMBs to Fortune 500 companies. Cloudflare protects and accelerates any Internet application online without adding hardware, installing software, or changing a line of code. Internet properties powered by Cloudflare all have web traffic routed through its intelligent global network, which gets smarter with every request. As a result, they see significant improvement in performance and a decrease in spam and other attacks. Cloudflare was named to Entrepreneur Magazine‚Äôs Top Company Cultures list and ranked among the World‚Äôs Most Innovative Companies by Fast Company.

We realize people do not fit into neat boxes. We are looking for curious and empathetic individuals who are committed to developing themselves and learning new skills, and we are ready to help you do that. Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
At Bloq.it, we‚Äôve created the world‚Äôs leading smart locker solution. Solving online deliveries by enabling everyone to participate easily, reducing delivery costs and making them more sustainable.

We‚Äôre quickly expanding, and after growing at 1000% for three years in a row, we‚Äôre now the fastest-growing Smart Locker company in the world and one of the fastest growing scale-ups in Europe.

We are in search of a Data Analyst to join our innovative team as our new #bloqstar.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing

  • Collaborate with stakeholders to gather business requirements and deliver data-driven solutions aligned with organizational objectives;
  • Work closely with data engineers and business teams to address data challenges and provide recommendations based on analysis;
  • Extract, transform, and analyze data from Amazon Redshift, AWS S3 Data Lakes, and MongoDB Atlas, ensuring data accuracy and integrity;
  • Create insightful dashboards and reports using visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or AWS QuickSight to present actionable insights;
  • Tackle business ad-hoc requests by exploring data product solutions or retrieving data directly from golden sources to address immediate needs.

What You‚Äôll Bring To The Table

  • Minimum of 2 years of experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar analytical role;
  • Proficiency in SQL for querying and Python or R for data analysis and scripting;
  • Experience in data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or AWS QuickSight;
  • Strong communication skills to present insights clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences.

It Would Be Great If You Would Also Have

  • Knowledge of statistical modeling or machine learning techniques is a plus;
  • Familiarity with MongoDB Atlas, including querying NoSQL data.

Why join us?

  • The opportunity to join our Software team and play a pivotal role in contributing to innovative solutions that redefine Bloq.it's revolution in the smart locker industry ;
  • A dynamic and fast-paced work environment with a culture of innovation, collaboration, and continuous learning;
  • Competitive salary and flexible benefits package, tailored to your experience and skills ;
  • Eligibility for performance-based bonus, tied to your results and designed to reward your impact ;
  • Work how you work best - we offer a remote-friendly policy and flexible hours so you can stay productive and keep life balanced ;
  • Portuguese Health Insurance ;
  • Unlimited days off (subject to manager approval).

Ready to join the revolution?

At Bloq.it, we provide end-to-end solutions for Smart Lockers, and our software ecosystem, Bloq.it OS, is the leading tech solution available in the market.

We've had the pleasure of working with some of the biggest names in e-commerce, logistics, and retail in Europe, such as Vinted and DHL.

We have recently become the fastest-growing Smart Locker company in the world. Before Bloq.it the industry had stagnated and lacked innovation and good products. We strive to have the same impact in this industry as Tesla has had on the car industry.

We believe that Smart Lockers are a big part of the future for everyone, and we want to play our part in making sure that Smart Lockers become as mainstream as the mobile phone.

Title: Data Analyst (Hybrid)
HTML:
A Company you will be happy to grow with!


At InnoTech, it‚Äôs all about connecting people with business through technology.

We care about you, your happiness, and your well-being. We seek passionate individuals eager to learn and improve their skills with us ‚Äì growth is in our DNA. This dedication has earned us recognition as a Best Workplace in Portugal for 2023 and 2024. Furthermore, in 2024, we were proudly acknowledged as one of the top IT companies to work for in Portugal, receiving the Best Workplace award in the IT sector, given by Great Place to Work.


For us, sustainability is not just a word. Integrity and social responsibility lead our behavior.

We dare to be different, ambitious, dream big, and deliver value like no other! You can work with top-level partners in banking, insurance, retail, telecommunications, financial services, and more!


Join our team of 180+ InnoTechers and bring your talent as a Data Analyst.


Your Mission Will Be:

  • Collaborate with stakeholders from different sectors to identify and understand their specific analytical needs and challenges;
  • Map business requirements to existing analytics product functionality, identifying opportunities for improvement and customization;
  • Develop and maintain dashboards and reports using Power BI to provide actionable insights;
  • Ensure the quality and integrity of the data used for analysis.


You Will Need:

  • Minimum of 2 years experience in data analysis;
  • Proven proficiency in the Power BI tool, including development of dashboards and reports;
  • Ability to translate business needs into technical specifications;
  • Fluency in Portuguese and English (other languages are a plus);
  • CPLP nationality or an EU work permit is required to facilitate employment.


Would Be Awesome If You Have:

  • BSc or MSc in Computer Science/Engineering, Information Technology, or related fields;
  • Experience in query languages such as SQL;
  • Familiarity with business intelligence principles and data management practices.


With Us You Can Be a:

  • TechThinker ‚Äì people who want to re-imagine technology with us
  • TechSolver ‚Äì strategic, resilient, and a little bit of a puzzle lover
  • InnoMinder ‚Äì inhale innovation, exhale digital transformation
  • InnoTecher ‚Äì no words needed. Just happiness, talent, and all the above!


Are you convinced? Come see it for yourself.

Join our Top-Notch Team!

Title: Business Analyst/Data Analyst
Description:
Mutual Respect, Empathy, Innovation and Professional Pride. Do you identify with these values?

Founded in 2006 with the mission "To Challenge Complexity," Closer Consulting is a Data Science company specializing in Business Intelligence, Advanced Analytics, and Artificial Intelligence.

By developing projects in the most diverse industries ‚Äì Banking, Telecommunications, Health, Retail, Energy, Insurance or Aviation - we analyze data, transforming it into knowledge for our clients, allowing them to adopt the best decision-making for their respective organizations and businesses.

We seek a Business Analyst willing to accept new challenges in our Closer team.

Hybrid working mode with base in Lisbon.




We're leading an exciting project focused on building a strong, scalable data foundation to drive enterprise-wide decision-making and operational efficiency.

Key areas of impact include:




‚úÖ Defining and aligning data strategy with senior management, maximizing data quality and minimizing costs

‚úÖ Leading the development of scalable, reliable data foundations to support core business operations

‚úÖ Driving cross-functional initiatives to foster a data-driven culture across all departments

‚úÖ Establishing and evolving robust data governance frameworks and secure data management practices

‚úÖ Overseeing the design and scalability of data architecture with performance and efficiency in mind

‚úÖ Managing the full data lifecycle‚Äîcollection, integration, storage, and maintenance

‚úÖ Mentoring and leading a high-performing Data Engineering team with a focus on innovation and improvement

‚úÖ Acting as the key liaison between the Data Department and business stakeholders to translate needs into effective data solutions

‚úÖ Delivering strategic reporting on data quality, usage, and pipeline efficiency to support business decisions

‚úÖ Enabling timely, accurate reporting to support data-driven strategies at the leadership level




üß† Tech & Environment:

Strong focus on Google Cloud Platform (GCP): Cloud Functions, Pub/Sub, Cloud Run
Deep understanding of modern data engineering practices and architecture

üí° Soft Skills & Leadership Qualities:

Strategic thinker with strong project management and cross-functional leadership skills
Skilled in conflict resolution, stakeholder engagement, and navigating internal blockers







If you believe in this match as much as we do, send your CV to leonor.carvalho@closer.pt and reach the closest side of life.




Closer is a company that values diversity and inclusion. We are committed to fostering an environment where everyone is treated with dignity and respect, regardless of race, gender, beliefs, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other personal characteristics.

Title: BI Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job


The Partners for Projects (P4P) BI Data Analyst main mission is to support the project teams in performing extensive data analysis projects and develop business cases, through data tools, automation and Artificial Intelligence (AI)


Your Main Activities Are


Support the project teams in performing extensive data analysis projects by using BNP Portugal data tools, mainly Alteryx, Dataiku, Python and PowerBI
Support in sourcing new Digital and AI use cases
Understand how the different Digital and AI technologies integrate and End-2-End process
Build the necessary Business Cases to support the use case validation and hand over to the Digital & AI providers
Monitor and manage the implementation of the Digital & AI solutions with providers and evaluate the value created generated
Advise and train P4P team members in topics regarding data, Digital and AI
Develop network and intimacy with clients and stakeholders while promoting P4P to enhance our brand image
Contribute to generate a positive, collaborative and motivating spirit within the team, and develop game-changing ideas


Profile And Skills To Success


Academic background in Management, Economics or any other relevant
At least 3 years of experience in Transformation and Digital practices, Business Analysis and/or Business Intelligence, with a transversal knowledge of available digital technologies, from automation to AI
Previous experience in project and change management tools and methodologies and in Digital and AI business case tools
Proficiency in Data Analytics tools, such as Alteryx, Dataiku or equivalent and development using Python and PowerBI
Experienced in Microsoft Office tools, notably MS PowerPoint & Excel
Excellent communication skills and fluency in English
Team spirit and a constructive and collaborative mindset, with curiosity and proactivity to tackle challenging problems, and an ability to be impactful with excellent analytical skills


About The Team


P4P is an internal management consultancy team with a unique positioning within Global Banking m√©tier, offering a credible alternative to external leading consulting firms
This is an inclusive team composed of 26 persons based in Paris and Lisbon, regrouping more than 5 nationalities with a well-balanced gender ratio, being a melting pot of diversified and complementary profiles from banking and consulting backgrounds, allowing to drive innovative thinking
The team manages a project portfolio with a global reach of impactful missions ranging from supporting Global Banking transformation (business growth, organisational re-design & operating model, operational excellence, ESG), to driving innovation (data, digital and GenAI)
P4P covers the full project value chain from framing, diagnosis and delivery of pragmatic recommendations to designing effective implementation and enabling change, managing end-to-end projects (Front-to-Operations-to-IT-to Finance projects)
As part of the consulting spirit, the team thrives in creating a dynamic environment with transversal practices and team building events to promote a ‚ÄúOne-team‚Äù spirit


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
CAPGEMINI ENGINEERING

At Capgemini Engineering, the world leader in engineering services, we bring together a global team of engineers, scientists, and architects to help the world‚Äôs most innovative companies unleash their potential. From autonomous cars to life-saving robots, our digital and software technology experts think outside the box as they provide unique R&D and engineering services across all industries. Join us for a career full of opportunities. Where you can make a difference. Where no two days are the same.

YOUR ROLE

As a Data Analyst at PMI, you will play a key role in transforming data into actionable insights that drive strategic decision-making across the organization. You will work with tools such as SQL, Excel, Power BI, and Tableau to analyze trends, define key performance indicators (KPIs) like model bias and accuracy, and support data quality initiatives.

Key Responsibilities:


Support Data Privacy Impact Assessments (DPIA) and Business System Owner (BSO) approvals.
Define and maintain business terms using Atlan for metadata management.
Design and implement data quality checks within DSH.
Reconcile source data with historical records using DPaaS.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure data integrity and alignment with business goals.
Present findings and insights in a clear, concise manner to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.


YOUR PROFILE


Proven experience with SQL and Business Intelligence tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau).
Strong proficiency in Excel and data visualization techniques.
Familiarity with data quality and metadata management tools such as Atlan, Snowflake, and DSH is a plus.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.
A proactive approach to problem-solving and continuous improvement.

Enjoy a supportive atmosphere promoting work-life balance.
Hybrid work.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
M/F










CHALLENGE:




As a Data Analyst, you will play a central role in supporting strategic planning and improving business analysis, predicting outcomes, and understanding complex data relationships.




Work closely with business users to understand the questions they want to answer with data, propose and design possible solutions, and work together with other teams to implement those solutions.







MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES:




Define, execute data analysis to make recommendations to support decision making
Collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders to formulate and complete full cycle analysis that includes data gathering, analysis, ongoing scaled deliverables and presentations
Develop and automate reports, and dashboards to provide insights at scale to define business priorities, and to provide valuable information to stakeholders and leadership
Verify, validate data accuracy and reports to provide a high quality of standards
Optimize Internal business processes to increase operational efficiency across all platforms
Contribute to building a strong data-driven culture.







PROFILE:




Degree in Mathematics, Economics, Engineering, or equivalent fields of study
A professional with +3 years of experience with data analytics
Interest and experience in data, metrics, analysis, and trends and applied knowledge of measurement, statistics, and program evaluation
Experienced in leveraging data and analytics to solve real-world problems and create new solutions. This requires a strong understanding of business processes and data flows.
Experience with Excel, Power BI and SQL
Familiarity in Python to the extent of delivering the same analysis you could do in SQL and a BI tool, and knowledge of Algorithms in Retail is a nice-to-have
An excellent communicator with presentation skills
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
Critical thinking
Problem-solving aptitude.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Join our team and start a new adventure in an international and dynamic environment, where you will be able to fulfil your career expectations in a fast growing organization.

As a Junior Data Analyst, you will be part of our corporate team, working closely with various departments to transform data into insights and value-added solutions that support strategic decision making and improve performance across the organization.




Your missions

Design, develop and deploy machine learning models to solve business problems
Collect, clean and process structured and unstructured data from multiple sources
Perform statistical analysis and predictive modeling to uncover trends and patterns
Develop dashboards and data visualization tools to communicate findings
Collaborate with IT and business teams to integrate models into operational systems
Validate models and ensure robustness, scalability, and reliability
Stay up to date with the latest data science trends, technologies, and best practices
Document solutions, prepare technical reports, and present results to stakeholders




Your profile

Academic background: bachelor's or Master‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or similar
Experience with data manipulation and analysis using Python and libraries like pandas, NumPy, scikit-learn
Proficiency in machine learning algorithms and statistical modeling techniques
Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI or Plotly
Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure) and databases (SQL, NoSQL)
Fluent English. French is a plus.
You are analytical, curious, and business-oriented, with excellent communication skills




What we offer

An international community bringing together 110+ different nationalities
An environment where trust has a central place: 70% of our key leaders started their careers at the first level of responsibilities
A robust training system with our internal Academy and 250+ available modules
A vibrant workplace that frequently gathers for internal events (afterworks, team buildings, etc.)




Remote policy: Possibility to work remotely up to 2 days per week

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The Data Analyst will play a critical role in analyzing and interpreting complex financial data to support strategic decision-making processes. This position requires proficiency in Power Queries and the ability to work with financial datasets, ensuring accurate insights and reporting. Additionally, experience with Navision or Oracle is desirable to streamline data extraction, integration, and analysis. The ideal candidate will contribute to optimizing business performance by providing clear, data-driven recommendations.




Core Responsabilities:




Collate and action requests for data creation and maintenance.
Maintain chart of accounts (including GL, cost centers and entities), other accounting master data objects, customer records and contracts data.
Continually own and maintain required standard data documentation.
Apply a degree of independent decision-making in dealing with complex business and/or technical issues.
Collaborate with cross-functionals teams across various levels including the BPO
Establish stable working relationships within Master Data team and with other departments/team members to ensure smooth ways of working and delivery of Master Data activities.
Anticipate data needs of other teams and proactively seek to respond / create solutions in advance of requests.
Collaborate with Finance process owners to adapt best practices and standards.
Collaborate with IT and Data & Analytics teams on data structures and data strategy.
Collaborate with other stakeholders to provide required data points.
Ensure data compliance & integrity.
Create reports and provide inputs for frequent and accurate reporting on data input, cleansing and maintenance activity to accurately monitor implementation of Master Data maintenance strategy and compliance with company policies and regulation.
Run reports to assess data quality and contribute to any testing & development in support of data quality improvement initiatives.
Validate data integrity during any data transformation and loading activities.




Technical Competencies:




Experience in financial roles
Experience in a Global Business Services environment or multi-national company experience
Experience with Oracle, Navision or other industry-leading ERP
Data Management Capabilities
Show more

Title: Associate Data Analyst
Place: Vila Nova de Gaia, Porto, Portugal
Description:
Job Description

Data analysts import, inspect, clean, transform, validate, model, or interpret collections of data with regard to the business goals of the company. They ensure that the data sources and repositories provide consistent and reliable data. Data analysts use different algorithms and IT tools as demanded by the situation and the current data. They might prepare reports in the form of visualizations such as graphs, charts, and dashboards.

Job Description - Grade Specific

The primary responsibilities revolve around collecting, cleaning, analyzing, and reporting on data to support decision-making processes.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Mutual Respect, Empathy, Innovation and Professional Pride. Do you identify with these values?

Founded in 2006 with the mission "To Challenge Complexity," Closer Consulting is a Data Science company specializing in Business Intelligence, Advanced Analytics, and Artificial Intelligence.

By developing projects in the most diverse industries ‚Äì Banking, Telecommunications, Health, Retail, Energy, Insurance or Aviation - we analyze data, transforming it into knowledge for our clients, allowing them to adopt the best decision-making for their respective organizations and businesses.




We seek a Data Analyst willing to accept new challenges in our Closer team.

Hybrid working mode with base in Porto.




Main Tasks:

‚Ä¢ Create business-facing dashboards and high impact data visualizations and analyses with complex data structures

‚Ä¢ Collaborate with internal/external clients to best understand their operational and strategic needs.

‚Ä¢ Creative descriptive, predictive, and quantitative analyses addressing key business priorities and supporting the stakeholder‚Äôs decision making.

‚Ä¢ Support and monitor the run of these activities of data analysis, reporting and data mining.




Technical Skills:

‚Ä¢ Data knowledge / Data processing / Data quality / IT Development

‚Ä¢ Database Management (SQL)

‚Ä¢ Methodologies (Agile)

‚Ä¢ Office Pack (MS Excel)

‚Ä¢ Power BI / Tableau




Language Skills:

‚Ä¢ English - Expert

‚Ä¢ French - Expert




Soft Skills:

‚Ä¢ IT - Business/IT relationship

‚Ä¢ Analytical Ability

‚Ä¢ Data Intelligence, Research and Quant Analytics

‚Ä¢ Ability to understand, explain and support change

‚Ä¢ Ability to collaborate/Teamwork

‚Ä¢ Attention to detail/rigor




If you believe in this match as much as we do, send your CV to leonor.carvalho@closer.pt and reach the closest side of life.




Closer is a company that values diversity and inclusion. We are committed to fostering an environment where everyone is treated with dignity and respect, regardless of race, gender, beliefs, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other personal characteristics.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Blip is a leading tech company focused on software engineering solutions for sports entertainment.

We operate at scale. As part of Flutter Entertainment, we play an essential role in the Group's goal of becoming the global leader in online sports betting and iGaming, developing innovative products and platforms for over 14 million monthly customers worldwide.

We are serious about Tech. We are problem-solvers with big ambitions, keeping a people-first mindset at the core of our work. We prioritize flexibility as we strive to deliver the best technological products and tackle the greatest industry challenges.

Recognizing that everyone brings their own strengths, backgrounds and new perspectives, we empower you to be yourself. That uniqueness shapes the culture of belonging we are so proud of.


The Role

Flutter Functions Global Sportsbook & Trading (GST) aims to empower Flutter brands shaping the future of sports betting by helping to drive their success and growth.

With over 400 colleagues working in roles across trading, operations, product, delivery, architecture and engineering, and by partnering closely with more than 1,100 people in the wider global trading and sportsbook community at Flutter, GST's Mission intends to raise the bar to be #1 on all sports; share Flutter's most innovative sportsbook products globally; transform Risk & Trading operations, unleashing the power of data; co-create the next generation sportsbook and build a culture of inclusion, innovation, personal growth and leadership excellence.


This role is an exciting opportunity for someone passionate about data analytics to pioneer the discipline in a rapidly growing area of the business. Critical thinking and problem solving will be key for exploring the challenges & opportunities as we develop the data team. You‚Äôll be working within Shared Platforms, alongside some of the main Flutter‚Äôs Brands to provide insights that will ensure we are making data-driven decisions to properly support the Inner Source strategy.


Your mission will be to uncover key insights from Flutter‚Äôs global data, enabling

quality decision-making about the future of our shared platforms and governance model. You will leverage your strong data analyst skills and data storytelling abilities to extract valuable insights from our vast data sources and communicate these insights to various stakeholders, to inspire action and change. Your role will involve transforming complex data into compelling narratives and supporting data-driven decision-making across our product lines.


What You‚Äôll Be Doing

  • Data Analysis: Explore, analyse, and interpret large datasets related to software development activies and the overall SDLC;
  • Collaboration: Build great relationships across teams and Divisional Leads, Product Owners, Managers and Engineers to understand their data requirements and provide valuable insights to optimize the efficiency of our co-creation model.
  • Data Storytelling: Craft data-driven visualisations and narratives which provide clear and actionable insights for our stakeholders, making complex data accessible and understandable to all;
  • Continuous Learning: Be enthusiastic about expanding your skillset, including learning new data platforms & tools, programming languages and techniques to enhance your data analysis capabilities.
  • Experimentation: Foster a culture of experimentation, leading the design, execution, and analysis of experiments to optimize our data extraction;
  • Data Transformation and Quality: Transform multiple raw data sources into clean views and continuously maintain data integrity, identifying and rectifying issues as they arise.


What You‚Äôll Bring

  • Experience as a seasoned data analyst;
  • Experience using Python to query large relational databases;
  • An ability to work independently and provide a personal resolution to projects;
  • A track record of excellence in subjects with a mathematical or statistical focus;
  • Advanced use of Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint;
  • Knowledge of statistical programming software and techniques (e.g. Python, R, etc.);
  • Experience of extracting, analysing, and interpreting large and sometimes incomplete data sets;
  • Advanced communication skills including experience of delivering output that is clear and succinct despite the subject being complex to senior stakeholders;
  • Curious and questioning approach with a high attention to detail;
  • Willingness to learn and continuously improve;
  • Strong problem-solving skills;
  • Interest in the sports betting industry is a distinct advantage;
  • Other desirable skills: Tableu, Looker, Power BI


This is what you should have. What do we have, you ask? Well...you can check our amazing perks & benefits right here!

So ... are you in?


Equal opportunities

At Blip, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace. We strongly encourage people from all backgrounds, ways of thinking, and working to apply.

We are committed to including everyone regardless of their race, disability, age, gender identity, sexual orientation, and religion.


Everyone brings different perspectives and experiences; you don‚Äôt have to meet all the requirements listed to apply for this role.


If you need any adjustments to apply for the position and to ensure this role aligns with your needs, please send an email to accommodations@blip.pt.

We will only respond to inquiries related to disabilities.

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
It's more than a job

In this IT role, you will manage, develop, and support the technology infrastructure that powers Kuehne+Nagel‚Äôs global systems and operations. This contribution is vital to making both special and ordinary moments in the lives of people a reality. In fact, your work enables our teams to deliver fresh fruit, time-sensitive healthcare products and much more to people all around the world. Working in IT at Kuehne+Nagel contributes to more than we imagine.

‚Äé

We are looking for a detail-oriented and analytical Data Analyst to join our growing team. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to transform data into actionable insights that support strategic decision-making and operational excellence.

How you create impact


Collect, clean, and analyze large datasets from multiple sources.
Develop dashboards and reports to visualize key metrics and trends.
Identify patterns, anomalies, and opportunities for process improvement.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand data needs and deliver insights.
Support data-driven decision-making across departments.


What we would like you to bring


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
2+ years of experience in a data analyst or similar role.
Proficiency in SQL, Excel, and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Experience with Python or R is a plus.
Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and presentation abilities.


What's in it for you

You will have a direct influence on the future of logistics and IT. Your colleagues are experts who shape the IT industry in Portugal and worldwide. We want you to feel comfortable in your working surroundings. Therefore, we are offering you flexible working hours and mobile working arrangements. We value teamwork, continuous learning, and diversity. Kuehne+Nagel offers you a custom-made career ‚Äì through individual planning and supervisors who support and advise you in every way. You get supported by many work-life balance offerings and supplementary health insurance.

Who we are

Logistics shapes everyday life - from the goods we consume to the healthcare we rely on. At Kuehne+Nagel, your work goes beyond logistics; it enables both ordinary and special moments in the lives of people around the world.

As a global leader with a strong heritage and a vision to move the world forward, we offer a safe, stable environment where your career can make a real difference. Whether we help deliver life-saving medicines, develop sustainable transportation solutions or support our local communities, your career will contribute to more than you can imagine.

We kindly advise that placement agencies refrain from submitting unsolicited profiles. Any submissions of candidates without prior signed agreement will be considered our property and no fees will be paid.

Title: Market Data Analyst
Description:
ü§îWho are we?




As the founding entity of RAINBOW PARTNERS, Quanteam is a consulting firm specializing in the fields of Banking, Finance, and Financial Services. Guided by our core values of closeness, teamwork, diversity, and excellence, our team of 980 expert consultants, representing 35 different nationalities, collaborates across 12 international offices: Paris, Lyon, New York, Montreal, London, Brussels, Geneva, Lisbon, Porto, Casablanca, Madrid and Singapore. Committed to sustainability (Ecovadis Gold), diversity (gender index: 92%), and quality of work life (Best Workplace Experience), Quanteam is a forward-thinking enterprise.




üöÄ Our Expertise




With a dual expertise in both business and IT, Quanteam supports its corporate clients (investment banks, asset management companies, private and retail banks, custodians, etc.) across the entire Front-to-Back spectrum in evolving their business activities and transformation projects.




Our teams are organized into 5 expertise areas:

‚û° Quantitative Finance

‚û° Risk, Compliance, and Regulatory

‚û° Operations and Finance

‚û° Transformation and Organization

‚û° Information Systems

In 2023, Quanteam generated a revenue of ‚Ç¨74.6 million.







üîé We are looking for a Market Data Analyst to support a key project within the Market Risk team, focusing on the quality control and validation of market data across multiple asset classes, including FX, Rates, Credit, and Equity.




You will work closely with an internal data control tool to eliminate a backlog of unresolved alerts, improve detection logic, and help maintain a clean, reliable, and efficient market data environment used across global trading platforms.




Main Tasks:

Analyze market data inconsistencies flagged by an internal control tool.
Identify and implement corrective actions, while improving alert configuration to avoid false positives.
Support the daily certification of market data and periodic monitoring (weekly/monthly).
Collaborate with cross-functional teams such as Risk, IT, Front Office, and Project Management.
Prepare clear reports and presentations for senior management.
Propose improvements to ensure a scalable and robust market data control framework.




Main Skills & Requirements:

Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Finance, or a related field.
Solid programming skills in Python and SQL.
Familiarity with data APIs, data transformation, and reporting tools.
Understanding of financial instruments and risk factors across FX, Rates, Credit, and Equity.
Previous experience in financial services or market risk is a strong plus.
Ability to translate complex data or technical concepts into simple, actionable insights.
Fluent in English (mandatory).

Nice to Have:

Exposure to valuation or risk platforms such as Murex, Summit, Sophis, or similar.
Experience in market data control or certification environments.
Interest in financial regulation (e.g., data completeness, consistency, compliance).




üìç Hybrid Role in Porto.




üöÄIf you feel this opportunity is for you, send your CV and join our team!

Title: Data Science Analyst
Description:
Who We Are

Metyis is a global and forward-thinking firm operating across a wide range of industries, developing and delivering AI & Data, Digital Commerce, Marketing & Design solutions and Advisory services. At Metyis, our long-term partnership model brings long-lasting impact and growth to our business partners and clients through extensive execution capabilities.

With our team, you can experience a collaborative environment with highly skilled multidisciplinary experts, where everyone has room to build bigger and bolder ideas. Being part of Metyis means you can speak your mind and be creative with your knowledge. Imagine the things you can achieve with a team that encourages you to be the best version of yourself.

We are Metyis. Partners for Impact.

What We Offer


A chance to grow your analytics skills in a supportive, international environment.
Direct exposure to real-world business challenges and data-driven strategy.
Mentorship from experienced data scientists and analysts.
Opportunities to evolve toward more advanced data science roles.
Dynamic and diverse team within one of the leading global fashion brands.
Become part of a fast-growing international and diverse team.



What you will do


Support data-driven decision-making by preparing and analyzing data related to customer behavior, CRM performance, and sales across multiple channels.
Work closely with data scientists and business stakeholders to translate business questions into meaningful insights.
Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) to support data science model development.
Use Python and SQL to clean, process, and visualize data in support of analytics and modeling projects.
Apply basic statistical methods (e.g. descriptive statistics, correlation analysis, hypothesis testing) to uncover insights.
Ensure data quality and consistency across sources by collaborating with data engineering and IT teams.
Communicate findings clearly through presentations and storytelling.
Actively participate in sprint planning, reviews, and agile ceremonies within the team.



What you‚Äôll bring


1‚Äì2 years of experience in analytics, business intelligence, or a related data role (internships included).
Bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Economics, Business Analytics, or Engineering.
Experience working with data using SQL and Python (pandas, matplotlib/seaborn).
Experience with PySpark and Spark technologies is a strong plus, but not mandatory.
Basic understanding of statistics and its application in business analytics.
Strong attention to detail, curiosity, and eagerness to learn.
Good communication skills, including the ability to explain data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Team player with a proactive mindset and willingness to grow in a collaborative environment.
Fluency in English (written and spoken)



Nice to have:


Exposure to cloud platforms like AWS, Azure or Databricks.
Knowledge of Python packages used in machine learning (e.g. scikit-learn).
Participation in academic or personal analytics projects



In a changing world, diversity and inclusion are core values for team well-being and performance. At Metyis, we want to welcome and retain all talents, regardless of gender, age, origin or sexual orientation, and irrespective of whether or not they are living with a disability, as each of them has their own experience and identity.
